   21: %% Run the entire test suite:
   22: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, [batch]).
   23: %%
   24: %% Run a specific group:
   25: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   26: %%
   27: %% Run a specific test case:
   28: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   29: %%
   30: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   31: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   32: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   33: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   34: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}]) end.
   35: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   36: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   37: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   38: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   39: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   40: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   41: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   42: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {group, inet_backend_socket}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   43: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   44: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   45: %%
   46: %%
   47: %%
   48:

  123: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  124:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  125:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  126:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  127:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  128:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  129:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  130: 
  131:     kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  132: 
  133:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  134:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  135:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  136:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  137:     Config.
  138: 
  139: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  140:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  141:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  142:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  143:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  144:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  145:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  146: 
  147:     SysEvs = kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
  148: 
  149:     ?P("system events during test: "
  150:        "~n   ~p", [SysEvs]),
  151: 
  152:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  153:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  154:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  155:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  156:     ok.
  157: 
  158: suite() ->
  159:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  160:      {timetrap,{minutes,4}}].
  161: 
  162: all() ->
  163:     %% This is a temporary measure to ensure that we can 
  164:     %% test the socket backend without effecting *all*
  165:     %% applications on *all* machines.
  166:     %% This flag is set only for *one* host.
  167:     case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
  168:         true ->
  169:             [
  170:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  171:              {group, inet_backend_inet},
  172:              {group, inet_backend_socket},
  173:              {group, tickets}
  174:             ];
  175:         _ ->
  176:             [
  177:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  178:              {group, tickets}
  179:             ]
  180:     end.
  181:

  187: 
  188:      {tickets,                [], ticket_cases()},
  189: 
  190:      {ctrl_proc,              [], ctrl_proc_cases()},
  191:      {close,                  [], close_cases()},
  192:      {active,                 [], active_cases()},
  193:      {shutdown,               [], shutdown_cases()},

  195:      {linger_zero,            [], linger_zero_cases()},

  202:     ].

  360: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  361: 
  362:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  363:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  364:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  365: 
  366:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  367:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  368:             SKIP;
  369: 
  370:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  371:             
  372:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  373:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  374:             
  375:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  376:             kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  377: 
  378:             Config1
  379:     end.
  380: 
  381: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  382: 
  383:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  384:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  385:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  386: 
  387:     %% Stop the local monitor
  388:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  389: 
  390:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  391: 
  392:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  393:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  394: 
  395:     Config1.
  396: 
  397: init_per_group(inet_backend_default = _GroupName, Config) ->
  398:     [{socket_create_opts, []} | Config];
  399: init_per_group(inet_backend_inet = _GroupName, Config) ->
  400:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  401:         true ->
  402:             %% The environment trumps us,
  403:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  404:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  405:         false ->
  406:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, inet}]} | Config]
  407:     end;
  408: init_per_group(inet_backend_socket = _GroupName, Config) ->
  409:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  410:         true ->
  411:             %% The environment trumps us,
  412:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  413:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  414:         false ->
  415:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, socket}]} | Config]
  416:     end;
  417: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  418:     Config.
  419: 
  420: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  421:     Config.
  422: 
  423: -define(UNIQ_NODE_NAME,
  424:   list_to_atom(?MODULE_STRING ++ "__" ++
  425:                atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_" ++
  426: 	       integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive])))).
  427: 
  428: %% Tests kernel application variables inet_default_listen_options and
  429: %% inet_default_connect_options.
  430: default_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  431:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  432:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  433:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  434:                             Addr;
  435:                         {error, Reason} ->
  436:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  437:                     end
  438:            end,
  439:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_default_options(Config, Addr) end,
  440:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  441:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  442: 
  443: do_default_options(Config, Addr) ->
  444:     %% First check the delay_send option
  445:     {true,  true,  true}  = do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr),
  446:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr),
  447:     {true,  false, false} = do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr),
  448:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_4(Config, Addr),
  449:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr),
  450:     {false, true,  true}  = do_delay_send_6(Config, Addr),
  451:     %% Now lets start some nodes with different combinations of options:
  452:     {true,true,true} =
  453:         do_delay_on_other_node("", fun() -> do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr) end),
  454:     {true,false,false} =
  455: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  456: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  457: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  458:     
  459:     {false,true,true} =
  460: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  461: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  462: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  463:     
  464:     {true,true,true} =
  465: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  466: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  467: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr) end),
  468:     {true,true,true} =
  469: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  470: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  471: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_6(Config, Addr) end),
  472:     {false,false,false} =
  473: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  474: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  475: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr) end),
  476:     {false,true,true} =
  477: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  478: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\" "
  479: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  480: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  481: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr) end),
  482:     {true,false,false} =
  483: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  484: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\" "
  485: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  486: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  487: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_4(Config, Addr) end),
  488:     {true,true,true} =
  489: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  490: 			       "\"{delay_send,true}\" "
  491: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  492: 			       "\"{delay_send,true}\"",
  493: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  494:     %% Active is to dangerous and is suppressed
  495:     {true,true,true} =
  496: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  497: 			       "\"{active,false}\" "
  498: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  499: 			       "\"{active,false}\"",
  500: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) end),
  501:     {true,true,true} =
  502: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  503: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\" "
  504: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  505: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\"",
  506: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) end),
  507:     {true,true,true} =
  508: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  509: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\" "
  510: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  511: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\"",
  512: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  513:     ok.
  514: 
  515: 
  516: do_delay_on_other_node(XArgs, Function) ->
  517:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  518:     {ok, Node} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME,
  519:                              "-pa " ++ Dir ++ " " ++ XArgs),
  520:     Res = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Function,[]]),
  521:     ?STOP_NODE(Node),
  522:     Res.
  523: 
  524: do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr) ->
  525:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]),
  526:     {ok, {_,PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  527:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]) of
  528:             {ok, Sock} ->
  529:                 Sock;
  530:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
  531:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
  532:         end,
  533:     {ok,S2}= gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  534:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  535:     {ok,[{delay_send,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  536:     {ok,[{delay_send,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  537:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  538:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  539:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  540:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  541: 
  542: do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) ->
  543:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  544:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  545:     {ok, S}  = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  546:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  547:     {ok, [{delay_send,B1}]} = inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  548:     {ok, [{delay_send,B2}]} = inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  549:     {ok, [{delay_send,B3}]} = inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  550:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  551:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  552:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  553:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  554: 
  555: do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr) ->
  556:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  557:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  558:     {ok,S} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]),
  559:     {ok,S2}= gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  560:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  561:     {ok,[{delay_send,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  562:     {ok,[{delay_send,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  563:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  564:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  565:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  566:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  567:     
  568: do_delay_send_4(Config, Addr) ->
  569:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,false}]),
  570:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  571:     {ok, S}  = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  572:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:accept(LS),

  580:     
  581: do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr) ->

  583:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  584:     {ok,S}   = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,false}]),
  585:     {ok,S2}  = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  586:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  587:     {ok,[{delay_send,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),

  594: do_delay_send_6(Config, Addr) ->

  596:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  597:     {ok, S}  = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),

  607: do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) ->
  608:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  609:     {ok,{_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  610:     {ok,S}   = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  611:     {ok,S2}  = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  612:     {ok,[{active,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[active]),
  613:     {ok,[{active,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[active]),
  614:     {ok,[{active,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[active]),
  615:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  616:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  617:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  618:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  619: 
  620: %% Open a listen port and change controlling_process for it
  621: %% The result should be ok of done by the owner process,
  622: %% Otherwise is should return {error,not_owner} or similar.
  623: controlling_process(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  624:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  625:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  626:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  627:                             Addr;
  628:                         {error, Reason} ->
  629:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  630:                     end
  631:            end,
  632:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_controlling_process(Config, Addr) end,
  633:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  634:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  635: 
  636: do_controlling_process(Config, Addr) ->
  637:     ?P("create listen socket with:"
  638:        "~n   Addr: ~p", [Addr]),
  639:     {ok, S} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  640:     Pid2    = spawn(?MODULE, not_owner, [S]),
  641:     Pid2 ! {self(),2,control},
  642:     {error, E} = receive {2,_E} ->
  643: 			      _E
  644: 		      after 10000 -> timeout
  645: 		      end,
  646:     io:format("received ~p~n",[E]),
  647:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE,not_owner,[S]),
  648:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(S,Pid),
  649:     Pid ! {self(),1,control},
  650:     ok = receive {1,ok} ->
  651:                      ok
  652:          after 1000 -> timeout
  653:          end,
  654:     Pid ! close.
  655: 
  656: not_owner(S) ->
  657:     receive
  658: 	{From,Tag,control} ->
  659: 	    From ! {Tag,gen_tcp:controlling_process(S,self())};
  660: 	close ->
  661: 	    gen_tcp:close(S)
  662:     after 1000 ->
  663: 	    ok
  664:     end.
  665: 
  666: %% Open a listen port and assign the controlling process to
  667: %% it self, then exit and make sure the port is closed properly.
  668: controlling_process_self(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  669:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  670:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  671:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  672:                             Addr;
  673:                         {error, Reason} ->
  674:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  675:                     end
  676:            end,
  677:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_controlling_process_self(Config, Addr) end,
  678:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  679:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  680: 
  681: do_controlling_process_self(Config, Addr) ->
  682:     S = self(),
  683:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
  684:     spawn_link(fun() ->
  685: 		       {ok,Sock} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  686: 		       S ! {socket, Sock},
  687: 		       ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(Sock,self()),
  688: 		       S ! done
  689: 	       end),
  690:     receive
  691: 	done ->
  692: 	    receive
  693: 		{socket,Sock} ->
  694: 		    process_flag(trap_exit,false),
  695: 		    %% Make sure the port is invalid after process crash
  696:                     receive after 500 -> ok end,
  697:                     case inet:port(Sock) of
  698:                         {error,einval} -> ok;
  699:                         {error,closed} -> ok % XXX gen_tcp_socket
  700:                     end
  701: 
  702: 	    end;
  703: 	Msg when element(1,Msg) /= socket ->
  704: 	    process_flag(trap_exit,false),
  705: 	    exit({unknown_msg,Msg})
  706:     end.
  707:     
  708: 
  709: %% Open a listen port and connect to it, then close the listen port
  710: %% without doing any accept.  The connected socket should receive
  711: %% a tcp_closed message.
  712: no_accept(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  713:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  714:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  715:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  716:                             Addr;
  717:                         {error, Reason} ->
  718:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  719:                     end
  720:            end,
  721:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_no_access(Config, Addr) end,
  722:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  723:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  724: 
  725: do_no_access(Config, Addr) ->
  726:     ?P("create listen socket with Addr: ~p", [Addr]),
  727:     %% LOpts = [{debug, true}],
  728:     LOpts = [],
  729:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr} | LOpts]),
  730:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
  731:     ?P("create connection socket"),
  732:     %% COpts = [{debug, true}],
  733:     COpts = [],
  734:     ?P("connect to"
  735:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
  736:        "~n   Port: ~p", [Addr, Port]),
  737:     {ok, Client}    = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr} | COpts]),
  738:     ?P("close listen socket"),
  739:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
  740:     ?P("await connection socket closed"),
  741:     receive
  742:         {tcp_closed, Client} ->
  743:             ?P("connection socket closed message received => OK"),
  744:             ok
  745:     after 5000 ->
  746:             ?P("connection socket closed message *not* received => FAIL"),
  747:             ct:fail(never_closed)    
  748:     end.
  749: 
  750: %% Send several packets to a socket and close it.  All packets should
  751: %% arrive to the other end.
  752: close_with_pending_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  753:     ?P("~w -> entry with"
  754:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  755:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Config, nodes()]),
  756:     Pre = fun() ->
  757:                   ?P("~w:pre -> try start node", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  758:                   case start_remote_node(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  759: 					 ?WHICH_INET_BACKEND(Config)) of
  760:                       {ok, Node} ->
  761:                           ?P("~w:pre -> node ~p started",
  762:                              [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
  763:                           Node;
  764:                       {error, {no_connection,timeout}} ->
  765:                           ?P("~w:pre -> [ERROR] no connection : timeout",
  766:                              [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  767:                           ?SKIPT("node start timeout");
  768:                       {error, Other} ->
  769:                           %% Node starting is not what this test case is about.
  770:                           %% so, if this fails, skip
  771:                           ?P("~w:pre -> [ERROR] Unexpected error:"
  772:                              "~n      ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Other]),
  773:                           ?SKIPT({failed_starting_remote_node, Other})
  774:                   end
  775:           end,
  776:     TC   = fun(Node) ->
  777:                    do_close_with_pending_output(Node, Config)
  778:            end,
  779:     Post = fun(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
  780:                    ?P("~w:post -> try stop 'remote' node ~p",
  781:                       [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
  782:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)   
  783:            end,
  784:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Pre, TC, Post).
  785: 
  786: do_close_with_pending_output(Node, Config) ->
  787:     {ok, Addr}      = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
  788:     ?P("~w -> try create listen socket", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  789:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
  790:     ?P("~w -> try get port", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  791:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
  792:     Packets         = 16,
  793:     Total           = 2048*Packets,
  794: 
  795:     Self = self(),
  796: 
  797:     ?P("~w -> try spawn sender (on ~p): "
  798:        "~n   Config:  ~p"
  799:        "~n   Addr:    ~p"
  800:        "~n   Port:    ~p"
  801:        "~n   packets: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node, Config, Addr, Port, Packets]),
  802:     Sender = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, sender,
  803: 			[Config, Self, Addr, Port, Packets]),
  804:     ?P("~w -> sender spawned (~p) - spawn reader",
  805:        [?FUNCTION_NAME, Sender]),
  806:     Reader = spawn_link(
  807: 	       fun() ->
  808: 		       Self ! {self(), "Starting - try accept"},
  809: 		       {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
  810: 		       ?P("~w -> connection accepted - recv ~w data",
  811: 			  [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total]),
  812: 		       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, true}]),    
  813: 		       Self ! {self(), "Accepted - try read"},
  814: 		       case gen_tcp:recv(A, Total) of
  815: 			   {ok, Bin} when (byte_size(Bin) =:= Total) ->
  816: 			       ?P("~w -> [OK] received expected ~w "
  817: 				  "bytes of data - "
  818: 				  "close sockets", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total]),
  819: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  820: 			       Self ! {self(), "read - expected amount of data - close socket(s)"},
  821: 			       gen_tcp:close(A),
  822: 			       gen_tcp:close(L),
  823: 			       ?P("~w -> [OK] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  824: 			       exit(ok);
  825: 			   {ok, Bin} ->
  826: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] unexpected amount "
  827: 				  "of data recv - "
  828: 				  "close sockets: "
  829: 				  "~n      Expected: ~p"
  830: 				  "~n      Received: ~p",
  831: 				  [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total, byte_size(Bin)]),
  832: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  833: 			       Self ! {self(), "read - *unexpected* amount of data - close socket(s)"},
  834: 			       gen_tcp:close(A),
  835: 			       gen_tcp:close(L),
  836: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  837: 			       ct:fail({small_packet, byte_size(Bin)});
  838: 			   Error ->
  839: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] recv failed - "
  840: 				  "close sockets: "
  841: 				  "~n      Error: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Error]),
  842: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  843: 			       Self ! {self(), ?P("read failed - ~p - close socket(s)", [Error])},
  844: 			       (catch gen_tcp:close(A)),
  845: 			       (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
  846: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  847: 			       ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
  848: 		       end
  849: 	       end
  850: 	      ),
  851:     await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader).
  852: 
  853: 
  854: await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader) ->
  855:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  856:     do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader).
  857: 
  858: do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader) ->
  859:     receive
  860: 	{'EXIT', Reader, ok} ->
  861: 	    ?P("reader terminated with success"),
  862: 	    ok;
  863: 	{'EXIT', Reader, RError} ->
  864: 	    ?P("reader terminated with failure: "
  865: 	       "~n   ~p", [RError]),
  866: 	    ct:fail({reader, RError});
  867: 
  868: 	{'EXIT', Sender, ok} ->
  869: 	    ?P("sender terminated with success"),
  870: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, undefined, Reader);
  871: 	{'EXIT', Sender, SError} ->
  872: 	    ?P("sender terminated with failure: "
  873: 	       "~n   ~p", [SError]),
  874: 	    ct:fail({sender, SError});
  875: 
  876: 	{nodedown, Node} = NODEDOWN ->
  877: 	    ?P("sender node down"),
  878: 	    ct:fail(NODEDOWN);
  879: 
  880: 	{Sender, Msg} ->
  881: 	    ?P("sender: ~s~n", [Msg]),
  882: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader);
  883: 
  884: 	{Reader, Msg} ->
  885: 	    ?P("reader: ~s~n", [Msg]),
  886: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader)
  887:     end.
  888: 
  889: sender(Config, Parent, ServerAddr, ServerPort, Packets) ->
  890:     Parent ! {self(), "starting - get local address"},
  891:     case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  892: 	{ok, LocalAddr} ->
  893: 	    Parent ! {self(), ?P("got local address ~p", [LocalAddr])},
  894: 	    X256 = lists:seq(0, 255),
  895: 	    X512 = [X256|X256],
  896: 	    X1K = [X512|X512],
  897: 	    Bin = list_to_binary([X1K|X1K]),
  898: 	    Parent ! {self(), "try connect to server"},
  899: 	    {ok, Sock} = ?CONNECT(Config, ServerAddr, ServerPort,
  900: 				  [{ip, LocalAddr}]),
  901: 	    Parent ! {self(), "connected - begin sending"},
  902: 	    send_loop(Sock, Bin, Packets),
  903: 	    Parent ! {self(), "sent - close socket"},
  904: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
  905: 	    Parent ! {self(), "done"},
  906: 	    exit(ok);
  907: 	Else ->
  908: 	    exit({skip, ?F("Failed get local address: ~p", [Else])})
  909:     end.
  910: 
  911: send_loop(_Sock, _Data, 0) -> ok;
  912: send_loop(Sock, Data, Left) ->
  913:     %% ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data),
  914:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data) of
  915: 	ok ->
  916: 	    ok;
  917:         {error, Reason} ->
  918:             ?P("[send_loop] failed send data when:"
  919: 	       "~n   Left:        ~p"
  920: 	       "~n   Reason:      ~p"
  921: 	       "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Left, Reason, (catch inet:info(Sock))]),
  922:             exit({failed_send, Left, Reason})
  923:     end,
  924:     send_loop(Sock, Data, Left-1).
  925: 
  926: %% Test {active,N} option
  927: %% Verify operation of the {active,N} option.
  928: active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  929:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  930:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  931:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  932:                             Addr;
  933:                         {error, Reason} ->
  934:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  935:                     end
  936:            end,
  937:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_active_n(Config, Addr) end,
  938:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  939:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  940: 
  941: do_active_n(Config, Addr) ->
  942:     N = 3,
  943:     LS = ok(?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{active,N}, {ip, Addr}])),
  944:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  945:     %% ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-N}]),
  946:     %% The point of this is to "demonstrate" that its possible to 
  947:     %% enable and then later disable debug in one (setopts) call!
  948:     %% Note the order! Its reversed!!
  949:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{debug, false}, {active,-N}, {debug, true}]),
  950:     receive
  951:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  952:     after
  953:         5000 ->
  954:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  955:     end,
  956:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  957:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,0}]),
  958:     receive
  959:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  960:     after
  961:         5000 ->
  962:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  963:     end,
  964:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,32767}]),
  965:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,1}]),
  966:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-32769}]),
  967:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-32768}]),
  968:     receive
  969:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  970:     after
  971:         5000 ->
  972:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  973:     end,
  974:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  975:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,N}]),
  976:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,true}]),
  977:     [{active,true}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  978:     receive
  979:         _ -> exit({error,active_n})
  980:     after
  981:         0 ->
  982:             ok
  983:     end,
  984:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,N}]),
  985:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,once}]),
  986:     [{active,once}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  987:     receive
  988:         _ -> exit({error,active_n})
  989:     after
  990:         0 ->
  991:             ok
  992:     end,
  993:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,32768}]),
  994:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,false}]),
  995:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  996:     Port = ok(inet:port(LS)),
  997:     C = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active,N}, {ip, Addr}]) of
  998:             {ok, CS} ->
  999:                 CS;
 1000:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1001:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 1002:         end,
 1003:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(C, [active])),
 1004:     S = ok(gen_tcp:accept(LS)),
 1005:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,N}]),
 1006:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S, [active])),
 1007:     repeat(3,
 1008:            fun(I) ->
 1009:                    Msg = "message "++integer_to_list(I),
 1010:                    ok = gen_tcp:send(C, Msg),
 1011:                    receive
 1012:                        {tcp,S,Msg} ->
 1013:                            ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Msg)
 1014:                    after
 1015:                        5000 ->
 1016:                            exit({error,timeout})
 1017:                    end,
 1018:                    receive
 1019:                        {tcp,C,Msg} ->
 1020:                            ok
 1021:                    after
 1022:                        5000 ->
 1023:                            exit({error,timeout})
 1024:                    end
 1025:            end),
 1026:     receive
 1027:         {tcp_passive,S} ->
 1028:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S, [active]))
 1029:     after
 1030:         5000 ->
 1031:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1032:     end,
 1033:     receive
 1034:         {tcp_passive,C} ->
 1035:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(C, [active]))
 1036:     after
 1037:         5000 ->
 1038:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1039:     end,
 1040:     LS2 = ok(?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,0}])),
 1041:     receive
 1042:         {tcp_passive,LS2} ->
 1043:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS2, [active]))
 1044:     after
 1045:         5000 ->
 1046:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1047:     end,
 1048:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS2),
 1049:     ok = gen_tcp:close(C),
 1050:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S),
 1051:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS),
 1052:     ok.
 1053: 
 1054: -define(OTP_3924_MAX_DELAY,  100).
 1055: -define(OTP_3924_MIN_FACTOR, 4).
 1056: %% Taken out of the blue, but on intra host connections
 1057: %% I expect propagation of a close to be quite fast
 1058: %% so 100 ms seems reasonable.
 1059: 
 1060: %% Tests that a socket can be closed fast enough.
 1061: otp_3924(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1062:     ?P("~w -> entry with"
 1063:        "~n      Config: ~p"
 1064:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Config, nodes()]),
 1065:     Cond = fun() ->
 1066:                    case lists:keysearch(kernel_factor, 1, Config) of
 1067:                        %% Only run this on machines that are "fast enough"...
 1068:                        {value, {kernel_factor, Factor}}
 1069:                          when (Factor =< ?OTP_3924_MIN_FACTOR) ->
 1070:                            ?P("~w:condition -> "
 1071:                               "*fast* enough (~w)", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Factor]),
 1072:                            ok;
 1073:                        _ ->
 1074:                            ?P("~w:condition -> "
 1075:                               "*not* fast enough", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1076:                            {skip, "Too slow for this test"}
 1077:                    end
 1078:            end,
 1079:     Pre = fun() ->
 1080:                   ?P("~w:pre -> which local address", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1081: 		  Addr = case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1082: 			     {ok, A} ->
 1083: 				 A;
 1084: 			     {error, Reason} ->
 1085: 				 throw({skip, Reason})
 1086: 			 end,
 1087:                   ?P("~w:pre -> calculate max delay", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1088:                   MaxDelay = (case has_superfluous_schedulers() of
 1089:                                   true -> 4;
 1090:                                   false -> 1
 1091:                               end
 1092:                               * case {erlang:system_info(debug_compiled),
 1093:                                       erlang:system_info(lock_checking)} of
 1094:                                     {true, _} -> 6;
 1095:                                     {_, true} -> 2;
 1096:                                     _ -> 1
 1097:                                 end * ?OTP_3924_MAX_DELAY),
 1098:                   ?P("~w:pre -> try start node", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1099:                   {ok, Node} = start_node(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME),
 1100:                   ?P("~w:pre -> done with: "
 1101:                      "~n      Node:     ~p"
 1102:                      "~n      MaxDelay: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node, MaxDelay]),
 1103:                   #{addr      => Addr,
 1104: 		    node      => Node,
 1105: 		    max_delay => MaxDelay}
 1106:           end,
 1107:     TC  = fun(#{addr      := Addr,
 1108: 		node      := Node,
 1109: 		max_delay := MaxDelay}) ->
 1110:                   ?P("~w:tc -> begin", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1111:                   Res = do_otp_3924(Config, Addr, Node, MaxDelay),
 1112:                   ?P("~w:tc -> done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1113:                   Res
 1114:           end,
 1115:     Post = fun({Node, _}) ->
 1116:                    ?P("~w:post -> try stop node ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
 1117:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)
 1118:            end,
 1119:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1120: 
 1121: do_otp_3924(Config, Addr, Node, MaxDelay) ->
 1122:     DataLen = 100*1024,
 1123:     Data    = otp_3924_data(DataLen),
 1124:     %% Repeat the test a couple of times to prevent the test from passing
 1125:     %% by chance.
 1126:     repeat(10, fun(N) ->
 1127:                        ok = otp_3924(Config, Addr, MaxDelay, Node, Data, DataLen, N)
 1128:                end),
 1129:     ok.
 1130: 
 1131: otp_3924(Config, Addr, MaxDelay, Node, Data, DataLen, N) ->
 1132:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [list, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
 1133:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1134:     Sender          = spawn_link(Node,
 1135: 				 ?MODULE,
 1136: 				 otp_3924_sender,
 1137: 				 [Config, self(), Addr, Port, Data]),
 1138:     Data = otp_3924_receive_data(L, Sender, MaxDelay, DataLen, N),
 1139:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 1140: 
 1141: otp_3924_receive_data(LSock, Sender, MaxDelay, Len, N) ->
 1142:     OP = process_flag(priority, max),
 1143:     OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1144:     TimeoutRef = make_ref(),
 1145:     Data = (catch begin
 1146:                       Sender ! start,
 1147:                       {ok, Sock} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
 1148:                       D = otp_3924_receive_data(Sock,
 1149:                                                 TimeoutRef,
 1150:                                                 MaxDelay,
 1151:                                                 Len,
 1152:                                                 [],
 1153:                                                 0),
 1154:                       ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1155:                       D
 1156:                   end),
 1157:     unlink(Sender),
 1158:     process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
 1159:     process_flag(priority, OP),
 1160:     receive
 1161: 	{'EXIT', _, TimeoutRef} ->
 1162: 	    ct:fail({close_not_fast_enough,MaxDelay,N});
 1163: 	{'EXIT', Sender, Reason} ->
 1164: 	    ct:fail({sender_exited, Reason});
 1165: 	{'EXIT', _Other, Reason} ->
 1166: 	    ct:fail({linked_process_exited, Reason})
 1167:     after 0 ->
 1168: 	    case Data of
 1169: 		{'EXIT', {A,B}} ->
 1170: 		    ct:fail({A,B,N});
 1171: 		{'EXIT', Failure} ->
 1172: 		    ct:fail(Failure);
 1173: 		_ ->
 1174: 		    Data
 1175: 	    end
 1176:     end.
 1177:     
 1178: 
 1179: otp_3924_receive_data(Sock, TimeoutRef, MaxDelay, Len, Acc, AccLen) ->
 1180:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0) of
 1181: 	{ok, Data} ->
 1182: 	    NewAccLen = AccLen + length(Data),
 1183: 	    if
 1184: 		NewAccLen == Len ->
 1185: 		    {ok, TRef} = timer:exit_after(MaxDelay,
 1186:                                                   self(),
 1187:                                                   TimeoutRef),
 1188: 		    {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0),
 1189: 		    timer:cancel(TRef),
 1190: 		    lists:flatten([Acc, Data]);
 1191: 		NewAccLen > Len ->
 1192: 		    exit({received_too_much, NewAccLen});
 1193: 		true ->
 1194: 		    otp_3924_receive_data(Sock,
 1195: 					  TimeoutRef,
 1196: 					  MaxDelay,
 1197: 					  Len,
 1198: 					  [Acc, Data],
 1199: 					  NewAccLen)
 1200: 	    end;
 1201: 	{error, closed} ->
 1202: 	    exit({premature_close, AccLen});
 1203: 	Error ->
 1204: 	    exit({unexpected_error, Error})
 1205:     end.
 1206:     
 1207: otp_3924_data(Size) ->
 1208:     Block =
 1209: 	"This is a sequence of characters that will be repeated "
 1210: 	"again and again and again and again and again and ...  ",
 1211:     L = length(Block), 
 1212:     otp_3924_data(Block, [], Size div L, Size rem L).
 1213: 
 1214: otp_3924_data(_, Acc, 0, 0) ->
 1215:     lists:flatten(Acc);
 1216: otp_3924_data(_, Acc, 0, SingleLeft) ->
 1217:     otp_3924_data(false, ["."|Acc], 0, SingleLeft-1);
 1218: otp_3924_data(Block, Acc, BlockLeft, SingleLeft) ->
 1219:     otp_3924_data(Block, [Block|Acc], BlockLeft-1, SingleLeft).
 1220: 
 1221: otp_3924_sender(Config, Receiver, Addr, Port, Data) ->
 1222:     receive
 1223: 	start ->
 1224: 	    %% {ok, Sock} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [list, {ip, Addr}]),
 1225: 	    case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [list, {ip, Addr}]) of
 1226: 		{ok, Sock} ->
 1227: 		    gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data),
 1228: 		    ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1229: 		    unlink(Receiver);
 1230: 		{error, eaddrinuse = Reason} ->
 1231: 		    exit({skip, Reason})
 1232: 	    end
 1233:     end.
 1234: 
 1235: 
 1236: %% Tests that a huge amount of data can be received before a close.
 1237: data_before_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1238:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1239:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1240:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1241:                             Addr;
 1242:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1243:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1244:                     end
 1245:            end,
 1246:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_data_before_close(Config, Addr) end,
 1247:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1248:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1249: 
 1250: do_data_before_close(Config, Addr) ->
 1251:     ?P("create listen socket"),
 1252:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}]),
 1253:     {ok, {_, TcpPort}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1254:     Bytes = 256*1024,
 1255:     ?P("create 'huge sender' process"),
 1256:     spawn_link(fun() -> huge_sender(Config, Addr, TcpPort, Bytes) end),
 1257:     ?P("accept connection"),
 1258:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1259:     ?P("receive and count data"),
 1260:     case count_bytes_recv(A, 0) of
 1261:         {Bytes, Result} ->
 1262:             ?P("Success: "
 1263:                "~n   Result: ~p", [Result]);
 1264:         {Wrong, Result} ->
 1265:             ?P("Wrong Number of Bytes:"
 1266:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1267:                "~n   Got:      ~p"
 1268:                "~n   Result:   ~p", [Bytes, Wrong, Result]),
 1269:             ct:fail({wrong_count, Wrong})
 1270:     end,
 1271:     ok.
 1272: 
 1273: count_bytes_recv(Sock, Total) ->
 1274:     receive
 1275: 	{tcp, Sock, Bin} ->
 1276:             Sz = byte_size(Bin),
 1277:             ?P("count_bytes_recv -> received ~w bytes of data", [Sz]),
 1278: 	    count_bytes_recv(Sock, Total+Sz);
 1279: 	Other ->
 1280:             ?P("count_bytes_recv -> received 'other': "
 1281:                "~n   ~p", [Other]),
 1282: 	    {Total, Other}
 1283:     end.
 1284: 
 1285: huge_sender(Config, Addr, TcpPort, Bytes) ->
 1286:     ?P("huge_sender -> connect to"
 1287:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1288:        "~n   Port: ~p", [Addr, TcpPort]),
 1289:     %% {ok, Client} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, TcpPort, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1290:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, TcpPort, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1291: 	{ok, Client} ->
 1292: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> connected: sleep some"),
 1293: 	    receive after 500 -> ok end,
 1294: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> try send ~w bytes", [Bytes]),
 1295: 	    ok = gen_tcp:send(Client, make_zero_packet(Bytes)),
 1296: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> data sent: sleep some"),
 1297: 	    receive after 500 -> ok end,
 1298: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> close socket"),
 1299: 	    _ = gen_tcp:close(Client),
 1300: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> done"),
 1301: 	    ok;
 1302: 	{error, Reason} when (Reason =:= duplicate_name) ->
 1303: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> connect failed: "
 1304: 	       "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 1305: 	    exit({skip, ?F("connect failed: ~p", [Reason])})
 1306:     end.
 1307: 
 1308: make_zero_packet(0) -> [];
 1309: make_zero_packet(N) when N rem 2 == 0 ->
 1310:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
 1311:     [P|P];
 1312: make_zero_packet(N) ->
 1313:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
 1314:     [0, P|P].
 1315: 
 1316: %% OTP-2924. Test that the socket process does not crash when
 1317: %% sys:get_status(Pid) is called.
 1318: get_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1319:     {ok,{socket,Pid,_,_}} = ?LISTEN(Config, 5678,[]),
 1320:     {status,Pid,_,_} = sys:get_status(Pid).
 1321: 
 1322: -define(RECOVER_SLEEP, 60000).
 1323: -define(RETRY_SLEEP,   15000).
 1324: 
 1325: %% Open as many sockets as possible. Do this several times and check
 1326: %% that we get the same number of sockets every time.
 1327: %% Guess: This is "supposed to" test for socket leakage
 1328: %% This works badly with the socket inet_backend, so make
 1329: %% some "checks" and "adjustments"...
 1330: iter_max_socks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1331:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(30)),
 1332:     Cond = fun() -> iter_max_socks_condition(Config) end,
 1333:     Pre  = fun() ->
 1334:                    %% This is not *nearly* enough
 1335:                    %% We have some crap machines,
 1336:                    %% which we need to "handle with care"...
 1337:                    Tries =
 1338:                        case os:type() of
 1339:                            {win32, _} ->
 1340: 			       7;
 1341:                            {unix, darwin} ->
 1342:                                10;
 1343:                            _ ->
 1344:                                20
 1345:                        end,
 1346:                    %% Run on a different node in order to
 1347:                    %% limit the effect if this test fails.
 1348:                    Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1349:                    {ok, Node} = ?START_NODE(test_iter_max_socks,
 1350:                                             "+Q 2048 -pa " ++ Dir),
 1351:                    {ok, Addr} = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
 1352:                    #{addr  => Addr,
 1353:                      tries => Tries,
 1354:                      node  => Node}
 1355:            end,
 1356:     Case = fun(#{addr  := Addr,
 1357:                  tries := Tries,
 1358:                  node  := Node}) ->
 1359:                    do_iter_max_socks(Config, Addr, Tries, Node)
 1360:            end,
 1361:     Post = fun(#{node := Node}) ->
 1362:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)
 1363:            end,
 1364:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 1365: 
 1366: -define(IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, 4096).
 1367: 
 1368: iter_max_socks_condition(Config) -> 
 1369:     case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 1370:         true ->
 1371:             case os:type() of
 1372:                 {unix, _} ->
 1373:                     MaxNumOpenFilesStr =
 1374:                         string:trim(os:cmd("ulimit -n")),
 1375:                     try list_to_integer(MaxNumOpenFilesStr) of
 1376:                         MaxNumOpenFile when
 1377:                               (MaxNumOpenFile =< ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT) ->
 1378:                             ok;
 1379:                         MaxNumOpenFile ->
 1380:                             {skip, ?F("ulimit -n: ~w (> ~w)",
 1381:                                       [MaxNumOpenFile, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT])}
 1382:                     catch
 1383:                         _:_:_ ->
 1384:                             %% Skip just to be on the safe side
 1385:                             {skip, "Works badly with the socket inet_backend"}
 1386:                     end;
 1387:                 _ ->
 1388:                     ok
 1389:             end;
 1390:         false ->
 1391:             ok
 1392:     end.
 1393: 
 1394:    
 1395: do_iter_max_socks(Config, Addr, Tries, Node) ->
 1396:     Self = self(),
 1397:     L = iter_max_socks_run(
 1398:           Node,
 1399:           fun() ->
 1400:                   exit(iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Self, Tries, initialize))
 1401:           end),
 1402:     ?P("Result: "
 1403:        "~n   ~p", [L]),
 1404:     all_equal(L),
 1405:     {comment, "Max sockets: " ++ integer_to_list(hd(L))}.
 1406: 
 1407: iter_max_socks_run(Node, F) ->
 1408:     try erlang:spawn_opt(Node, F, [monitor]) of
 1409:         {Pid, MRef} when is_pid(Pid) andalso is_reference(MRef) ->
 1410:             iter_max_socks_await_runner(Node, Pid, MRef);
 1411:         _Any ->
 1412:             ?P("Unexpected process start result: "
 1413:                "~n   ~p", [_Any]),
 1414:             {skip, "Failed starting iterator (remote) process"}
 1415:     catch
 1416:         C:E:S ->
 1417:             ?P("Failed starting iterator (remote) process: "
 1418:                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1419:                "~n   Error: ~p"
 1420:                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 1421:             {skip, "Failed starting iterator (remote) process"}
 1422:     end.
 1423: 
 1424: iter_max_socks_await_runner(Node, Pid, MRef) ->
 1425:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 1426:     Start = millis(),
 1427:     iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Start).
 1428: 
 1429: iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp) ->
 1430:     receive
 1431:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Res} ->
 1432:             T = millis(),
 1433:             ?P("received runner result after ~w ms "
 1434:                  "(~w ms since last status)", [T - Start, T - Timestamp]),
 1435:             erlang:monitor_node(Node, false),
 1436:             Res;
 1437: 
 1438:         {nodedown, Node} = NODEDOWN ->
 1439:             ?P("Received unexpected ~p 'nodedown'", [Node]),
 1440:             NODEDOWN;
 1441: 
 1442:         {status, Action, Info} ->
 1443:             T = millis(),
 1444:             ?P("Received status message (after ~w ms) from the runner ~p: "
 1445:                "~n   ~p => ~p", [T - Timestamp, Pid, Action, Info]),
 1446:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, T);
 1447: 
 1448:         Any ->
 1449:             ?P("Received unexpected message while waiting for the runner ~p: "
 1450:                "~n   ~p", [Pid, Any]),
 1451:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp)
 1452: 
 1453:     after 5000 ->
 1454:             ?P("timeout while waiting for the runner ~p", [Pid]),
 1455:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp)
 1456:     end.
 1457: 
 1458:              
 1459: iter_max_socks_runner(_Config, _Addr, _Parent, 0, _) ->
 1460:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(0,-) -> done"),
 1461:     [];
 1462: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, initialize = First) ->
 1463:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1464:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1465:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1466:     [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, MS)];
 1467: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, failed = First) ->
 1468:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1469:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1470:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1471:     [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1472: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, First) when is_integer(First) ->
 1473:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1474:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1475:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1476:     if
 1477:         (MS =:= First) -> 
 1478: 	    [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1479:        true ->
 1480: 	    ?P("~w =/= ~w => sleeping for ~p seconds...",
 1481:                [MS, First, ?RETRY_SLEEP/1000]), 
 1482: 	    receive after ?RETRY_SLEEP -> ok end,
 1483: 	    ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> trying again", [N, First]),
 1484:             Parent ! {status, retry_socks_counting, {First, MS}},
 1485: 	    RetryMS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1486: 	    if RetryMS == First ->
 1487:                     [RetryMS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1488:                true ->
 1489:                     [RetryMS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, failed)]
 1490:             end
 1491:     end.
 1492: 
 1493: all_equal({skip, _} = SKIP) ->
 1494:     throw(SKIP);
 1495: all_equal([]) ->
 1496:     ok;
 1497: all_equal([Rule | T]) ->
 1498:     all_equal(Rule, T).
 1499: 
 1500: all_equal(Rule, [Rule | T]) ->
 1501:     all_equal(Rule, T);
 1502: all_equal(_, [_ | _]) ->
 1503:     ct:sleep(?RECOVER_SLEEP), % Wait a while and *hope* that we'll
 1504:                               % recover so other tests won't be
 1505:                               % affected.
 1506:     ct:fail(max_socket_mismatch);
 1507: all_equal(_Rule, []) ->
 1508:     ok.
 1509: 
 1510: max_socks(Config, Addr) ->
 1511:     put(state, open),
 1512:     Socks = case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 1513: 		true ->
 1514: 		    case os:type() of
 1515: 			{win32, nt} ->
 1516: 			    %% 'socket' behaves differently
 1517: 			    %% on Windows, so this test case
 1518: 			    %% needs a lot of tweaking...
 1519: 			    open_socks(Config,
 1520: 				       ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT div 2,
 1521: 				       Addr);
 1522: 			_ ->
 1523: 			    open_socks(Config, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, Addr)
 1524: 		    end;
 1525: 		_ ->
 1526: 		    open_socks(Config, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, Addr)
 1527: 
 1528: 	    end,			    
 1529:     N = length(Socks),
 1530:     put(state, close),
 1531:     lists:foreach(fun(S) -> ok = gen_tcp:close(S) end, Socks),
 1532:     put(state, ready),
 1533:     ?P("Got ~p sockets", [N]),
 1534:     N.
 1535: 
 1536: %% We loop *either* until:
 1537: %% a) We cannot create more sockets
 1538: %% b) We have reached the max number of open sockets.
 1539: %%    Going passed this limit will make the system unstable
 1540: open_socks(Config, N, Addr) ->
 1541:     case ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1542: 	{ok, L} ->
 1543: 	    {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1544: 	    [L | connect_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1545: 	_ ->
 1546: 	    []
 1547:     end.
 1548: 
 1549: 
 1550: connect_accept(Config, N, L, Addr, Port) when (N > 0) ->
 1551:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1552: 	{ok, C} ->
 1553: 	    [C | do_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1554: 	_ ->
 1555: 	    []
 1556:     end;
 1557: connect_accept(_, _, _, _, _) ->
 1558:     [].
 1559: 
 1560: 
 1561: do_accept(Config, N, L, Addr, Port) ->
 1562:     case gen_tcp:accept(L) of
 1563: 	{ok, A} -> [A | connect_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1564: 	_ -> []
 1565:     end.
 1566: 
 1567: start_node(Name) ->
 1568:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1569:     ?START_NODE(Name, "-pa " ++ Pa).
 1570: 
 1571: %% start_node(Name0, InetBackend) ->
 1572: %%     Name = list_to_atom(?F("~w_~w", [Name0, InetBackend])),
 1573: %%     start_node(Name).
 1574: 
 1575: start_remote_node(Name0, InetBackend) ->
 1576:      Name = list_to_atom(?F("~w_~w", [Name0, InetBackend])),
 1577:      Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1578:      Opts = [{remote, true}, {fail_on_error, false}],
 1579:      ?START_NODE(Name, "-pa " ++ Pa, Opts).
 1580: 
 1581: %% Tests that when 'the other side' on a passive socket closes, the
 1582: %% connecting side can still read until the end of data.
 1583: passive_sockets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1584:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1585:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1586:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1587:                             Addr;
 1588:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1589:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1590:                     end
 1591:            end,
 1592:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_passive_sockets(Config, Addr) end,
 1593:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1594:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1595: 
 1596: 
 1597: do_passive_sockets(Config, Addr) ->
 1598:     ME = self(),
 1599:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1600:                        passive_sockets_server(Config,
 1601:                                               [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}],
 1602:                                               ME)
 1603:                end),
 1604:     receive
 1605:         {socket,Port} -> ok
 1606:     end,
 1607:     ct:sleep(500),
 1608:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 1609:         {ok, Sock} ->
 1610:             passive_sockets_read(Sock);
 1611:         {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1612:             {skip, connect_failed_str(Reason)};
 1613:         Error ->
 1614:             ct:fail({"Could not connect to server", Error})
 1615:     end.
 1616: 
 1617: %%
 1618: %% Read until we get an {error, closed}. If we get another error, this test case
 1619: %% should fail.
 1620: %%
 1621: passive_sockets_read(Sock) ->
 1622:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0, 2000) of
 1623: 	{ok, Data} ->
 1624: 	    io:format("Received ~p bytes~n", [length(Data)]),
 1625: 	    passive_sockets_read(Sock);
 1626: 	{error, closed} ->
 1627: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock);
 1628: 	Error ->
 1629: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1630: 	    ct:fail({"Did not get {error, closed} before other error", Error})
 1631:     end.
 1632: 
 1633: passive_sockets_server(Config, Opts, Parent) ->
 1634:     case ?LISTEN(Config, 0, Opts) of
 1635:         {ok, LSock} ->
 1636:             {ok,{_,Port}} = inet:sockname(LSock),
 1637:             Parent ! {socket,Port},
 1638:             passive_sockets_server_accept(LSock);
 1639:         Error ->
 1640:             ct:fail({"Could not create listen socket", Error})
 1641:     end.
 1642: 
 1643: passive_sockets_server_accept(Sock) ->
 1644:     case gen_tcp:accept(Sock) of
 1645:         {ok, Socket} ->
 1646:             timer:sleep(500),			% Simulate latency
 1647:             passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, 5),
 1648:             passive_sockets_server_accept(Sock);
 1649:         Error ->
 1650:             ct:fail({"Could not accept connection", Error})
 1651:     end.
 1652: 
 1653: passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, 0) ->
 1654:     io:format("Closing other end..~n", []),
 1655:     gen_tcp:close(Socket);
 1656: passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, X) ->
 1657:     Data = lists:duplicate(1024*X, $a),
 1658:     case gen_tcp:send(Socket, Data) of
 1659:         ok ->
 1660:             ct:sleep(50),   % Simulate some processing.
 1661:             passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, X-1);
 1662:         {error, _Reason} ->
 1663:             ct:fail("Failed to send data")
 1664:     end.
 1665: 
 1666: 
 1667: %% Tests the return value from gen_tcp:accept when
 1668: %% the socket is closed from another process. (OTP-3817)
 1669: accept_closed_by_other_process(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1670:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1671:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1672:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1673:                             Addr;
 1674:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1675:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1676:                     end
 1677:            end,
 1678:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_accept_closed_by_other_process(Config, Addr) end,
 1679:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1680:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1681: 
 1682: do_accept_closed_by_other_process(Config, Addr) ->
 1683:     Parent = self(),
 1684:     {ok, ListenSocket} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1685:     Child =
 1686: 	spawn_link(
 1687: 	  fun() ->
 1688: 		  Parent ! {self(), gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket)}
 1689: 	  end),
 1690:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1691:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ListenSocket),
 1692:     receive
 1693:         {Child, {error, closed}} ->
 1694:             ok;
 1695:         {Child, Other} ->
 1696:             ct:fail({"Wrong result of gen_tcp:accept", Other})
 1697:     end.
 1698: 
 1699: repeat(N, Fun) ->
 1700:     repeat(N, N, Fun).
 1701: 
 1702: repeat(N, T, Fun) when is_integer(N), N > 0 ->
 1703:     Fun(T-N),
 1704:     repeat(N-1, T, Fun);
 1705: repeat(_, _, _) ->
 1706:     ok.
 1707: 
 1708: 
 1709: %% Tests the response when using a closed socket as argument.
 1710: closed_socket(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1711:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1712:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1713:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1714:                             Addr;
 1715:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1716:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1717:                     end
 1718:            end,
 1719:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_closed_socket(Config, Addr) end,
 1720:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1721:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1722: 
 1723: do_closed_socket(Config, Addr) ->
 1724:     {ok, LS1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1725:     erlang:yield(),
 1726:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS1),
 1727:     %% If the following delay is uncommented, the result error values
 1728:     %% below will change from {error, einval} to {error, closed} since
 1729:     %% inet_db then will have noticed that the socket is closed.
 1730:     %% This is a scheduling issue, i.e when the gen_server in 
 1731:     %% in inet_db processes the 'EXIT' message from the port,
 1732:     %% the socket is unregistered.
 1733:     %%
 1734:     %% ct:sleep({seconds,2})
 1735:     %%
 1736:     {error, R_send}   = gen_tcp:send(LS1, "data"),
 1737:     {error, R_recv}   = gen_tcp:recv(LS1, 17),
 1738:     {error, R_accept} = gen_tcp:accept(LS1),
 1739:     {error, R_controlling_process} =
 1740: 	gen_tcp:controlling_process(LS1, self()),
 1741:     %%
 1742:     ok = ?P("R_send = ~p", [R_send]),
 1743:     ok = ?P("R_recv = ~p", [R_recv]),
 1744:     ok = ?P("R_accept = ~p", [R_accept]),
 1745:     ok = ?P("R_controlling_process = ~p", [R_controlling_process]),
 1746:     ok.
 1747: 
 1748: %%%
 1749: %%% Test using the gen_tcp:shutdown/2 function using a sort server.
 1750: %%% 
 1751: 
 1752: shutdown_active(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1753:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1754:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1755:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1756:                             Addr;
 1757:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1758:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1759:                     end
 1760:            end,
 1761:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> shutdown_common(Config, Addr, true) end,
 1762:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1763:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1764: 
 1765: shutdown_passive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1766:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1767:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1768:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1769:                             Addr;
 1770:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1771:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1772:                     end
 1773:            end,
 1774:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> shutdown_common(Config, Addr, false) end,
 1775:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1776:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1777: 
 1778: shutdown_common(Config, Addr, Active) ->
 1779:     ?P("start sort server"),
 1780:     P = sort_server(Config, Addr, Active),
 1781:     ?P("Sort server port: ~p", [P]),
 1782: 
 1783: 
 1784:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1785:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["glurf"]),
 1786:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["abc","nisse","dum"]),
 1787: 
 1788:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 255)]),
 1789:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(77, 999)]),
 1790:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 55)]),
 1791:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1792:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["apa"]),
 1793:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["kluns","gorilla"]),
 1794:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 1233)]),
 1795:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1796:     receive
 1797: 	Any ->
 1798: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message,Any})
 1799:     after 0 -> ok
 1800:     end.
 1801: 
 1802: do_sort(Config, Addr, P, List0) ->
 1803:     ?P("Sort: "
 1804:        "~n   ~p", [List0]),
 1805:     List = [El++"\n" || El <- List0],
 1806:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, P, [{ip, Addr}, {packet,line}]) of
 1807:             {ok, Socket} ->
 1808:                 Socket;
 1809:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1810:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 1811:         end,
 1812:     %% ok = inet:setopts(S, [{debug, true}]),
 1813:     send_lines(S, List),
 1814:     ok = gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1815:     Lines = collect_lines(S, true),
 1816:     ?P("Collected: "
 1817:        "~n   ~p", [Lines]),
 1818:     SortedLines = lists:sort(List),
 1819:     ?P("Sorted: "
 1820:        "~n   ~p", [SortedLines]),
 1821:     Lines = SortedLines,
 1822:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S).
 1823: 
 1824: sort_server(Config, Addr, Active) ->
 1825:     Opts = [{ip, Addr}, {exit_on_close,false},{packet,line},{active,Active}],
 1826:     {ok,L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, Opts),
 1827:     Go = make_ref(),
 1828:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1829:                              receive Go -> sort_server_1(L, Active) end
 1830:                      end),
 1831:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(L, Pid),
 1832:     Pid ! Go,
 1833:     {ok,Port} = inet:port(L),
 1834:     Port.
 1835: 
 1836: sort_server_1(L, Active) ->
 1837:     {ok,S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1838:     Go = make_ref(),
 1839:     Sorter = spawn(fun() -> receive Go -> sorter(S, Active) end end),
 1840:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(S, Sorter),
 1841:     Sorter ! Go,
 1842:     sort_server_1(L, Active).
 1843: 
 1844: sorter(S, Active) ->
 1845:     Lines = collect_lines(S, Active),
 1846:     send_lines(S, lists:sort(Lines)),
 1847:     gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1848:     gen_tcp:close(S).
 1849: 
 1850: collect_lines(S, true) ->
 1851:     collect_lines_1(S, []);
 1852: collect_lines(S, false) ->
 1853:     passive_collect_lines_1(S, []).
 1854: 
 1855: collect_lines_1(S, Acc) ->
 1856:     receive
 1857: 	{tcp,S,Line} ->
 1858:             ?P("collect_lines_1(~w): ~p", [S, Line]),
 1859:             collect_lines_1(S, [Line|Acc]);
 1860: 	{tcp_closed,S} ->
 1861:             ?P("collect_lines_1(~w): tcp_closed", [S]),
 1862:             lists:reverse(Acc)
 1863:     end.
 1864: 
 1865: passive_collect_lines_1(S, Acc) ->
 1866:     case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0) of
 1867: 	{ok,Line} -> passive_collect_lines_1(S, [Line|Acc]);
 1868: 	{error,closed} -> lists:reverse(Acc)
 1869:     end.
 1870: 
 1871: 
 1872: send_lines(S, Lines) ->    
 1873:     lists:foreach(fun(Line) ->
 1874:                           ?P("send_line(~w): ~p", [S, Line]),
 1875: 			  ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Line)
 1876: 		  end, Lines).
 1877: 
 1878: %%%
 1879: %%% Shutdown pending.
 1880: %%%
 1881: 
 1882: shutdown_pending(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1883:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1884:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1885:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1886:                             Addr;
 1887:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1888:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1889:                     end
 1890:            end,
 1891:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_shutdown_pending(Config, Addr) end,
 1892:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1893:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1894: 
 1895: do_shutdown_pending(Config, Addr) ->
 1896:     N = 512*1024+17,
 1897:     ?P("N: ~p", [N]),
 1898:     Data = [<<N:32>>,ones(N),42],
 1899:     {Port, Pid} = a_server(Config, Addr),
 1900:     ?P("try connect to server (port: ~p)", [Port]),
 1901:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1902:             {ok, Socket} ->
 1903:                 ?P("connected"),
 1904:                 Socket;
 1905:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1906:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 1907:         end,
 1908:     ?P("send"),
 1909:     gen_tcp:send(S, Data),
 1910:     ?P("shutdown(write)"),
 1911:     gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1912:     ?P("await data message"),
 1913:     case sp_await_data(Pid, S) of
 1914:         N ->
 1915:             ok;
 1916:         InvalidN ->
 1917:             ?P("Invalid message: "
 1918:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1919:                "~n   Received: ~p", [N, InvalidN]),
 1920:             ct:fail({unexpected_msg, N, InvalidN})
 1921:     end,
 1922:     ?P("done"),
 1923:     ok.
 1924: 
 1925: sp_await_data(Pid, Sock) ->
 1926:     receive
 1927:         {tcp, Sock, Msg} ->
 1928:             ?P("got tcp (data) message: ~p", [Msg]),
 1929:             list_to_integer(Msg) - 5;
 1930:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
 1931:             ?P("server exited normal"),
 1932:             sp_await_data(Pid, Sock);
 1933:         Other ->
 1934:             ?P("UNEXPECTED: "
 1935:                "~n   ~p", [Other]),
 1936:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1937:     end.
 1938: 
 1939:  ones(0) -> [];
 1940:  ones(1) -> [1];
 1941:  ones(N) ->
 1942:      Half = N div 2,
 1943:      Ones = ones(Half),
 1944:      case 2*Half of
 1945: 	 N -> [Ones|Ones];
 1946: 	 _ -> [1,Ones|Ones]
 1947:      end.
 1948: 
 1949: a_server(Config, Addr) ->
 1950:      {ok, L}    = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {exit_on_close,false},{active,false}]),
 1951:      Pid        = spawn_link(fun() -> a_server2(L) end),
 1952:      ok         = gen_tcp:controlling_process(L, Pid),
 1953:      {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 1954:      {Port, Pid}.
 1955: 
 1956: a_server2(L) ->
 1957:      {ok,S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1958:      do_recv(S, []).
 1959: 
 1960:  do_recv(S, Bs0) ->
 1961:      case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0) of
 1962: 	 {ok,B} ->
 1963: 	     do_recv(S, [Bs0,B]);
 1964: 	 {error,closed} ->
 1965: 	     Bs = list_to_binary(Bs0),
 1966: 	     gen_tcp:send(S, integer_to_list(byte_size(Bs))),
 1967: 	     gen_tcp:close(S)
 1968:      end.
 1969: 
 1970: %%
 1971: %% Test 'show_econnreset' option
 1972: %%
 1973: 
 1974: show_econnreset_active(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1975:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1976:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1977:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1978:                             Addr;
 1979:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1980:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1981:                     end
 1982:            end,
 1983:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_show_econnreset_active(Config, Addr) end,
 1984:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1985:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1986: 
 1987: do_show_econnreset_active(Config, Addr) ->
 1988:     %% First confirm everything works with option turned off.
 1989:     ?P("test with option switched off (default)"),
 1990:     {ok, L0} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1991:     {ok, Port0} = inet:port(L0),
 1992:     Client0 = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port0,
 1993:                             [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 1994:                  {ok, CSock0} ->
 1995:                      CSock0;
 1996:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason0} ->
 1997:                       ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason0))
 1998:               end,
 1999:     {ok, S0} = gen_tcp:accept(L0),
 2000:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L0),
 2001:     ok = inet:setopts(Client0, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2002:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client0),
 2003:     receive
 2004:        {tcp_closed, S0} ->
 2005: 	   ok;
 2006:        Other0 ->
 2007: 	   ct:fail({unexpected, off, closed, Other0})
 2008:     after 1000 ->
 2009: 	ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_closed}})
 2010:     end,
 2011: 
 2012:     %% Now test with option switched on.
 2013:     %% Note: We are also testing that the show_econnreset option is
 2014:     %% inherited from the listening socket by the accepting socket.
 2015:     ?P("test with option explicitly switched on"),
 2016:     {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{show_econnreset, true}, {ip, Addr}]),
 2017:     {ok, Port1} = inet:port(L1),
 2018:     Client1 = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port1,
 2019:                             [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 2020:                   {ok, CSock1} ->
 2021:                       CSock1;
 2022:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2023:                       ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason1))
 2024:               end,
 2025:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:accept(L1),
 2026:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L1),
 2027:     ok = inet:setopts(Client1, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2028:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client1),
 2029:     receive
 2030: 	{tcp_error, S1, econnreset} ->
 2031: 	    receive
 2032: 		{tcp_closed, S1} ->
 2033:                     ?P("done"),
 2034: 		    ok;
 2035: 		Other1 ->
 2036:                     ?P("UNEXPECTED (expected closed):"
 2037:                        "~n   ~p", [Other1]),
 2038: 		    ct:fail({unexpected, on, closed, Other1})
 2039: 	    after 1 ->
 2040:                     ?P("UNEXPECTED timeout (expected closed)"),
 2041:                     ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_closed}})
 2042: 	    end;
 2043: 	Other2 ->
 2044:             ?P("UNEXPECTED (expected error:econnreset):"
 2045:                "~n   ~p", [Other2]),
 2046: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, on, econnreset, Other2})
 2047:     after 1000 ->
 2048:             ?P("UNEXPECTED timeout (expected error:econnreset)"),
 2049:             ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_error}})
 2050:     end.
 2051: 
 2052: show_econnreset_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2053:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2054:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2055:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2056:                             Addr;
 2057:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2058:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2059:                     end
 2060:            end,
 2061:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_show_econnreset_active_once(Config, Addr) end,
 2062:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2063:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2064: 
 2065: do_show_econnreset_active_once(Config, Addr) ->
 2066:     %% Now test using {active, once}
 2067:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0,
 2068:                       [{active, false},
 2069:                        {show_econnreset, true},
 2070:                        {ip, Addr}]),
 2071:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 2072:     Client = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port,
 2073:                            [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 2074:                  {ok, CSock} ->
 2075:                      CSock;
 2076:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 2077:                       ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 2078:               end,
 2079:     {ok, S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 2080:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2081:     ok = inet:setopts(Client, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2082:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client),
 2083:     ok = ct:sleep(20),
 2084:     ok = receive Msg -> {unexpected_msg, Msg} after 0 -> ok end,
 2085:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active, once}]),
 2086:     receive
 2087: 	{tcp_error, S, econnreset} ->
 2088: 	    receive
 2089: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 2090: 		    ok;
 2091: 		Other1 ->
 2092: 		    ct:fail({unexpected1, Other1})
 2093: 	    after 1 ->
 2094: 		ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_closed}})
 2095: 	    end;
 2096: 	Other2 ->
 2097: 	    ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})
 2098:     after 1000 ->
 2099: 	ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_error}})
 2100:     end.
 2101: 
 2102: show_econnreset_passive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2103:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2104:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2105:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2106:                             Addr;
 2107:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2108:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2109:                     end
 2110:            end,
 2111:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_show_econnreset_passive(Config, Addr) end,
 2112:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2113:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2114: 
 2115: do_show_econnreset_passive(Config, Addr) ->
 2116:     %% First confirm everything works with option turned off.
 2117:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]),
 2118:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 2119:     Client = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 2120:                  {ok, CSock} ->
 2121:                      CSock;
 2122:                  {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 2123:                      ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 2124:              end,
 2125:     {ok, S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 2126:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2127:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2128:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S),
 2129:     ok = ct:sleep(1),
 2130:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Client, 0),
 2131: 
 2132:     %% Now test with option switched on.
 2133:     {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]),
 2134:     {ok, Port1} = inet:port(L1),
 2135:     Client1 =
 2136:         case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port1,
 2137:                       [{active,          false},
 2138:                        {show_econnreset, true},
 2139:                        {ip,              Addr}]) of
 2140:             {ok, CSock1} ->
 2141:                 CSock1;
 2142:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2143:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason1))
 2144:         end,            
 2145:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:accept(L1),
 2146:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L1),
 2147:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2148:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S1),
 2149:     ok = ct:sleep(1),
 2150:     {error, econnreset} = gen_tcp:recv(Client1, 0),
 2151:     ?P("done"),
 2152:     ok.
