 2976: %%
 2977: %% Test {linger {true, 0}} aborts a connection
 2978: %%
 2979: 
 2980: linger_zero(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2981:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2982:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2983:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2984:                             Addr;
 2985:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2986:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2987:                     end
 2988:            end,
 2989:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_linger_zero(Config, Addr) end,
 2990:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2991:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2992: 
 2993: do_linger_zero(Config, Addr) ->
 2994:     %% All the econnreset tests will prove that {linger, {true, 0}} aborts
 2995:     %% a connection when the driver queue is empty. We will test here
 2996:     %% that it also works when the driver queue is not empty.
 2997:     ?P("[ctrl] pre"),
 2998:     {OS, ISB, Client, Server} = lz_pre(Config, Addr),
 2999: 
 3000:     ?P("[ctrl] populate when"
 3001:        "~n   OS:     ~p"
 3002:        "~n   ISB:    ~p"
 3003:        "~n   Client: ~p"
 3004:        "~n   Server: ~p", [OS, ISB, Client, Server]),
 3005:     PayloadSize  = 1024 * 1024,
 3006:     {ok, Sender} = lz_populate(OS, ISB, Client, PayloadSize),
 3007: 
 3008:     ?P("[ctrl] set linger: {true, 0}"),
 3009:     %% ok = inet:setopts(Client, [{debug,  true}]),
 3010:     ok = inet:setopts(Client, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 3011:     %% ok = inet:setopts(Client, [{linger, {true, 1}}]),
 3012:     ?P("[ctrl] read back the linger option"),
 3013:     {ok, [{linger, {true, 0}}]} = inet:getopts(Client, [linger]),
 3014:     %% {ok, [{linger, {true, 1}}]} = inet:getopts(Client, [linger]),
 3015:     %% ok = inet:setopts(Client, [{debug,  false}]),
 3016:     ?P("[ctrl] close client socket"),
 3017:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client),
 3018:     ?P("[ctrl] sleep some"),
 3019:     ok = ct:sleep(1),
 3020: 
 3021:     ?P("[ctrl] verify"),
 3022:     lz_verify(Client, Server, PayloadSize),
 3023: 
 3024:     ?P("[ctrl] cleanup"), % Just in case
 3025:     (catch gen_tcp:close(Server)),
 3026:     if is_pid(Sender) -> exit(Sender, kill);
 3027:        true           -> ok
 3028:     end,
 3029: 
 3030:     ?P("[ctrl] done"),
 3031:     ok.
 3032: 
 3033: lz_pre(Config, Addr) ->
 3034:     {OS, _} = os:type(),
 3035:     ISB     = ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config),
 3036:     ?P("create listen socket"),
 3037:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip,              Addr},
 3038:                                   {active,          false},
 3039:                                   {recbuf,          4096},
 3040:                                   {show_econnreset, true}]),
 3041:     ?P("listen socket created"),
 3042:     %% inet_backend = inet
 3043:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 3044:     ?P("connect (create client socket)"),
 3045:     Client = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port,
 3046:                            [{ip,      Addr},
 3047:                             {nodelay, true},
 3048:                             {active,  false},
 3049:                             {sndbuf,  4096}]) of
 3050:                  {ok, CSock} ->
 3051:                      CSock;
 3052:                  {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 3053:                      ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 3054:              end,
 3055:     ?P("accept"),
 3056:     {ok, Server} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 3057:     ?P("close listen socket"),
 3058:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 3059:     {OS, ISB, Client, Server}.
 3060: 
 3061: lz_populate(OS, _ISB, Client, PayloadSize) when is_port(Client) ->
 3062:     ?P("[inet] create payload"),
 3063:     Payload = lz_make_payload(PayloadSize),
 3064:     ?P("[inet] ensure non-empty queue"),
 3065:     lz_ensure_non_empty_queue(Client, Payload, OS),
 3066:     {ok, undefined};
 3067: lz_populate(OS, ISB, Client, PayloadSize) ->
 3068:     ?P("[socket] send payload"),
 3069:     Sender = spawn_link(fun() ->
 3070: 				lz_populate_sender(OS, ISB, Client, PayloadSize)
 3071: 			end),
 3072:     receive
 3073:         {'EXIT', Sender, Reason} ->
 3074:             {error, {unexpected_exit, Sender, Reason}}
 3075:     after 2000 ->
 3076:             {ok, Sender}
 3077:     end.
 3078: 
 3079: lz_populate_sender(OS, ISB, Client, PayloadSize) ->
 3080:     ?P("[socket,~w,~w] create payload", [OS, ISB]),
 3081:     Payload = lz_make_payload(PayloadSize),
 3082:     if ((OS =:= win32) andalso ISB) ->
 3083: 	    ?P("[socket] send payload (expect one success and then failure)"),
 3084: 	    ok              = gen_tcp:send(Client, Payload),
 3085: 	    {error, closed} = gen_tcp:send(Client, Payload),
 3086: 	    ?P("[socket] payload send success + failure (as expected)"), 
 3087: 	    exit(normal);
 3088:        true ->
 3089: 	    ?P("[socket] send payload (expect failure)"),
 3090: 	    {error, closed} = gen_tcp:send(Client, Payload),
 3091: 	    ?P("[socket] payload send failed (as expected)"), 
 3092: 	    exit(normal)
 3093:     end.
 3094: 
 3095: 
 3096: lz_verify(Client, Server, PayloadSize)
 3097:   when is_port(Client) andalso is_port(Server) ->
 3098:     ?P("[inet] verify client socket (port) not connected"),
 3099:     undefined = erlang:port_info(Client, connected),
 3100:     ?P("[inet] try (and fail) recv (on accepted socket)"),
 3101:     {error, econnreset} = gen_tcp:recv(Server, PayloadSize),
 3102:     ok;
 3103: lz_verify(_Client, Server, PayloadSize) ->
 3104:     ?P("[socket] try (and fail) recv (on accepted socket)"),
 3105:     {error, econnreset} = gen_tcp:recv(Server, PayloadSize),
 3106:     ok.
 3107: 
 3108: lz_make_payload(PayloadSize) ->
 3109:     list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(PayloadSize, $.)).
 3110: 
 3111: %% THIS DOES NOT WORK FOR 'SOCKET'
 3112: lz_ensure_non_empty_queue(Sock, Payload, OS) when is_port(Sock) ->
 3113:     lz_ensure_non_empty_queue(Sock, Payload, OS, 1).
 3114: 
 3115: -define(LZ_MAX_SENDS, 3).
 3116: 
 3117: lz_ensure_non_empty_queue(Sock, _Payload, _OS, N) when (N > ?LZ_MAX_SENDS) ->
 3118:     ?P("queue size verification failed - port info: "
 3119:        "~n   Socket:      ~p"
 3120:        "~n   Socket info: ~p", [Sock, erlang:port_info(Sock)]),
 3121:     ct:fail("Queue size verification failed");
 3122: lz_ensure_non_empty_queue(Sock, Payload, OS, N) ->
 3123:     ?P("try send payload (~w bytes) ~w (on client socket) when port info:"
 3124:        "~n   ~p", [byte_size(Payload), N, erlang:port_info(Sock)]),
 3125:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, Payload),
 3126:     ?P("try verify client socket queue size"),
 3127:     case erlang:port_info(Sock, queue_size) of
 3128: 	{queue_size, QSz} when QSz > 0 ->
 3129:             ?P("queue size verification *successful* (~p) - port info: "
 3130:                "~n   ~p", [QSz, erlang:port_info(Sock)]),
 3131:             ok;
 3132: 	{queue_size, 0} when OS =:= win32 ->
 3133:             ?P("queue size verification *successful* - port info: "
 3134:                "~n   ~p", [erlang:port_info(Sock)]),
 3135:             ok;
 3136: 	{queue_size, 0} ->
 3137:             ?P("queue size verification failed - port info: "
 3138:                "~n   ~p", [erlang:port_info(Sock)]),
 3139:             lz_ensure_non_empty_queue(Sock, Payload, OS, N+1)
 3140:     end.
 3141: 
 3142: 
 3143: linger_zero_sndbuf(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3144:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 3145:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 3146:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 3147:                             Addr;
 3148:                         {error, Reason} ->
 3149:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 3150:                     end
 3151:            end,
 3152:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_linger_zero_sndbuf(Config, Addr) end,
 3153:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3154:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 3155: 
 3156: do_linger_zero_sndbuf(Config, Addr) ->
 3157:     %% All the econnreset tests will prove that {linger, {true, 0}} aborts
 3158:     %% a connection when the driver queue is empty. We will test here
 3159:     %% that it also works when the driver queue is not empty
 3160:     %% and the linger zero option is set on the listen socket.
 3161:     {OS, ISB, Client, Server} = lzs_pre(Config, Addr),
 3162: 
 3163:     PayloadSize = 1024 * 1024,
 3164:     {ok, Sender} = lzs_populate(OS, ISB, Client, PayloadSize),
 3165: 
 3166:     ?P("verify linger: {true, 0}"),
 3167:     {ok, [{linger, {true, 0}}]} = inet:getopts(Server, [linger]),
 3168:     ?P("close client socket"),
 3169:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Server),
 3170:     ok = ct:sleep(1),
 3171: 
 3172:     lzs_verify(Client, Server, PayloadSize),
 3173: 
 3174:     ?P("cleanup"), % Just in case
 3175:     (catch gen_tcp:close(Server)),
 3176:     if is_pid(Sender) -> exit(Sender, kill);
 3177:        true           -> ok
 3178:     end,
 3179: 
 3180:     ?P("done"),
 3181:     ok.
 3182: 
 3183: lzs_pre(Config, Addr) ->
 3184:     {OS, _} = os:type(),
 3185:     ISB     = ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config),
 3186:     ?P("create listen socket"),
 3187:     {ok, Listen} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip,              Addr},
 3188:                                        {active,          false},
 3189:                                        {recbuf,          4096},
 3190:                                        {show_econnreset, true},
 3191:                                        {linger,          {true, 0}}]),
 3192:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(Listen),
 3193:     ?P("connect (create client socket)"),
 3194:     Client = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port,
 3195:                            [{ip,      Addr},
 3196:                             {nodelay, true},
 3197:                             {active,  false},
 3198:                             {sndbuf,  4096}]) of
 3199:             {ok, CSock} ->
 3200:                 CSock;
 3201:             {error, eaddrnotavail = CReason} ->
 3202:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(CReason))
 3203:         end,
 3204:     ?P("accept"),
 3205:     {ok, Server} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
 3206:     %% On *some* platforms, the linger is inherited,
 3207:     %% but not all so do not assume...
 3208:     ?P("check if linger option was inherited"),
 3209:     case inet:getopts(Server, [linger]) of
 3210: 	{ok, [{linger, {true, 0}}]} ->
 3211: 	    ?P("linger option was inherited"),
 3212: 	    ok;
 3213: 	{ok, [{linger, {true, TO}}]} ->
 3214: 	    ?P("linger option was *not* inherited: TRUE, ~p", [TO]),
 3215: 	    ok = inet:setopts(Server, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 3216: 	    ok;
 3217: 	{ok, [{linger, {false, TO}}]} ->
 3218: 	    ?P("linger option was *not* inherited: FALSE, ~p", [TO]),
 3219: 	    ok = inet:setopts(Server, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 3220: 	    ok;
 3221: 	{error, SReason} ->
 3222: 	    ?P("FAILED reading linger option: ~p", [SReason]),
 3223: 	    ok = inet:setopts(Server, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 3224: 	    ok
 3225:     end,
 3226:     ?P("close listen socket"),
 3227:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Listen),
 3228:     {OS, ISB, Client, Server}.
 3229: 
 3230: lzs_populate(OS, _ISB, Client, PayloadSize) when is_port(Client) ->
 3231:     ?P("[inet] create payload"),
 3232:     Payload = lzs_make_payload(PayloadSize),
 3233:     ?P("[inet] ensure non-empty queue"),
 3234:     lz_ensure_non_empty_queue(Client, Payload, OS),
 3235:     {ok, undefined};
 3236: lzs_populate(OS, ISB, Client, PayloadSize) ->
 3237:     ?P("[socket] send payload ( = start payload sender)"),
 3238:     Sender = spawn(fun() ->
 3239: 			   lzs_populate_sender(OS, ISB, Client, PayloadSize)
 3240: 		   end),
 3241:     receive
 3242:         {'EXIT', Sender, Reason} ->
 3243:             {error, {unexpected_exit, Sender, Reason}}
 3244:     after 2000 ->
 3245:             {ok, Sender}
 3246:     end.
 3247: 
 3248: lzs_populate_sender(OS, ISB, Client, PayloadSize) ->
 3249:     ?P("[socket,~w,~w] create payload", [OS, ISB]),
 3250:     Payload = lzs_make_payload(PayloadSize),
 3251:     if ((OS =:= win32) andalso ISB) ->
 3252: 	    ?P("[socket] send payload (expect one success and then failure)"), 
 3253: 	    ok              = gen_tcp:send(Client, Payload),
 3254: 	    {error, closed} = gen_tcp:send(Client, Payload),
 3255: 	    ?P("[socket] payload send success + failure (as expected)"), 
 3256: 	    exit(normal);
 3257:        true ->
 3258: 	    ?P("[socket] send payload (expect failure)"), 
 3259: 	    {error, closed} = gen_tcp:send(Client, Payload),
 3260: 	    ?P("[socket] payload send failed (as expected)"), 
 3261: 	    exit(normal)
 3262:     end.
 3263:     
 3264: lzs_make_payload(PayloadSize) ->
 3265:     Payload = binary:copy(<<"0123456789ABCDEF">>, 64 * 1024), % 1 MB
 3266:     if (PayloadSize =:= byte_size(Payload)) ->
 3267:             Payload;
 3268:        true ->
 3269:             exit({payload_size, PayloadSize, byte_size(Payload)})
 3270:     end.
 3271: 
 3272: lzs_verify(Client, Server, PayloadSize)
 3273:   when is_port(Client) andalso is_port(Server) ->
 3274:     ?P("[inet] verify client socket (port) not connected"),
 3275:     undefined = erlang:port_info(Server, connected),
 3276:     ?P("[inet] try (and fail) recv (on accepted socket)"),
 3277:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Client, PayloadSize),
 3278:     ok;
 3279: lzs_verify(Client, _Server, PayloadSize) ->
 3280:     ?P("[socket] try (and fail) recv (on accepted socket)"),
 3281:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Client, PayloadSize),
 3282:     ok.
 3283:     
 3284: %% Thanks to Luke Gorrie. Tests for a very specific problem with 
 3285: %% corrupt data. The testcase will be killed by the timetrap timeout
 3286: %% if the bug is present.
 3287: http_bad_packet(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3288:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 3289:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 3290:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 3291:                             Addr;
 3292:                         {error, Reason} ->
 3293:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 3294:                     end
 3295:            end,
 3296:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_http_bad_packet(Config, Addr) end,
 3297:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3298:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 3299: 
 3300: do_http_bad_packet(Config, Addr) ->
 3301:     {ok,L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip,        Addr},
 3302:                                  {active,    false},
 3303:                                  binary,
 3304:                                  {reuseaddr, true},
 3305:                                  {packet,    http}]),
 3306:     {ok,Port} = inet:port(L),
 3307:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 3308:                        erlang:yield(),
 3309:                        http_bad_client(Config, Addr, Port)
 3310:                end),
 3311:     case gen_tcp:accept(L) of
 3312:         {ok,S} ->
 3313:             http_worker(S);
 3314:         Err ->
 3315:             exit({accept,Err})
 3316:     end.
 3317: 
 3318: http_worker(S) ->
 3319:     case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0, 30000) of
 3320: 	{ok,{http_error,Error}} ->
 3321: 	     io:format("Http error: ~s\n", [Error]);
 3322: 	{ok,Data} ->
 3323: 	    io:format("Data: ~p\n", [Data]),
 3324: 	    http_worker(S)
 3325:     end.
 3326: 
 3327: http_bad_client(Config, Addr, Port) ->
 3328:     {ok,S} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port,
 3329:                       [{ip, Addr}, {active,false}, binary]),
 3330:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, "\r\n"),
 3331:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S).
 3332: 
 3333: 
 3334: %% Fill send queue and then start receiving.
 3335: %%
 3336: busy_send(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3337:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 3338:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 3339:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 3340:                             Addr;
 3341:                         {error, Reason} ->
 3342:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 3343:                     end
 3344:            end,
 3345:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_busy_send(Config, Addr) end,
 3346:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3347:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 3348: 
 3349: do_busy_send(Config, Addr) ->
 3350:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3351:     Master  = self(),
 3352:     Msg     = <<"the quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog~n">>,
 3353:     ?P("[master] start server"),
 3354:     ServerF =
 3355:         fun() ->
 3356:                 ?P("[server] create listen socket"),
 3357:                 case ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary,
 3358:                                          {ip,        Addr},
 3359:                                          {active,    false},
 3360:                                          {reuseaddr, true},
 3361:                                          {packet,    0},
 3362:                                          {recbuf,    4096},
 3363:                                          {sndbuf,    4096}]) of
 3364:                     {ok, L} ->
 3365:                         ?P("[server] listen socket created"),
 3366:                         {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 3367:                         Master ! {self(), listen_port, Port},
 3368:                         ?P("[server] await continue"),
 3369:                         receive
 3370:                             {Master, continue} ->
 3371:                                 ?P("[server] received continue"),
 3372:                                 busy_send_srv(L, Master, Msg)
 3373:                         end;
 3374:                     {error, Reason} ->
 3375:                         ?P("[server] UNEXPECTED: ~w", [Reason]),
 3376:                         ?SKIPE(listen_failed_str(Reason))
 3377:                 end
 3378:         end,
 3379:     Server = spawn_link(ServerF),
 3380:     ?P("[master] server: ~p", [Server]),
 3381:     ListenPort =
 3382:         receive
 3383:             {'EXIT', Server, {skip, _} = SKIP} ->
 3384:                 ?P("[master] server issued skip: "
 3385:                    "~n      ~p", [SKIP]),
 3386:                 throw(SKIP);
 3387: 
 3388:             {'EXIT', Server, Reason} ->
 3389:                 ?P("[master] server crashed: "
 3390:                    "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
 3391:                 exit({server, Reason});
 3392: 
 3393:             {Server, listen_port, LP} ->
 3394:                 ?P("listen port: ~p", [LP]),
 3395:                 LP
 3396:         end,
 3397:     ?P("[master] start client"),
 3398:     ClientF = 
 3399:       fun () ->
 3400:               ?P("[client] await (connect) server port"),
 3401:               Port =
 3402:                   receive
 3403:                       {Master, connect, P} ->
 3404:                           P
 3405:                   end,
 3406:               ?P("[client] connect to ~w", [Port]),
 3407: 	      case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port,
 3408:                             [binary,
 3409:                              {ip,     Addr},
 3410:                              {active, false},
 3411:                              {packet, 0},
 3412:                              {recbuf, 4096},
 3413:                              {sndbuf, 4096}]) of
 3414:                   {ok, Socket} ->
 3415:                       Master ! {self(), connected},
 3416:                       ?P("[client] connected - await recv"),
 3417:                       receive
 3418:                           {Master, recv, N} ->
 3419:                               ?P("[client] received recv:~w", [N]),
 3420:                               busy_send_client_loop(Socket, Master, Msg, N)
 3421:                       end;
 3422:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = CReason} ->
 3423:                       ?P("[client] UNEXPECTED: ~w", [CReason]),
 3424:                       ?SKIPE(connect_failed_str(CReason))
 3425:               end
 3426:       end,
 3427:     Client = spawn_link(ClientF),
 3428:     ?P("[master] client: ~p", [Client]),
 3429:     Server ! {self(), continue},
 3430:     Client ! {self(), connect, ListenPort},
 3431:     receive
 3432:         {Client, connected} ->
 3433:             ?P("[master] client connected"),
 3434:             ok
 3435:     end,
 3436:     busy_send_loop(Server, Client, 0),
 3437:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
 3438:     ?P("[master] done"),
 3439:     ok.
 3440: 
 3441: busy_send_loop(Server, Client, N) ->
 3442:     %% Master
 3443:     %%
 3444:     receive
 3445:         {Server, send} ->
 3446:             busy_send_loop(Server, Client, N+1)
 3447: 
 3448:     after 2000 ->
 3449:             ?P("[master] send timeout: server send queue full (N = ~w+1)", [N]),
 3450:             %% Send queue full, sender blocked 
 3451:             %% -> stop sender and release client
 3452:             Server ! {self(), close},
 3453:             Client ! {self(), recv, N+1},
 3454:             ?P("[master] await server 'send'..."),
 3455:             receive
 3456:                 {Server, send} ->
 3457:                     busy_send_2(Server, Client, N+1)
 3458:             after 10000 ->
 3459:                     %% If this happens, see busy_send_srv
 3460:                     ?P("[master] UNEXPECTED: server send timeout"),
 3461:                     ct:fail({timeout,{server,not_send,flush([])}})
 3462:             end
 3463:     end.
 3464: 
 3465: busy_send_2(Server, Client, _N) ->
 3466:     %% Master
 3467:     %%
 3468:     ?P("[master] await (server) closed"),
 3469:     receive
 3470:         {Server, [closed]} ->
 3471:             ?P("[master] received expected (server) closed - "
 3472:                "await client closed"),
 3473:             receive
 3474:                 {Client, [0,{error,closed}]} ->
 3475:                     ?P("[master] received expected (client) closed"),
 3476:                     ok
 3477:             end
 3478:     after 10000 ->
 3479:             ?P("[master] UNEXPECTED: server closed timeout"),
 3480:             ct:fail({timeout, {server, not_closed, flush([])}})
 3481:     end.
 3482: 
 3483: busy_send_srv(L, Master, Msg) ->
 3484:     %% Server
 3485:     %% Sometimes this accept does not return, do not really know why
 3486:     %% but it causes the timeout error in busy_send_loop to be
 3487:     %% triggered. Only happens on OS X Leopard?!?
 3488:     ?P("[server] try accept"),
 3489:     case gen_tcp:accept(L) of
 3490:         {ok, Socket} ->
 3491:             ?P("[server] accepted"),
 3492:             busy_send_srv_loop(Socket, Master, Msg);
 3493:         {error, Reason} ->
 3494:             ?P("UNEXPECTED: server accept failure: ~p", [Reason]),
 3495:             ?SKIPE(accept_failed_str(Reason))
 3496:     end.
 3497: 
 3498: busy_send_srv_loop(Socket, Master, Msg) ->
 3499:     %% Server
 3500:     %%
 3501:     receive
 3502: 	{Master, close} ->
 3503:             ?P("[server] received close"),
 3504: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(Socket),
 3505: 	    Master ! {self(),flush([closed])}
 3506:     after 0 ->
 3507: 	    ok = gen_tcp:send(Socket, Msg),
 3508: 	    Master ! {self(), send},
 3509: 	    busy_send_srv_loop(Socket, Master, Msg)
 3510:     end.
 3511: 
 3512: busy_send_client_loop(Socket, Master, Msg, N) ->
 3513:     %% Client
 3514:     %%
 3515:     Size = byte_size(Msg),
 3516:     case gen_tcp:recv(Socket, Size) of
 3517: 	{ok, Msg} ->
 3518: 	    busy_send_client_loop(Socket, Master, Msg, N-1);
 3519: 	Other ->
 3520:             ?P("[client] recv response: "
 3521:                "~n      ~p", [Other]),
 3522: 	    Master ! {self(), flush([Other,N])}
 3523:     end.
 3524: 
 3525: %%%
 3526: %%% Send to a socket whose other end does not read until the port gets busy.
 3527: %%% Then close the other end. The writer should get an {error,closed} error.
 3528: %%% (Passive mode.)
 3529: %%%
 3530: 
 3531: busy_disconnect_passive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3532:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 3533:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 3534:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 3535:                             Addr;
 3536:                         {error, Reason} ->
 3537:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 3538:                     end
 3539:            end,
 3540:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_busy_disconnect_passive(Config, Addr) end,
 3541:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3542:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 3543: 
 3544: do_busy_disconnect_passive(Config, Addr) ->
 3545:     ?P("[passive] begin"),
 3546:     MuchoData = list_to_binary(ones(64*1024)),
 3547:     [do_busy_disconnect_passive2(Config, Addr, MuchoData, N) ||
 3548:         N <- lists:seq(1, 10)],
 3549:     ?P("[passive] done"),
 3550:     ok.
 3551: 
 3552: do_busy_disconnect_passive2(Config, Addr, MuchoData, N) ->
 3553:     ?P("[passive,~w] *** prepare server *** ", [N]),
 3554:     {_Server, S} = busy_disconnect_prepare_server(Config, Addr, [{active,false}]),
 3555:     ?P("[passive,~w] server prepared - start sending", [N]),
 3556:     {_OSFam, OSName} = os:type(),
 3557:     busy_disconnect_passive_send(S, MuchoData, OSName).
 3558: 
 3559: busy_disconnect_passive_send(S, Data, OS) ->
 3560:     case gen_tcp:send(S, Data) of
 3561: 	ok ->
 3562:             busy_disconnect_passive_send(S, Data, OS);
 3563: 	{error, closed} ->
 3564:             ok;
 3565: 	{error, eprototype = Reason} when (OS =:= darwin) ->
 3566: 	    ?P("send failed with ~w", [Reason]),
 3567:             ok
 3568:     end.
 3569: 
 3570: %%%
 3571: %%% Send to a socket whose other end does not read until the port gets busy.
 3572: %%% Then close the other end. The writer should get an {error,closed} error and
 3573: %%% a {tcp_closed,Socket} message. (Active mode.)
 3574: %%%
 3575: busy_disconnect_active(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3576:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 3577:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 3578:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 3579:                             Addr;
 3580:                         {error, Reason} ->
 3581:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 3582:                     end
 3583:            end,
 3584:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_busy_disconnect_active(Config, Addr) end,
 3585:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3586:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 3587: 
 3588: do_busy_disconnect_active(Config, Addr) ->
 3589:     ?P("[active] begin"),
 3590:     MuchoData = list_to_binary(ones(64*1024)),
 3591:     [do_busy_disconnect_active2(Config, Addr, MuchoData, N) ||
 3592:         N <- lists:seq(1, 10)],
 3593:     ?P("[active] done"),
 3594:     ok.
 3595: 
 3596: do_busy_disconnect_active2(Config, Addr, MuchoData, N) ->
 3597:     ?P("[active,~w] *** prepare server *** ", [N]),
 3598:     {Server, S} = busy_disconnect_prepare_server(Config, Addr, [{active,true}]),
 3599:     ?P("[active,~w] server prepared - start sending", [N]),
 3600:     busy_disconnect_active_send(Server, S, MuchoData).
 3601: 
 3602: busy_disconnect_active_send(Server, S, Data) ->
 3603:     {_OSFam, OSName} = os:type(),
 3604:     busy_disconnect_active_send(Server, S, Data, 1, OSName).
 3605: 
 3606: busy_disconnect_active_send(Server, S, Data, Iter, OS) ->
 3607:     case gen_tcp:send(S, Data) of
 3608: 	ok ->
 3609:             busy_disconnect_active_send(Server, S, Data, Iter+1, OS);
 3610: 	{error, closed} ->
 3611:             ?P("[active-sender,~w] send failed with closed - await tcp-closed",
 3612: 	       [Iter]),
 3613:             busy_disconnect_active_send_await_closed(Server, S);
 3614: 
 3615: 	{error, eprototype = Reason} when (OS =:= darwin) ->
 3616:             ?P("[active-sender,~w] send failed with ~w - await tcp-closed",
 3617: 	       [Iter, Reason]),
 3618:             busy_disconnect_active_send_await_closed(Server, S);
 3619: 
 3620:         {error, einval = Reason} ->
 3621:             ?P("[active-sender,~w] UNEXPECTED send failure:"
 3622:                "~n   ~p", [Iter, Reason]),
 3623:             ?SKIPT(send_failed_str(Reason));
 3624: 
 3625:         {error, Reason} ->
 3626:             ?P("[active-sender,~w] UNEXPECTED send failure:"
 3627:                "~n   ~p", [Iter, Reason]),
 3628:             ct:fail({unexpected_send_result, Reason, Iter})
 3629:     end.
 3630: 
 3631: busy_disconnect_active_send_await_closed(Server, S) ->
 3632:     busy_disconnect_active_send_await_closed(Server, S, false, false).
 3633: busy_disconnect_active_send_await_closed(Server, S, Closed, Stopped) ->
 3634:     receive
 3635:         {tcp_closed, S} when (Stopped =:= true) ->
 3636:             ?P("[active-sender] received tcp-closed - done"),
 3637:             ok;
 3638: 
 3639:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
 3640:             ?P("[active-sender] received tcp-closed"),
 3641:             busy_disconnect_active_send_await_closed(Server, S, true, Stopped);
 3642: 
 3643:         {'EXIT', Server, normal} when (Closed =:= true) ->
 3644:             ?P("[active-sender] received server (normal) exit - done"),
 3645:             ok;
 3646: 
 3647:         {'EXIT', Server, normal} ->
 3648:             ?P("[active-sender] received server (normal) exit"),
 3649:             busy_disconnect_active_send_await_closed(Server, S, Closed, true);
 3650: 
 3651:         Other ->
 3652:             ?P("[active-sender] received UNEXPECTED message:"
 3653:                "~n   Expected tcp-close of ~p"
 3654:                "~n   Server:               ~p"
 3655:                "~n   Unexpected message:   ~p", [S, Server, Other]),
 3656:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other, S, flush([])})
 3657:     end.
 3658:     
 3659: 
 3660: busy_disconnect_prepare_server(Config, Addr, ConnectOpts) ->
 3661:     Sender = self(),
 3662:     ?P("[prep-server] create server"),
 3663:     Server = spawn_link(fun() ->
 3664:                                 busy_disconnect_server(Config, Addr, Sender)
 3665:                         end),
 3666:     ?P("[prep-server] await port (from server)"),
 3667:     receive {port, Server, Port} -> ok end,
 3668:     ?P("[prep-server] connect to ~w", [Port]),
 3669:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr} | ConnectOpts]) of
 3670:         {ok, S} ->
 3671:             ?P("[prep-server] connected - order server start sending"),
 3672:             Server ! {Sender, sending},
 3673:             ?P("[prep-server] done"),
 3674:             {Server, S};
 3675:         {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 3676:             ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 3677:     end.
 3678: 
 3679: busy_disconnect_server(Config, Addr, Sender) ->
 3680:     ?P("[server] create listen socket"),
 3681:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0,
 3682:                       [binary,
 3683:                        {ip,        Addr},
 3684:                        {active,    false},
 3685:                        {reuseaddr, true},
 3686:                        {packet,    0}]),
 3687:     ?P("[server] created - get port number"),
 3688:     {ok,Port} = inet:port(L),
 3689:     ?P("[server] send port ~w (to sender)", [Port]),
 3690:     Sender ! {port,self(),Port},
 3691:     ?P("[server] try accept"),
 3692:     {ok,S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 3693:     ?P("[server] connection accepted"),
 3694:     receive
 3695: 	{Sender, sending} ->
 3696:             ?P("[server] received sending (from sender)"),
 3697: 	    busy_disconnect_server_wait_for_busy(Sender, S)
 3698:     end.
 3699: 
 3700: %% Close the socket as soon as the Sender process can't send because of
 3701: %% a busy port.
 3702: busy_disconnect_server_wait_for_busy(Sender, S) ->
 3703:     case process_info(Sender, status) of
 3704: 	{status, waiting = Status} ->
 3705: 	    %% We KNOW that the sender will be in state 'waiting' only
 3706: 	    %% if the port has become busy. (Fallback solution if the
 3707: 	    %% implementation changes: Watch Sender's reduction count;
 3708: 	    %% when it stops changing, wait 2 seconds and then close.)
 3709: 	    ?P("[server] sender status ~p => close socket", [Status]),
 3710: 	    gen_tcp:close(S);
 3711: 	{status, Status} ->
 3712: 	    ?P("[server] sender status ~p", [Status]),
 3713: 	    timer:sleep(100),
 3714: 	    busy_disconnect_server_wait_for_busy(Sender, S);
 3715: 	Other ->
 3716: 	    ?P("[server] sender status ~p", [Other]),
 3717: 	    timer:sleep(100),
 3718: 	    busy_disconnect_server_wait_for_busy(Sender, S)
 3719:     end.
 3720: 
 3721: 
 3722: %%%
 3723: %%% Fill send queue
 3724: %%%
 3725: fill_sendq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3726:     Cond = fun() ->
 3727: 		   is_windows() andalso ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) andalso
 3728: 		       skip("Unstable for 'socket on Windows'"),
 3729: 		   ok
 3730: 	   end,
 3731:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 3732:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 3733:                             Addr;
 3734:                         {error, Reason} ->
 3735:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 3736:                     end
 3737:            end,
 3738:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_fill_sendq(Config, Addr) end,
 3739:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3740:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 3741: 
 3742: do_fill_sendq(Config, Addr) ->
 3743:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3744:     Master  = self(),
 3745:     ServerF =
 3746:         fun () ->
 3747:                 ?P("[server] try listen"),
 3748:                 case ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr},
 3749:                                          {active,false},binary,
 3750:                                          {reuseaddr,true},{packet,0}]) of
 3751:                     {ok, L} ->
 3752:                         ?P("[server] try port"),
 3753:                         case inet:port(L) of
 3754:                             {ok, Port} ->
 3755:                                 Master ! {self(), listen_port, Port},
 3756:                                 fill_sendq_srv(L, Master);
 3757:                             {error, PReason} ->
 3758:                                 ?SKIPE(port_failed_str(PReason))
 3759:                         end;
 3760:                     {error, LReason} ->
 3761:                         ?SKIPE(listen_failed_str(LReason))
 3762:                 end
 3763:         end,
 3764:     Server  = spawn_link(ServerF),
 3765:     ?P("[master] server: ~p", [Server]),
 3766:     ClientF =
 3767:         fun () ->
 3768:                 ?P("[client] await server port"),
 3769:                 ServerPort =
 3770:                     receive
 3771:                         {Master, server_port, SP} ->
 3772:                             ?P("[client] server port: ~w", [SP]),
 3773:                             SP
 3774:                     end,
 3775:                 %% Just close on order
 3776:                 ?P("[client] try connect"),
 3777:                 case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, ServerPort,
 3778:                               [{ip, Addr}, {active,false},binary,{packet,0}]) of
 3779:                     {ok, S} ->
 3780:                         ?P("[client] connected"),
 3781:                         Master ! {self(), connected},
 3782:                         receive
 3783:                             {Master, close} ->
 3784:                                 ?P("[client] received close"),
 3785:                                 ok = gen_tcp:close(S)
 3786:                         end;
 3787:                     {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 3788:                         ?SKIPE(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 3789:                 end
 3790:         end,
 3791:     Client = spawn_link(ClientF),
 3792:     ?P("[master] client: ~p", [client]),
 3793:     ListenPort =
 3794:         receive
 3795:             {Server, listen_port, LP} ->
 3796:                 ?P("[master] listen port: ~w", [LP]),
 3797:                 LP
 3798:         end,
 3799:     Client ! {self(), server_port, ListenPort},
 3800:     ?P("[master] await client connected"),
 3801:     receive {Client, connected} -> ok end,
 3802:     ?P("[master] await reader"),
 3803:     Res = receive
 3804:               {Server, reader, Reader} ->
 3805:                   ?P("[master] reader: ~p", [Reader]),
 3806:                   fill_sendq_loop(Server, Client, Reader)
 3807:           end,
 3808:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),    
 3809:     ?P("[master] done"),
 3810:     Res.
 3811: 
 3812: fill_sendq_loop(Server, Client, Reader) ->
 3813:     %% Master
 3814:     %%
 3815:     receive
 3816:         {Server, send} ->
 3817: 	    fill_sendq_loop(Server, Client, Reader)
 3818:     after 2000 ->
 3819: 	    %% Send queue full, sender blocked -> close client.
 3820: 	    ?P("[master] send timeout, closing client"),
 3821: 	    Client ! {self(), close},
 3822: 	    receive
 3823:                 {Server, [{error,closed}] = SErrors} ->
 3824:                     ?P("[master] got expected server closed"),
 3825:                     receive
 3826:                         {Reader, [{error,closed}]} ->
 3827:                             ?P("[master] got expected reader closed"),
 3828:                             ok;
 3829:                         {Reader, RErrors} when is_list(RErrors) ->
 3830:                             ct:fail([{server, SErrors}, {reader, RErrors}])
 3831:                     after 3000 ->
 3832:                             ct:fail({timeout,{closed,reader}})
 3833:                     end;
 3834: 
 3835:                 {Server, SErrors} when is_list(SErrors) ->
 3836:                     ?P("UNEXPECTED SERVER ERROR(S): "
 3837:                        "~n   ~p"
 3838:                        "~n   ~p", [SErrors, flush([])]),
 3839:                     ct:fail([{server, SErrors}, {reader, []}]);
 3840: 
 3841:                 {Reader, [{error,closed}] = RErrors} ->
 3842:                     ?P("[master] got expected reader closed"),
 3843:                     receive
 3844:                         {Server, [{error,closed}]} ->
 3845:                             ?P("[master] got expected server closed"),
 3846:                             ok;
 3847:                         {Server, SErrors} when is_list(SErrors) ->
 3848:                             ct:fail([{server, SErrors}, {reader, RErrors}])
 3849:                     after 3000 ->
 3850:                             ct:fail({timeout,{closed,server}})
 3851:                     end;
 3852: 
 3853:                 {Reader, RErrors} when is_list(RErrors) ->
 3854:                     ?P("UNEXPECTED READER ERROR(S): "
 3855:                        "~n   ~p"
 3856:                        "~n   ~p", [RErrors, flush([])]),
 3857:                     ct:fail([{server, []}, {reader, RErrors}])
 3858: 
 3859:             after 3000 ->
 3860:                     Msgs = flush([]),
 3861:                     ct:fail({timeout,{closed,[server,reader]}, Msgs})
 3862:             end
 3863:     end.
 3864: 
 3865: fill_sendq_srv(L, Master) ->
 3866:     %% Server
 3867:     %%
 3868:     ?P("[server] await accept"),
 3869:     case gen_tcp:accept(L) of
 3870: 	{ok, S} ->
 3871:             ?P("[server] accepted ~p", [S]),
 3872: 	    Master ! {self(), reader,
 3873: 		      spawn_link(fun () -> fill_sendq_read(S, Master) end)},
 3874: 	    Msg = "the quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog~n",
 3875: 	    fill_sendq_write(S, Master, [Msg,Msg,Msg,Msg,Msg,Msg,Msg,Msg]);
 3876: 	E ->
 3877:             Error = flush([E]),
 3878: 	    ?P("[server] accept error: ~p", [E]),
 3879: 	    Master ! {self(), Error}
 3880:     end.
 3881: 
 3882: fill_sendq_write(S, Master, Msg) ->
 3883:     %% Server
 3884:     %%
 3885:     %% ?P("[server,writer] sending..."),
 3886:     case gen_tcp:send(S, Msg) of
 3887: 	ok ->
 3888:             Master ! {self(), send},
 3889: 	    %% ?P("[server,writer] ok."),
 3890: 	    fill_sendq_write(S, Master, Msg);
 3891: 	{error, _} = E ->
 3892: 	    Error = flush([E]),
 3893: 	    ?P("[server,writer] send error: ~p", [Error]),
 3894: 	    Master ! {self(), Error}
 3895:     end.
 3896: 
 3897: fill_sendq_read(S, Master) ->
 3898:     %% Reader
 3899:     %%
 3900:     ?P("[server,reader] read infinity..."),
 3901:     case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0, infinity) of
 3902: 	{ok, Data} ->
 3903: 	    ?P("[server,reader] recv: ~p", [Data]),
 3904: 	    fill_sendq_read(S, Master);
 3905: 	E ->
 3906: 	    Error = flush([E]),
 3907: 	    ?P("[server,reader] recv error: ~p", [Error]),
 3908: 	    Master ! {self(), Error}
 3909:     end.
 3910: 
 3911: 
 3912: %%% Try to receive more than available number of bytes from 
 3913: %%% a closed socket.
 3914: %%%
 3915: partial_recv_and_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3916:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 3917:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 3918:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 3919:                             Addr;
 3920:                         {error, Reason} ->
 3921:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 3922:                     end
 3923:            end,
 3924:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_partial_recv_and_close(Config, Addr) end,
 3925:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3926:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 3927: 
 3928: do_partial_recv_and_close(Config, Addr) ->
 3929:     Msg = "the quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog 0123456789\n",
 3930:     Len = length(Msg),
 3931:     {ok,L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,false}]),
 3932:     {ok,P} = inet:port(L),
 3933:     Sock =
 3934:         case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, P, [{ip, Addr}, {active,false}]) of
 3935:             {ok, S} ->
 3936:                 S;
 3937:         {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 3938:             ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 3939:     end,
 3940:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 3941:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, Msg),
 3942:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 3943:     %% inet:setopts(A, [{debug, true}]),
 3944:     case gen_tcp:recv(A, Len+1) of
 3945: 	{error, closed} ->
 3946: 	    %% inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),
 3947: 	    gen_tcp:close(A),
 3948: 	    ok;
 3949: 	{error, BadReason} ->
 3950: 	    ?P("unexpected failure (should be 'closed'): "
 3951: 	       "~n   ~p", [BadReason]),
 3952: 	    %% inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),
 3953: 	    gen_tcp:close(A),
 3954: 	    error;
 3955: 	{ok, Msg} ->
 3956: 	    ?P("unexpected success (with expected message): "
 3957: 	       "~n   ~p", [Msg]),
 3958: 	    %% inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),
 3959: 	    gen_tcp:close(A),
 3960: 	    error;
 3961: 	{ok, BadMsg} ->
 3962: 	    ?P("unexpected success (with unexpected message): "
 3963: 	       "~n   ~p", [BadMsg]),
 3964: 	    %% inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),
 3965: 	    gen_tcp:close(A),
 3966: 	    error
 3967:     end.
 3968: 
 3969: 
 3970: %%% Try to receive more than available number of bytes from 
 3971: %%% a closed socket, this time waiting in the recv before closing.
 3972: %%%
 3973: partial_recv_and_close_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3974:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 3975:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 3976:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 3977:                             Addr;
 3978:                         {error, Reason} ->
 3979:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 3980:                     end
 3981:            end,
 3982:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_partial_recv_and_close_2(Config, Addr) end,
 3983:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3984:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 3985: 
 3986: do_partial_recv_and_close_2(Config, Addr) ->
 3987:     Msg = "the quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog 0123456789\n",
 3988:     Len = length(Msg),
 3989:     {ok,L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,false}]),
 3990:     {ok,P} = inet:port(L),
 3991:     Server = self(),
 3992:     Client =
 3993: 	spawn_link(
 3994: 	  fun () ->
 3995: 		  receive after 2000 -> ok end,
 3996: 		  case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, P, [{ip, Addr}, {active,false}]) of
 3997:                       {ok, S} ->
 3998:                           ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Msg),
 3999:                           receive {Server,close} -> ok end,
 4000:                           receive after 2000 -> ok end,
 4001:                           ok = gen_tcp:close(S);
 4002:                       {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 4003:                           ?SKIPE(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 4004:                   end
 4005: 	  end),
 4006:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 4007:     Client ! {Server, close},
 4008:     %% {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(A, Len+1),
 4009:     %% inet:setopts(A, [{debug, true}]),
 4010:     case gen_tcp:recv(A, Len+1) of
 4011: 	{error, closed} ->
 4012: 	    %% inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),
 4013: 	    gen_tcp:close(A),
 4014: 	    ok;
 4015: 	{error, BadReason} ->
 4016: 	    ?P("unexpected failure (should be 'closed'): "
 4017: 	       "~n   ~p", [BadReason]),
 4018: 	    %% inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),
 4019: 	    gen_tcp:close(A),
 4020: 	    error;
 4021: 	{ok, Msg} ->
 4022: 	    ?P("unexpected success (with 'expected' message): "
 4023: 	       "~n   ~p", [Msg]),
 4024: 	    %% inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),
 4025: 	    gen_tcp:close(A),
 4026: 	    error;
 4027: 	{ok, BadMsg} ->
 4028: 	    ?P("unexpected success (with *unexpected* message): "
 4029: 	       "~n   ~p", [BadMsg]),
 4030: 	    %% inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),
 4031: 	    gen_tcp:close(A),
 4032: 	    error
 4033:     end.
 4034: 
 4035: %%% Here we tests that gen_tcp:recv/2 will return {error,closed} following
 4036: %%% a send operation of a huge amount data when the other end closed the socket.
 4037: %%%
 4038: partial_recv_and_close_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4039:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 4040:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 4041:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 4042:                             Addr;
 4043:                         {error, Reason} ->
 4044:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 4045:                     end
 4046:            end,
 4047:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_partial_recv_and_close_3(Config, Addr) end,
 4048:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 4049:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 4050: 
 4051: do_partial_recv_and_close_3(Config, Addr) ->
 4052:     [do_partial_recv_and_close_4(Config, Addr) || _ <- lists:seq(0, 20)],
 4053:     ok.
 4054: 
 4055: do_partial_recv_and_close_4(Config, Addr) ->
 4056:     Parent = self(),
 4057:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 4058: 		       {ok,L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0,
 4059:                                         [{ip, Addr}, {active,false}]),
 4060: 		       {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
 4061: 		       Parent ! {port,Port},
 4062: 		       {ok,S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 4063: 		       gen_tcp:recv(S, 1),
 4064: 		       gen_tcp:close(S)
 4065: 	       end),
 4066:     receive
 4067: 	{port,Port} -> ok
 4068:     end,
 4069:     Much = ones(8*64*1024),
 4070:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr}, {active, false}]) of
 4071:             {ok, Sock} ->
 4072:                 Sock;
 4073:         {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 4074:             ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 4075:     end,
 4076: 
 4077:     %% Send a lot of data (most of it will be queued).
 4078:     %% The receiver will read one byte and close the connection.
 4079:     %% The write operation will fail.
 4080:     gen_tcp:send(S, Much),
 4081: 
 4082:     %% We should always get {error,closed} here.
 4083:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(S, 0).
 4084:

 4086: test_prio_put_get(Config, Addr) ->
 4087:     Tos = 3 bsl 5,
 4088:     ?P("test_prio_put_get -> create listen socket"),
 4089:     {ok,L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,false}]),
 4090:     ?P("test_prio_put_get -> set opts prio (= 3)"),
 4091:     ok = inet:setopts(L1,[{priority,3}]),
 4092:     ?P("test_prio_put_get -> set opts tos (= ~p)", [Tos]),
 4093:     ok = inet:setopts(L1,[{tos,Tos}]),
 4094:     ?P("test_prio_put_get -> verify opts prio and tos"),
 4095:     {ok,[{priority,3},{tos,Tos}]} = inet:getopts(L1,[priority,tos]),
 4096:     ?P("test_prio_put_get -> set opts prio (= 3)"),
 4097:     ok = inet:setopts(L1,[{priority,3}]), % Dont destroy each other
 4098:     ?P("test_prio_put_get -> verify opts prio and tos"),
 4099:     {ok,[{priority,3},{tos,Tos}]} = inet:getopts(L1,[priority,tos]),
 4100:     ?P("test_prio_put_get -> set opts reuseaddr (= true)"),
 4101:     ok = inet:setopts(L1,[{reuseaddr,true}]), % Dont let others destroy
 4102:     ?P("test_prio_put_get -> verify opts prio and tos"),
 4103:     {ok,[{priority,3},{tos,Tos}]} = inet:getopts(L1,[priority,tos]),
 4104:     ?P("test_prio_put_get -> close listen socket"),
 4105:     gen_tcp:close(L1),
 4106:     ?P("test_prio_put_get -> done"),
 4107:     ok.
 4108: 
 4109: test_prio_accept(Config, Addr) ->
 4110:     ?P("test_prio_accept -> create listen socket"),
 4111:     {ok, Sock} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {packet,0},{active,false},
 4112:                                      {reuseaddr,true},{priority,4}]),
 4113:     ?P("test_prio_accept -> get port number of listen socket"),
 4114:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(Sock),
 4115:     ?P("test_prio_accept -> connect to port ~p", [Port]),
 4116:     Sock2 = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [binary,
 4117:                                                {ip, Addr},
 4118:                                                {packet,0},
 4119:                                                {active,false},
 4120:                                                {reuseaddr,true},
 4121:                                                {priority,4}]) of
 4122:                 {ok, S2} -> 
 4123:                     S2;
 4124:                 {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 4125:                     ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 4126:             end,
 4127:     ?P("test_prio_accept -> connected => accept connection"),
 4128:     {ok, Sock3} = gen_tcp:accept(Sock),
 4129:     ?P("test_prio_accept -> accepted => getopts prio for listen socket"),
 4130:     {ok, [{priority,4}]} = inet:getopts(Sock,  [priority]),
 4131:     ?P("test_prio_accept -> getopts prio for connected socket"),
 4132:     {ok, [{priority,4}]} = inet:getopts(Sock2, [priority]),
 4133:     ?P("test_prio_accept -> getopts prio for accepted socket"),
 4134:     {ok, [{priority,4}]} = inet:getopts(Sock3, [priority]),
 4135:     ?P("test_prio_accept -> close listen socket"),
 4136:     gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 4137:     ?P("test_prio_accept -> close connected socket"),
 4138:     gen_tcp:close(Sock2),
 4139:     ?P("test_prio_accept -> close accepted socket"),
 4140:     gen_tcp:close(Sock3),
 4141:     ?P("test_prio_accept -> done"),
 4142:     ok.
 4143: 
 4144: test_prio_accept2(Config, Addr) ->
 4145:     Tos1 = 4 bsl 5,
 4146:     Tos2 = 3 bsl 5,
 4147:     ?P("test_prio_accept2 -> create listen socket"),
 4148:     {ok, Sock} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {packet,0},{active,false},
 4149:                                     {reuseaddr,true},{priority,4},
