 6348:                            case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
 6349:                                {value, {Key, Factor}} when (Factor > 6) ->
 6350:                                    {skip,
 6351:                                     ?F("Too slow (factor = ~w)", [Factor])};
 6352:                                _ ->
 6353:                                    ok
 6354:                            end
 6355:                    end
 6356:            end,
 6357:     Pre  = fun() ->
 6358:                    Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 6359:                    ?P("create node"),
 6360:                    {ok, RNode} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME, "-pa " ++ Dir),
 6361: 		   {ok, Addr}  = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
 6362:                    #{addr => Addr, rnode => RNode}
 6363:            end,
 6364:     Case = fun(#{addr := Addr, rnode := Node}) ->
 6365:                    do_send_timeout_para_w_autoclose(Config, Addr, Node)
 6366:            end,
 6367:     Post = fun(#{rnode := Node}) ->
 6368:                    ?P("stop node ~p", [Node]),
 6369:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)
 6370:            end,
 6371:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 6372: 
 6373: do_send_timeout_para_w_autoclose(Config, Addr, RNode) ->
 6374:     ?P("begin"),
 6375:     {TslTimeout, SndTimeout, BinData, SndBuf} =
 6376:         send_timeout_cfg(Config, send_timeout_para_w_autoclose),
 6377: 
 6378:     %% Check that parallel writers do not hang forever
 6379:     ?P("check parallel writers wo autoclose"),
 6380:     send_timeout_para(Config, Addr, BinData, SndBuf, TslTimeout, SndTimeout,
 6381: 		      true, RNode),
 6382: 
 6383:     ?P("done"),
 6384:     ok.
 6385: 
 6386: send_timeout_para(Config, Addr, BinData, BufSz, TslTimeout, SndTimeout,
 6387: 		  AutoClose, RNode) ->
 6388:     ?P("[para] sink -> entry with"
 6389:        "~n      size(BinData): ~p"
 6390:        "~n      BufSz:         ~p"
 6391:        "~n      SndTimeout:    ~p"
 6392:        "~n      AutoClose:     ~p",
 6393:        [byte_size(BinData), BufSz, SndTimeout, AutoClose]),
 6394:     {A, Pid} = setup_timeout_sink(Config, RNode,
 6395:                                   Addr, SndTimeout, AutoClose, BufSz),
 6396:     Self = self(),
 6397:     SenderFun = fun() ->
 6398:                         ?P("[para:sender] starting"),
 6399: 			Send = fun() -> gen_tcp:send(A, BinData) end,
 6400: 			Self ! {self(), timeout_sink_loop(Send, TslTimeout)}
 6401: 		end,
 6402:     ?P("[para] spawn sender process 1"),
 6403:     Snd1 = spawn_link(SenderFun),
 6404:     ?P("[para] spawn sender process 2"),
 6405:     Snd2 = spawn_link(SenderFun),
 6406: 
 6407:     SockInfo    = fun() -> (catch inet:info(A)) end,
 6408:     SockTimeout = fun() ->
 6409:                           try inet:getopts(A, [send_timeout]) of
 6410:                               {ok, [V2]} ->
 6411:                                   V2;
 6412:                               {error, R2} ->
 6413:                                   ?F("ERROR: ~p", [R2]);
 6414:                               X2 ->
 6415:                                   ?F("UNKNOWN: ~p", [X2])
 6416:                           catch
 6417:                               C2:E2:S2 ->
 6418:                                   ?F("CAUGHT: ~p, ~p, ~p", [C2, E2, S2])
 6419:                           end
 6420:                   end,
 6421: 
 6422:     ?P("[para] await first sender timeout when"
 6423:        "~n   Sender 1: ~p"
 6424:        "~n   Sender 2: ~p", [Snd1, Snd2]),
 6425:     First =
 6426:         receive
 6427:             {Snd1, {{error, timeout}, N}} ->
 6428:                 ?P("[para] timeout received from sender 1 (~p, ~p)", [Snd1, N]),
 6429:                 1;
 6430:             {Snd2, {{error, timeout}, N}} ->
 6431:                 ?P("[para] timeout received from sender 2 (~p, ~p)", [Snd2, N]),
 6432:                 2;
 6433: 
 6434:             {'EXIT', _Pid, {timetrap_timeout, _Timeout, _Stack}} ->
 6435:                 %% The test case (timetrap) has timed out, which either means
 6436:                 %% we are running on very slow hw or some system functions
 6437:                 %% are slowing us down (this test case should never normally
 6438:                 %% time out like this).
 6439:                 ?P("Test case timetrap timeout - check for system events"),
 6440:                 case kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events(?SECS(5)) of
 6441:                     SysEvs when (SysEvs =/= []) ->
 6442:                         ?P("timetrap timeout with system events: "
 6443:                            "~n   System Events: ~p"
 6444:                            "~n   Sender 1 Info: ~p"
 6445:                            "~n   Sender 2 Info: ~p"
 6446:                            "~n   Socket Info:   ~p",
 6447:                            [SysEvs,
 6448:                             process_info(Snd1), process_info(Snd2),
 6449:                             SockInfo()]),
 6450:                         ?SKIPT(?F("TC system ~w events", [length(SysEvs)]));
 6451:                     {error, Reason} ->
 6452:                         ?P("TC timetrap timeout but failed get system events: "
 6453:                            "~n   Reason:        ~p"
 6454:                            "~n   Sender 1 Info: ~p"
 6455:                            "~n   Sender 2 Info: ~p"
 6456:                            "~n   Socket Info:   ~p",
 6457:                            [Reason,
 6458:                             process_info(Snd1), process_info(Snd2),
 6459:                             SockInfo()]),
 6460:                         exit({timetrap, {failed_get_sys_evs, Reason}});
 6461:                     [] ->
 6462:                         ?P("TC timetrap *without* system events: "
 6463:                            "~n   Sender 1 Info: ~p"
 6464:                            "~n   Sender 2 Info: ~p"
 6465:                            "~n   Socket Info:   ~p",
 6466:                            [process_info(Snd1), process_info(Snd2),
 6467:                             SockInfo()]),
 6468:                         exit(timetrap)
 6469:                 end
 6470: 
 6471:         after 20000 ->
 6472:                 SockInfo1 = SockInfo(),
 6473:                 SockTo1   = SockTimeout(),
 6474:                 ?P("[para] UNEXPECTED timeout(1,~w) when:"
 6475:                    "~n   Sender 1 Info: ~p"
 6476:                    "~n   Sender 2 Info: ~p"
 6477:                    "~n   Socket Info:   ~p"
 6478:                    "~n   Send Timeout:  ~p"
 6479:                    "~n   Message Queue: ~p",
 6480:                    [AutoClose,
 6481:                     (catch process_info(Snd1)),
 6482:                     (catch process_info(Snd2)),
 6483:                     SockInfo1, SockTo1,
 6484:                     flush([])]),
 6485:                 Snd1 ! {info_and_die, SockInfo, SockTimeout},
 6486:                 Snd2 ! {info_and_die, SockInfo, SockTimeout},
 6487:                 ct:sleep(?SECS(1)),
 6488:                 exit({timeout, AutoClose})
 6489:         end,
 6490: 
 6491:     Second = if (First =:= 1) -> 2; true -> 1 end,
 6492:     ?P("[para] await second sender ~w error", [Second]),
 6493:     receive
 6494: 	{Snd1, {{error, Error_1}, N_1}} ->
 6495:             ?P("[para] error (~p) received from sender 1 (~p, ~p)",
 6496:                [Error_1, Snd1, N_1]),
 6497:             after_send_timeout(AutoClose, Error_1);
 6498: 	{Snd2, {{error, Error_1}, N_1}} ->
 6499:             ?P("[para] error (~p) received from sender 2 (~p, ~p)",
 6500:                [Error_1, Snd2, N_1]),
 6501:             after_send_timeout(AutoClose, Error_1)
 6502:     after 10000 ->
 6503:             if (Second =:= 1) ->
 6504:                     SockInfo21 = SockInfo(),
 6505:                     SockTo21   = SockTimeout(),
 6506:                     ?P("[para] UNEXPECTED timeout(2, ~w):"
 6507:                        "~n   Sender 1 Info: ~p"
 6508:                        "~n   Socket Info:   ~p"
 6509:                        "~n   Send Timeout:  ~p"
 6510:                        "~n   Message Queue: ~p",
 6511:                        [AutoClose,
 6512:                         (catch process_info(Snd1)),
 6513:                         SockInfo21, SockTo21,
 6514:                         flush([])]),
 6515:                 Snd1 ! {info_and_die, SockInfo, SockTimeout};
 6516:                true ->
 6517:                     SockInfo22 = SockInfo(),
 6518:                     SockTo22   = SockTimeout(),
 6519:                     ?P("[para] UNEXPECTED timeout(2, ~w):"
 6520:                        "~n   Sender 2 Info: ~p"
 6521:                        "~n   Socket Info:   ~p"
 6522:                        "~n   Send Timeout:  ~p"
 6523:                        "~n   Message Queue: ~p",
 6524:                        [AutoClose,
 6525:                         (catch process_info(Snd2)),
 6526:                         SockInfo22, SockTo22,
 6527:                         flush([])]),
 6528:                     Snd2 ! {info_and_die, SockInfo, SockTimeout}
 6529:             end,
 6530:             ct:sleep(?SECS(1)),
 6531: 	    exit({timeout, AutoClose, Second})
 6532:     end,
 6533: 
 6534:     ?P("[para] socket info: "
 6535:        "~n   ~p", [SockInfo()]),
 6536:     {error, Error_2} = gen_tcp:send(A, BinData),
 6537:     after_send_timeout(AutoClose, Error_2),
 6538:     ?P("[para] cleanup - await sender terminations"),
 6539:     st_await_sender_termination(Snd1, Snd2),
 6540:     ?P("[para] cleanup - close socket"),
 6541:     send_timeout_close(A),
 6542:     ?P("[para] cleanup - kill sink"),
 6543:     exit(Pid, kill),
 6544:     ?P("[para] done"),
 6545:     ok.
 6546: 
 6547: %% Spawn a closer process, transfer "ownership" of the socket
 6548: %% to it and then send it the socket (to close) at its leisure.
 6549: send_timeout_close(Sock) ->
 6550:     F = fun() ->
 6551:                 receive
 6552:                     {close, S} ->
 6553:                         (catch gen_tcp:close(S)),
 6554:                         exit(normal)
 6555:                 end
 6556:         end,
 6557:     Pid = spawn_link(F),
 6558:     case gen_tcp:controlling_process(Sock, Pid) of
 6559:         ok ->
 6560:             Pid ! {close, Sock},
 6561:             ok;
 6562:         {error, Reason} ->
 6563:             ?P("failed transfering ownership to closer process: "
 6564:                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6565:             exit(Pid, kill),
 6566:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Sock))
 6567:     end.
 6568:     
 6569: st_await_sender_termination(undefined, undefined) ->
 6570:     ok;
 6571: st_await_sender_termination(Sender1, Sender2) ->
 6572:     receive
 6573:         {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} when (Pid =:= Sender1) ->
 6574:             ?P("sender 1 (~p) terminated: "
 6575:                "~n   ~p", [Pid, Reason]),
 6576:             st_await_sender_termination(undefined, Sender2);
 6577:         {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} when (Pid =:= Sender2) ->
 6578:             ?P("sender 2 (~p) terminated: "
 6579:                "~n   ~p", [Pid, Reason]),
 6580:             st_await_sender_termination(Sender1, undefined)
 6581:     end.
 6582:             
 6583: get_max_diff(Pid) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 6584:     receive
 6585: 	ok ->
 6586: 	    get_max_diff2(0)
 6587:     after 10000 ->
 6588:             ?P("timeout awaiting first send result (ok) from sender ~p:"
 6589:                "~n   Sender process info: ~p",
 6590:                [Pid, pi(Pid)]),
 6591: 	    exit(timeout)
 6592:     end.
 6593: 
 6594: get_max_diff2(Max) ->
 6595:     T1 = millis(),
 6596:     receive
 6597: 	ok ->
 6598: 	    Diff = millis() - T1,
 6599: 	    if
 6600: 		Diff > Max ->
 6601: 		    ?P("new max send time: ~w", [Diff]),
 6602: 		    get_max_diff2(Diff);
 6603: 		true ->
 6604: 		    get_max_diff2(Max)
 6605: 	    end;
 6606: 	{error, timeout} ->
 6607: 	    Diff = millis() - T1,
 6608: 	    if
 6609: 		Diff > Max ->
 6610: 		    ?P("timeout diff (> prev max send to): ~w", [Diff]),
 6611: 		    Diff;
 6612: 		true ->
 6613: 		    Max
 6614: 	    end
 6615:     after 10000 ->
 6616:               exit(timeout)
 6617:     end.
 6618: 	    
 6619: after_send_timeout(AutoClose, Reason) ->
 6620:     case Reason of
 6621:         timeout              when AutoClose =:= false -> ok;
 6622:         {timeout, _RestData} when AutoClose =:= false -> ok;
 6623:         enotconn             when AutoClose =:= true  -> ok;
 6624: 	closed               when AutoClose           -> ok;
 6625:         _ ->
 6626:             ?P("after_send_timeout -> "
 6627:                "~n      AutoClose: ~w"
 6628:                "~n      Reason:    ~p", [AutoClose, Reason]),
 6629:             exit({after_send_timeout, AutoClose, Reason})
 6630:     end.
 6631: 
 6632: 
 6633: %% Test the send_timeout socket option for active sockets.
 6634: send_timeout_active(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6635:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 6636:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 6637:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 6638:                             Addr;
 6639:                         {error, Reason} ->
 6640:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 6641:                     end
 6642:            end,
 6643:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_send_timeout_active(Config, Addr) end,
 6644:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 6645:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 6646: 
 6647: do_send_timeout_active(Config, Addr) ->
 6648:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 6649:     {ok, RNode} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME, "-pa " ++ Dir),
 6650:     do_send_timeout_active(Config, Addr, false, RNode),
 6651:     do_send_timeout_active(Config, Addr, true, RNode),
 6652:     ?STOP_NODE(RNode),
 6653:     ok.
 6654: 
 6655: do_send_timeout_active(Config, Addr, AutoClose, RNode) ->
 6656:     {A,C} = setup_active_timeout_sink(Config, RNode, Addr, 1, AutoClose),
 6657:     inet:setopts(A, [{active, once}]),
 6658:     Mad = spawn_link(RNode, fun() -> mad_sender(C) end),
 6659:     ListData = lists:duplicate(1000, $a),
 6660:     F = fun() ->
 6661:                 ?P("[sink action] await data"),
 6662: 		receive
 6663: 		    {tcp, _Sock, _Data} ->
 6664:                         ?P("[sink action] active -> once"),
 6665: 			inet:setopts(A, [{active, once}]),
 6666:                         ?P("[sink action] send payload"),
 6667: 			Res = gen_tcp:send(A, ListData),
 6668: 			Res;
 6669: 		    Unexpected ->
 6670: 			?P("[sink action] unexpected message: "
 6671:                            "~n      ~p", [Unexpected]),
 6672: 			Unexpected
 6673: 		end
 6674: 	end,
 6675:     {{error, timeout}, _} = timeout_sink_loop(F, 1),
 6676:     unlink(Mad),
 6677:     exit(Mad, kill),
 6678:     flush(),
 6679:     ok.
 6680: 
 6681: mad_sender(S) ->
 6682:     put(action,  nothing),
 6683:     put(sent,    0),
 6684:     put(elapsed, 0),
 6685:     mad_sender(S, 0).
 6686: 
 6687: mad_sender(S, N) ->
 6688:     U = rand:uniform(1000000),
 6689:     put(action, send),
 6690:     Start   = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 6691:     Ret     = gen_tcp:send(S, integer_to_list(U)),
 6692:     Stop    = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 6693:     Elapsed = get(elapsed),
 6694:     put(elapsed, Elapsed + (Stop - Start)),
 6695:     put(action, sent),
 6696:     N2 = N + 1,
 6697:     put(sent,   N2),
 6698:     case Ret of
 6699:         ok ->
 6700:             mad_sender(S, N + 1);
 6701:         {error, timeout} = ERROR1 ->
 6702:             ?P("mad_sender -> send failed: timeout"
 6703:                "~n   Number of sends:     ~w"
 6704:                "~n   Elapsed (send) time: ~w msec",
 6705:                [N2,
 6706:                 erlang:convert_time_unit(get(elapsed), native, millisecond)]),
 6707:             ERROR1;
 6708:         {error, {timeout, RestData}} = ERROR2 ->
 6709:             ?P("mad_sender -> "
 6710:                "send failed: timeout with ~w bytes of rest data"
 6711:                "~n   Number of sends:     ~w"
 6712:                "~n   Elapsed (send) time: ~w msec",
 6713:                [byte_size(RestData),
 6714:                 N2,
 6715:                 erlang:convert_time_unit(get(elapsed), native, millisecond)]),
 6716:             ERROR2;
 6717:         {error, Reason} = ERROR3 ->
 6718:             ?P("mad_sender -> send failed: "
 6719:                "~n   ~p"
 6720:                "~n   Number of sends:     ~w"
 6721:                "~n   Elapsed (send) time: ~w msec",
 6722:                [Reason,
 6723:                 N2,
 6724:                 erlang:convert_time_unit(get(elapsed), native, millisecond)]),
 6725:             ERROR3;
 6726:         ERROR4 ->
 6727:             ?P("mad_sender -> send failed: "
 6728:                "~n   ~p"
 6729:                "~n   Number of sends:     ~w"
 6730:                "~n   Elapsed (send) time: ~w msec",
 6731:                [ERROR4,
 6732:                 N2,
 6733:                 erlang:convert_time_unit(get(elapsed), native, millisecond)]),
 6734:             ERROR4
 6735:     end.
 6736: 
 6737: flush() ->
 6738:     receive
 6739: 	_X ->
 6740: 	    flush()
 6741:     after 0 ->
 6742: 	    ok
 6743:     end.
 6744: 
 6745: setup_closed_ao(Config, Addr) ->
 6746:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 6747:     ?P("[setup] start node"),
 6748:     R = case ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME, "-pa " ++ Dir) of
 6749:             {ok, Node} ->
 6750:                 Node;
 6751:             {error, Reason} ->
 6752:                 ?SKIPT(?F("failed starting node: ~p", [Reason]))
 6753:         end,
 6754:     ?P("[setup] get (\"proper\")local address"),
 6755:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 6756:     Host = get_hostname(node()),
 6757:     ?P("[setup] create listen socket (with ~p)", [Addr]),
 6758:     L = case ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,false},{packet,2}]) of
 6759:             {ok, LSock} ->
 6760:                 LSock;
 6761:             {error, eaddrnotavail = LReason} ->
 6762:                 (catch ?STOP_NODE(R)),
 6763:                 ?SKIPT(listen_failed_str(LReason))
 6764:         end,
 6765:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 6766:     ?P("[setup] listen socket port: "
 6767:        "~n   Port: ~p", [Port]),
 6768:     Fun = fun(F) ->
 6769:                   receive
 6770:                       {From,X} when is_function(X) ->
 6771:                           From ! {self(),X()}, F(F);
 6772:                       die -> ok
 6773:                   end
 6774:           end,
 6775:     ?P("[setup] create remote runner"),
 6776:     Pid = rpc:call(R,erlang,spawn,[fun() -> Fun(Fun) end]),
 6777:     Remote = fun(Fu) ->
 6778:                      Pid ! {self(), Fu},
 6779:                      receive {Pid,X} -> X end
 6780:              end,
 6781:     Connect = fun() -> 
 6782:                       ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port,
 6783:                                [{ip, Addr}, {active, false}, {packet, 2}]) 
 6784:               end,
 6785:     ?P("[setup] create (remote) connection"),
 6786:     C = case Remote(Connect) of
 6787:             {ok, CSock} ->
 6788:                 CSock;
 6789:             {error, eaddrnotavail = CReason} ->
 6790:                 (catch ?STOP_NODE(R)),
 6791:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(CReason))
 6792:         end,
 6793:     ?P("[setup] accept (local) connection"),
 6794:     A = case gen_tcp:accept(L) of
 6795:             {ok, ASock} ->
 6796:                 ASock;
 6797:             {error, eaddrnotavail = AReason} ->
 6798:                 (catch ?STOP_NODE(R)),
 6799:                 ?SKIPT(accept_failed_str(AReason))
 6800:         end,
 6801:     ?P("[setup] send (local) and receive (remote) message"),
 6802:     gen_tcp:send(A,"Hello"),
 6803:     {ok, "Hello"} = Remote(fun() -> gen_tcp:recv(C,0) end),
 6804:     ?P("[setup] close (remote) connection"),
 6805:     ok =  Remote(fun() -> gen_tcp:close(C) end),
 6806:     Loop2 = fun(_,_,_,0) ->
 6807: 		    {failure, timeout}; 
 6808: 	       (L2,{MA,MB},F2,N) ->
 6809: 		    case F2() of
 6810: 			MA -> ?P("[setup] action result (MA): ~p", [MA] ), MA;
 6811: 			MB -> ?P("[setup] action result (MB): ~p", [MB] ), MB;
 6812: 			Other -> ?P("[setup] Loop2: ~p",[Other]),
 6813: 				 receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 6814: 				 L2(L2,{MA,MB},F2,N-1)
 6815: 		    end
 6816: 	    end,
 6817:     Loop = fun(Match2,F3) ->  Loop2(Loop2,Match2,F3,10) end,
 6818:     ?P("[setup] stop node"),
 6819:     ?STOP_NODE(R),
 6820:     ?P("[setup] done"),
 6821:     {Loop,A}.
 6822:     
 6823: setup_timeout_sink(Config, RNode, Addr, Timeout, AutoClose, BufSz) ->
 6824:     ?P("[sink setup] create listen socket"),
 6825:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,             Addr},
 6826:                                   {active,             false},
 6827: 				  {packet,             4},
 6828: 				  {sndbuf,             BufSz},
 6829: 				  {send_timeout,       Timeout},
 6830: 				  {send_timeout_close, AutoClose}]),
 6831: 
 6832:     ?P("listen socket created with: "
 6833:        "~n   Send Timeout Opts: ~p",
 6834:        [oki(inet:getopts(L, [send_timeout, send_timeout_close]))]),
 6835:     Fun = fun(N, F) ->
 6836: 		  receive
 6837: 		      {From,X} when is_function(X) ->
 6838: 			  From ! {self(),X()}, F(N+1,F);
 6839:                       {From, iterations} ->
 6840:                           From ! {self(), N}, F(N, F);
 6841: 		      die ->
 6842:                           ok
 6843: 		  end
 6844: 	  end,
 6845:     ?P("[sink setup] start remote runner process (on ~p)", [RNode]),
 6846:     Pid =  rpc:call(RNode, erlang, spawn, [fun() -> Fun(0,Fun) end]),
 6847:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 6848:     Remote = fun(Fu) ->
 6849: 		     Pid ! {self(), Fu},
 6850: 		     receive
 6851:                          {Pid,X} -> X
 6852: 		     end
 6853: 	     end,
 6854:     ?P("[sink setup] connect from remote node (~p)", [RNode]),
 6855:     {ok, C} = Remote(fun() ->
 6856: 			     ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port,
 6857: 				      [{ifaddr, Addr},
 6858:                                        {active, false},
 6859: 				       {packet, 4},
 6860: 				       {recbuf, BufSz div 2},
 6861: 				       {sndbuf, BufSz div 2}])
 6862: 		     end),
 6863:     ?P("[sink setup] accept"),
 6864:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 6865:     ?P("[sink setup] accepted with options: "
 6866:        "~n   Send Timeout Opts: ~p"
 6867:        "~n   => send 'test' message",
 6868:        [oki(inet:getopts(A, [send_timeout, send_timeout_close]))]),
 6869:     gen_tcp:send(A, "Hello"),
 6870:     ?P("[sink setup] 'test' message sent - "
 6871:        "recv 'test' message on remote node (~p)", [RNode]),
 6872:     {ok, "Hello"} = Remote(fun() -> gen_tcp:recv(C,0) end),
 6873:     ?P("[sink setup] cleanup - close listen socket"),
 6874:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 6875: 
 6876:     ?P("[sink setup] done when: "
 6877:        "~n   Accepted socket: ~p"
 6878:        "~n      Buffer Info: ~p"
 6879:        "~n      SockName:    ~p"
 6880:        "~n      PeerName:    ~p"
 6881:        "~n   Connected socket: ~p"
 6882:        "~n      Buffer Info: ~p"
 6883:        "~n      SockName:    ~p"
 6884:        "~n      PeerName:    ~p",
 6885:        [A,
 6886:         oki(inet:getopts(A, [buffer, recbuf, sndbuf])),
 6887:         oki(inet:sockname(A)),
 6888:         oki(inet:peername(A)),
 6889:         C,
 6890:         oki(Remote(fun() -> inet:getopts(C, [buffer, recbuf, sndbuf]) end)),
 6891:         oki(Remote(fun() -> inet:sockname(C) end)),
 6892:         oki(Remote(fun() -> inet:peername(C) end))]),
 6893: 
 6894:     ?P("[sink setup] done"),
 6895: 
 6896:     {A, Pid}.
 6897: 
 6898: oki({ok, V}) -> V;
 6899: oki(E)       -> E.
 6900: 
 6901: setup_active_timeout_sink(Config, RNode, Addr, Timeout, AutoClose) ->
 6902:     ListenOpts =  [binary,
 6903:                    {ifaddr,             Addr},
 6904: 		   {active,             false},
 6905: 		   {packet,             0},
 6906: 		   {nodelay,            true},
 6907: 		   {keepalive,          true},
 6908: 		   {send_timeout,       Timeout},
 6909: 		   {send_timeout_close, AutoClose}],
 6910:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, ListenOpts),
 6911:     Fun = fun(F) ->
 6912: 		  receive
 6913: 		      {From,X} when is_function(X) ->
 6914: 			  From ! {self(),X()},
 6915: 			  F(F);
 6916: 		      die -> ok
 6917: 		  end
 6918: 	  end,
 6919:     Pid = rpc:call(RNode, erlang, spawn, [fun() -> Fun(Fun) end]),
 6920:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 6921:     Remote = fun(Fu) ->
 6922: 		     Pid ! {self(), Fu},
 6923: 		     receive {Pid,X} -> X
 6924: 		     end
 6925: 	     end,
 6926:     {ok, C} = Remote(fun() ->
 6927: 			     ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip,     Addr},
 6928: 			                                   {active, false}])
 6929: 		     end),
 6930:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 6931:     gen_tcp:send(A, "Hello"),
 6932:     {ok, "H"++_} = Remote(fun() -> gen_tcp:recv(C, 0) end),
 6933:     {A, C}.
 6934: 
 6935: %% timeout_sink_loop(Action) ->
 6936: %%     timeout_sink_loop(Action, 1).
 6937: 
 6938: timeout_sink_loop(Action, To) ->
 6939:     put(action,   nothing),
 6940:     put(sent,     0),
 6941:     put(elapsed,  0),
 6942:     put(send_max, 0),
 6943:     put(lsendts,  "-"), % Last Send TS (time stamp)
 6944:     timeout_sink_loop(Action, To, 0).
 6945: 
 6946: timeout_sink_loop(Action, To, N) ->
 6947:     put(action, send),
 6948:     Start   = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 6949:     Ret     = Action(),
 6950:     Stop    = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 6951:     LSendTS = ?FTS(),
 6952:     SendT   = Stop - Start,
 6953:     Elapsed = get(elapsed),
 6954:     put(elapsed, Elapsed + SendT),
 6955:     SendMax = get(send_max),
 6956:     if (SendT > SendMax) -> put(send_max, SendT);
 6957:        true              -> ok
 6958:     end,
 6959:     put(action, sent),
 6960:     put(lsendts, LSendTS),
 6961:     N2 = N + 1,
 6962:     put(sent,   N2),
 6963:     case Ret of
 6964: 	ok ->
 6965: 	    receive
 6966:                 {info_and_die, SockInfo, SockTimeout} ->
 6967:                     ?P("[sink-loop] info and die: "
 6968:                        "~n   Socket Info:  ~p"
 6969:                        "~n   Send Timeout: ~p",
 6970:                        [SockInfo(), SockTimeout()]),
 6971:                     exit(normal)
 6972:             after To -> ok end,
 6973: 	    timeout_sink_loop(Action, To, N+1);
 6974: 	{error, {timeout, RestData}} ->
 6975:             ?P("[sink-loop] action result: "
 6976:                "~n   Number of actions: ~p"
 6977:                "~n   Elapsed time:      ~p msec"
 6978:                "~n   Result:            timeout with ~w bytes of rest data",
 6979:                [N2,
 6980:                 erlang:convert_time_unit(get(elapsed), native, millisecond),
 6981:                 byte_size(RestData)]),
 6982: 	    {{error, timeout}, N2};
 6983: 	Other ->
 6984:             ?P("[sink-loop] action result: "
 6985:                "~n   Number of actions: ~p"
 6986:                "~n   Elapsed time:      ~p msec"
 6987:                "~n   Result:            ~p",
 6988:                [N2,
 6989:                 erlang:convert_time_unit(get(elapsed), native, millisecond),
 6990:                 Other]),
 6991: 	    {Other, N2}
 6992:     end.
 6993: 
 6994: 
 6995: %% =========================================================================
 6996: 
 6997: send_timeout_resume(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6998:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(16)),
 6999:     Cond = fun() ->
 7000:                    case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 7001:                        true ->
 7002:                            {skip, "Unstable with 'socket' backend"};
 7003:                        false ->
 7004:                            Key = kernel_factor,
 7005:                            case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
 7006:                                {value, {Key, Factor}} when (Factor > 6) ->
 7007:                                    {skip,
 7008:                                     ?F("Too slow (factor = ~w)", [Factor])};
 7009:                                _ ->
 7010:                                    ok
 7011:                            end
 7012:                    end
 7013:            end,
 7014:     Pre  = fun() ->
 7015:                    Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 7016:                    ?P("create node"),
 7017:                    {ok, RNode} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME, "-pa " ++ Dir),
 7018:                    RNode
 7019:            end,
 7020:     Case = fun(Node) -> do_send_timeout_resume(Config, Node, 13) end,
 7021:     Post = fun(Node) ->
 7022:                    ?P("stop node ~p", [Node]),
 7023:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)
 7024:            end,
 7025:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 7026: 
 7027: do_send_timeout_resume(Config, RNode, BlockPow) ->
 7028:     BlockSize = 1 bsl BlockPow,
 7029:     1         = rand:uniform(1),
 7030:     Seed      = rand:export_seed(),
 7031:     ListenOpts =
 7032:         [inet,
 7033:          binary,
 7034:          {backlog, 2},
 7035:          {active,  false}],
 7036:     ConnectOpts =
 7037:         [inet,
 7038:          {send_timeout, 0},
 7039:          {active,       false},
 7040:          binary],
 7041:     StreamOpts =
 7042:         [{high_watermark, BlockSize},
 7043:          {low_watermark,  BlockSize bsr 1},
 7044:          {sndbuf,         BlockSize},
 7045:          {recbuf,         BlockSize},
 7046:          {buffer,         BlockSize bsl 1}],
 7047:     Client = self(),
 7048:     Tag = make_ref(),
 7049:     {Server, Mref} =
 7050:         spawn_opt(
 7051:           RNode,
 7052:           fun () ->
 7053:                   send_timeout_resume_srv(
 7054:                     Config, Seed, Client, Tag, ListenOpts, StreamOpts)
 7055:           end, [monitor, link]),
 7056:     ?P("Client=~p Server=~p Tag=~p~n", [Client, Server, Tag]),
 7057:     receive
 7058:         {Tag, port, Port} ->
 7059:             ok;
 7060:         {'DOWN', Mref, _, _, Port} ->
 7061:             %% Use variable Port just to get export from case
 7062:             ct:fail(Port)
 7063:     end,
 7064:     ?P("connecting to ~p~n", [Port]),
 7065:     {ok, C} = ?CONNECT(Config, localhost, Port, ConnectOpts, 2000),
 7066:     try
 7067:         ok = inet:setopts(C, StreamOpts),
 7068:         ?P("client StreamOpts: ~p~n",
 7069:            [inet:getopts(C, optnames(StreamOpts))]),
 7070:         receive
 7071:             {Tag, send} ->
 7072:                 ok;
 7073:             {'DOWN', Mref, _, _, Error2} ->
 7074:                 ct:fail(Error2)
 7075:         end,
 7076:         RetryTimeout = str_which_retry_timeout(),
 7077:         ?P("send"),
 7078:         {N, Timeouts} =
 7079:             do_send_timeout_resume_send(C, Server, Tag,
 7080:                                         RetryTimeout, BlockSize),
 7081:         ?P("await server (~p) reply (DOWN)", [Server]),
 7082:         receive
 7083:             {'DOWN', Mref, _, _, Result} ->
 7084:                 ?P("received DOWN message from server:"
 7085:                    "~n   N:        ~p"
 7086:                    "~n   Timeouts: ~p"
 7087:                    "~n   Result:   ~p", [N, Timeouts, Result]),
 7088:                 case Result of
 7089:                     {Tag, ok, Count}
 7090:                       when Count =:= N * BlockSize,
 7091:                            %% We should get 10 time-outs.
 7092:                            %% If we do not get more than one, it seems
 7093:                            %% we get stuck when trying to poll the
 7094:                            %% send buffer with send_timeout = 0,
 7095:                            %% so that did not work
 7096:                            1 < Timeouts ->
 7097:                         ?P("count checked out"),
 7098:                         ok;
 7099:                     {Tag, ok, Count} when Count =:= N * BlockSize ->
 7100:                         ?P("Unexpected number of timeouts: ~w", [Timeouts]),
 7101:                         ct:fail(Result);
 7102:                     {Tag, ok, Count} ->
 7103:                         ?P("Unexpected counts: "
 7104:                            "~n      Got:      ~p"
 7105:                            "~n      Expected: ~p", [Count, N*BlockSize]),
 7106:                         ct:fail(Result);
 7107:                     {Tag, Res, _Count} ->
 7108:                         ?P("Unexpected res: "
 7109:                            "~n      Res: ~p", [Res]),
 7110:                         ct:fail(Result);
 7111:                     _ ->
 7112:                         ct:fail(Result)
 7113:                 end
 7114:         end
 7115:     after
 7116:         ?P("after: kill (failsafe) server"),
 7117:         exit(Server, failsafe),
 7118:         ?P("after: close socket"),
 7119:         gen_tcp:close(C),
 7120:         ?P("after: done"),
 7121:         ok
 7122:     end.
 7123: 
 7124: optnames(Opts) ->
 7125:     [Name || {Name, _} <- Opts].
 7126: 
 7127: str_which_retry_timeout() ->
 7128:     case os:type() of
 7129:         {unix, darwin} ->
 7130:             %% This is really sketchy, but it seems to "work"...
 7131:             %% Don't know if its the processor (M1) or if its the
 7132:             %% OS/darwin version (darwin 21.x).
 7133:             %% But since we don't have any intel macs running 21...
 7134:             case os:version() of
 7135:                 {Major, _, _} when (Major >= 20) ->
 7136:                     25;
 7137:                 _ ->
 7138:                     100
 7139:             end;
 7140:         {unix, freebsd} ->
 7141:             %% Has seen this on FreeBSD 12.2 and later.
 7142:             case os:version() of
 7143:                 {Major, _, _} when (Major >= 13) ->
 7144:                     25;
 7145:                 {Major, Minor, _} when (Major =:= 12) andalso
 7146:                                        (Minor >= 2) ->
 7147:                     25;
 7148:                 _ ->
 7149:                     100
 7150:             end;
 7151:         _ ->
 7152:             100
 7153:     end.
 7154:     
 7155: %% Fill buffers
 7156: do_send_timeout_resume_send(S, Server, Tag, RetryTimeout, BlockSize) ->
 7157:     ?P("try send-timeout-resume with"
 7158:        "~n   RetryTimeout: ~w ms"
 7159:        "~n   BlockSize:    ~w", [RetryTimeout, BlockSize]),
 7160:     do_send_timeout_resume_send(S, Server, Tag, 0, RetryTimeout, BlockSize).
 7161: 
 7162: do_send_timeout_resume_send(S, Server, Tag, N, RetryTimeout, BlockSize) ->
 7163:     Bin = random_data(BlockSize),
 7164:     case send_timeout_repeat(S, Server, Tag, N, Bin, RetryTimeout, 0) of
 7165:         0 ->
 7166:             do_send_timeout_resume_send(S, Server, Tag,
 7167:                                         N + 1, RetryTimeout, BlockSize);
 7168:         Timeouts ->
 7169:             ok = gen_tcp:close(S),
 7170:             {N + 1, Timeouts}
 7171:     end.
 7172: 
 7173: send_timeout_repeat(S, Server, Tag, N, Bin, RetryTimeout, Timeouts) ->
 7174:     case gen_tcp:send(S, Bin) of
 7175:         ok ->
 7176:             ?P("send_timeout_repeat -> success => done when"
 7177:                "~n      N:           ~p"
 7178:                "~n      Timeouts:    ~p"
 7179:                "~n      Socket Info: ~p", [N, Timeouts, (catch inet:info(S))]),
 7180:             Timeouts;
 7181:         {error, Reason} ->
 7182:             case Reason of
 7183:                 timeout ->
 7184:                     ?P("send_timeout_repeat -> timeout:"
 7185:                        "~n      S:           ~p"
 7186:                        "~n      N:           ~p"
 7187:                        "~n      Timeouts:    ~p"
 7188:                        "~n      Socket Info: ~p",
 7189:                        [S, N, Timeouts, (catch inet:info(S))]),
 7190:                     Server ! {Tag, rec},
 7191:                     receive after RetryTimeout -> ok end,
 7192:                     send_timeout_repeat(
 7193:                       S, Server, Tag, N, <<>>, RetryTimeout, Timeouts + 1);
 7194:                 {timeout, RestData} ->
 7195:                     ?P("send_timeout_repeat -> timeout with RestData: "
 7196:                        "~n      S:           ~p"
 7197:                        "~n      N:           ~p"
 7198:                        "~n      Timeouts:    ~p"
 7199:                        "~n      Socket Info: ~p",
 7200:                        [S, N, Timeouts, (catch inet:info(S))]),
 7201:                     Server ! {Tag, rec},
 7202:                     receive after RetryTimeout -> ok end,
 7203:                     send_timeout_repeat(
 7204:                       S, Server, Tag, N, RestData, RetryTimeout, Timeouts + 1);
 7205:                 _ ->
 7206:                     ?P("send_timeout_repeat -> unexpected send failure: "
 7207:                        "~n      Reason:      ~p"
 7208:                        "~n   when"
 7209:                        "~n      N:           ~p"
 7210:                        "~n      Timeouts:    ~p"
 7211:                        "~n      Socket Info: ~p",
 7212:                        [Reason, N, Timeouts, (catch inet:info(S))]),
 7213:                     error({Reason, N, Timeouts})
 7214:             end
 7215:     end.
 7216: 
 7217: random_data(0) ->
 7218:     <<>>;
 7219: random_data(Size) ->
 7220:     <<(rand:uniform(256) - 1), (random_data(Size - 1))/binary>>.
 7221: 
 7222: compare_data(<<>>, Count) ->
 7223:     Count;
 7224: compare_data(<<Byte, Bin/binary>>, Count) ->
 7225:     case rand:uniform(256) - 1 of
 7226:         Byte ->
 7227:             compare_data(Bin, Count + 1);
 7228:         _ ->
 7229:             error({diff, Count})
 7230:     end.
 7231: 
 7232: send_timeout_resume_srv(Config, Seed, Client, Tag, ListenOpts, StreamOpts) ->
 7233:     rand:seed(Seed),
 7234:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, ListenOpts),
 7235:     ?P("[server] get listen StreamOpts -> ~p",
 7236:        [inet:getopts(L, optnames(StreamOpts))]),
 7237:     {ok, P} = inet:port(L),
 7238:     Client ! {Tag, port, P},
 7239:     %%
 7240:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L, 2000),
 7241:     ?P("[server] accept success ~p", [A]),
 7242:     ok = inet:setopts(A, StreamOpts),
 7243:     ?P("[server] get accept StreamOpts -> ~p",
 7244:        [inet:getopts(A, optnames(StreamOpts))]),
 7245:     Client ! {Tag, send},
 7246:     %%
 7247:     receive
 7248:         {Tag, rec} ->
 7249:             ?P("[server] received recv command - now wait some time"),
 7250:             receive after 5000 -> ok end,
 7251:             ?P("[server] begin receiving (on ~p)", [A]),
 7252:             exit({Tag, ok, send_timeout_resume_srv(A, 0)})
 7253:     end.
 7254: 
 7255: send_timeout_resume_srv(S, Count) ->
 7256:     case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0) of
 7257:         {ok, Data} ->
 7258:             Count_1 = compare_data(Data, Count),
 7259:             send_timeout_resume_srv(S, Count_1);
 7260:         {error, closed} ->
 7261:             Count;
 7262:         {error, Reason} ->
 7263:             error({Reason, Count})
 7264:     end.
 7265: 
 7266: 
 7267: 
 7268: has_superfluous_schedulers() ->
 7269:     case {erlang:system_info(schedulers),
 7270: 	  erlang:system_info(logical_processors)} of
 7271: 	{S, unknown} when S > 1 -> true;
 7272: 	{S, P} when S > P -> true;
 7273: 	_ -> false
 7274:     end.
 7275: 
 7276: 
 7277: %% Leaking message from inet_drv {inet_reply,P,ok}
 7278: %% when a socket sending resumes working after a send_timeout.
 7279: %% Should we even bother testing this if 'inet_backend = socket'?
 7280: otp_7731(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 7281:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 7282:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 7283:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 7284:                             Addr;
 7285:                         {error, Reason} ->
 7286:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 7287:                     end
 7288:            end,
 7289:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_otp_7731(Config, Addr) end,
 7290:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 7291:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 7292: 
 7293: do_otp_7731(Config, Addr) ->
 7294:     ?P("[ctrl] create server"),
 7295:     ME = self(),
 7296:     ServerPid = spawn_link(fun() -> otp_7731_server(Config, Addr, ME) end),
 7297:     ?P("[ctrl] await listening port (number) from server"),
 7298:     receive {ServerPid, ready, PortNum} -> ok end,
 7299: 
 7300:     ?P("[ctrl] connect to server on port ~w", [PortNum]),
 7301:     {ok, Socket} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum,
 7302:                             [binary,
 7303:                              {ip,           Addr},
 7304:                              {active,       false},
 7305:                              {packet,       raw},
 7306:                              {send_timeout, 1000}]),
 7307: 
 7308:     ?P("[ctrl] send data"),
 7309:     otp_7731_send(Socket),
 7310:     ?P("[ctrl] sending complete - order server to recv"),
 7311:     ServerPid ! {self(), recv},
 7312:     ?P("[ctrl] await 'recv complete' from server"),
 7313:     receive {ServerPid, ok} -> ?P("[ctrl] received 'recv complete'"), ok end,
 7314: 
 7315:     %% Now make sure inet_drv does not leak any internal messages.
 7316:     ?P("[ctrl] waiting for leaking messages..."),
 7317:     receive Msg ->
 7318:             ?P("[ctrl] got unexpected message: "
 7319:                "~n      ~p", [Msg]),
 7320: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Msg})
 7321:     after 1000 ->
 7322: 	    ok
 7323:     end,
 7324:     ?P("[ctrl] no leaking messages - cleanup"),
 7325:     (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 7326:     ServerPid ! {self(), die},
 7327:     ?P("[ctrl] done."),
 7328:     ok.
 7329:     
 7330: otp_7731_send(Socket) ->
 7331:     Bin = <<1:10000>>,
 7332:     ?P("[client] sending ~p bytes...", [byte_size(Bin)]),
 7333:     case gen_tcp:send(Socket, Bin) of
 7334:         ok ->
 7335:             otp_7731_send(Socket);
 7336:         {error, {timeout, RestData}} ->
 7337:             ?P("[client] send timeout with ~w bytes of rest data",
 7338:                [byte_size(RestData)]),
 7339:             ok;
 7340:         {error, timeout} ->
 7341:             ?P("[client] send timeout"),
 7342:             ok
 7343:     end.
 7344: 
 7345: otp_7731_server(Config, Addr, Ctrl) ->
 7346:     ?P("[server] create listen socket"),
 7347:     {ok, LSocket} =
 7348:         ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {packet, raw}, {active, false}]),
 7349:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LSocket),
 7350:     ?P("[server] listening on port number ~p", [PortNum]),
 7351:     Ctrl ! {self(), ready, PortNum},
 7352: 
 7353:     ?P("[server] accept"),
 7354:     {ok, CSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(LSocket),
 7355:     ?P("[server] accepted - close listen socket"),
 7356:     gen_tcp:close(LSocket),
 7357: 
 7358:     ?P("[server] await recv order"),
 7359:     receive {Ctrl, recv} -> ok end,
 7360:     
 7361:     ?P("[server] start receiving..."),
 7362:     otp_7731_recv(CSocket),
 7363: 
 7364:     ?P("[server] announce recv done"),
 7365:     Ctrl ! {self(), ok},
 7366: 
 7367:     ?P("[server] finished, (connection) closing..."),
 7368:     gen_tcp:close(CSocket),
 7369:     receive {Ctrl, die} -> ok end,
 7370:     ?P("[server] done"),
 7371:     exit(normal).
 7372: 
 7373: 
 7374: otp_7731_recv(Socket) ->
 7375:     case gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0, 1000) of
 7376:         {ok, Bin} ->
 7377:             ?P("[server] received ~p bytes", [size(Bin)]),
 7378:             otp_7731_recv(Socket);
 7379:         {error, timeout} ->
 7380:             ?P("[server] receive timeout - done recv"),
 7381:             ok
 7382:     end.
 7383: 
 7384: 
 7385: %% OTP-7615: TCP-ports hanging in CLOSING state when sending large
 7386: %% buffer followed by a recv() that returns error due to closed
 7387: %% connection.
 7388: %% OTP-7615 Leaking closed ports.
 7389: %% This is a specific inet-driver bug, skip this when using 'socket'
 7390: zombie_sockets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 7391:     Cond = fun() ->
 7392:                    case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 7393:                        true ->
 7394:                            {skip, "Inet driver specific test"};
 7395:                        false ->
 7396:                            ok
 7397:                    end
 7398:            end,
 7399:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 7400:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 7401:                             Addr;
 7402:                         {error, Reason} ->
 7403:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 7404:                     end
 7405:            end,
 7406:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_zombie_sockets(Config, Addr) end,
 7407:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 7408:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 7409: 
 7410: do_zombie_sockets(Config, Addr) ->
 7411:     register(zombie_collector,self()),
 7412:     Calls = 10,
 7413:     ?P("create zombie server"),
 7414:     Server = spawn_link(?MODULE, zombie_server, [Config, Addr, self(), Calls]),
 7415:     {Server, ready, PortNum} = receive Msg -> Msg  end,
 7416:     ?P("Ports before = ~p",[lists:sort(erlang:ports())]),
 7417:     zombie_client_loop(Config, Calls, Addr, PortNum),
 7418:     Ports = lists:sort(zombie_collector(Calls, [])),
 7419:     Server ! terminate,
 7420:     ?P("Collected ports = ~p", [Ports]),
 7421:     [] = zombies_alive(Ports, 10),
 7422:     timer:sleep(1000),
 7423:     ?P("done"),
 7424:     ok.
 7425: 
 7426: zombie_client_loop(_Config, 0, _, _) ->
 7427:     ?P("[zombie client] done"),
 7428:     ok;
 7429: zombie_client_loop(Config, N, Addr, PortNum) when is_integer(PortNum) ->
 7430:     ?P("[zombie client][~w] try connect", [N]),
 7431:     {ok, Socket} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum,
 7432:                             [binary,
 7433:                              {ip,     Addr},
 7434:                              {active, false},
 7435:                              {packet, raw}]),
 7436:     ?P("[zombie client] connected - now close ~p", [Socket]),
 7437:     gen_tcp:close(Socket), % to make server recv fail
 7438:     zombie_client_loop(Config, N-1, Addr, PortNum).
 7439: 
 7440: 
 7441: zombie_collector(0, Acc) ->
 7442:     ?P("[zombie collector] done: "
 7443:        "~n   ~p", [Acc]),
 7444:     Acc;
 7445: zombie_collector(N, Acc) ->
 7446:     receive 
 7447: 	{closed, Socket} -> 
 7448:             ?P("[zombie collector] ~p closed", [Socket]),
 7449: 	    zombie_collector(N-1, [Socket|Acc]);
 7450: 	E -> 
 7451: 	    {unexpected, E, Acc}
 7452:     end.
 7453: 	    
 7454: zombies_alive(Ports, WaitSec) ->
 7455:     Alive = lists:sort(erlang:ports()),
 7456:     ?P("[zombies alive][~w] Alive: ~p", [WaitSec, Alive]),
 7457:     Zombies = lists:filter(fun(P) -> lists:member(P, Alive) end, Ports),
 7458:     case Zombies of
 7459: 	[] -> [];
 7460: 	_ ->
 7461: 	    case WaitSec of
 7462: 		0 -> Zombies;
 7463: 		_ -> timer:sleep(1000), % Wait some more for zombies to die
 7464: 		     zombies_alive(Zombies, WaitSec-1)
 7465: 	    end
 7466:     end.
 7467: 
 7468: zombie_server(Config, Addr, Pid, Calls) ->
 7469:     ?P("[zombie server] try create listen socket with backlog: ~w", [Calls]),
 7470:     {ok, LSock} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {packet, raw},
 7471:                                       {active, false}, {backlog, Calls}]),
 7472:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LSock),
 7473:     ?P("[zombie server] Listening on ~w with port number ~p", [LSock, PortNum]),
 7474:     BigBin = list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(100*1024, 77)),
 7475:     ?P("[zombie server] send ready"),
 7476:     Pid ! {self(), ready, PortNum},
 7477:     zombie_accept_loop(LSock, BigBin, Calls),
 7478:     ?P("[zombie server] await terminate"),
 7479:     terminate = receive Msg -> Msg end,
 7480:     ?P("[zombie server] terminating"),
 7481:     ok.
 7482: 
 7483: zombie_accept_loop(_, _, 0) ->
 7484:     ?P("[zombie server] accept loop done"),
 7485:     ok;
 7486: zombie_accept_loop(Socket, BigBin, Calls) ->
 7487:     ?P("[zombie server][~w] try accept", [Calls]),
 7488:     case gen_tcp:accept(Socket) of
 7489: 	{ok, NewSocket} ->
 7490:             ?P("[zombie server][~w] accepted ~p - create handler",
 7491:                [Calls, NewSocket]),
 7492: 	    spawn_link(fun() -> zombie_server_handler(NewSocket, BigBin) end),
 7493: 	    zombie_accept_loop(Socket, BigBin, Calls-1);
 7494: 	E ->
 7495: 	    E
 7496:     end.
 7497: 
 7498: zombie_server_handler(Socket, Bin) ->
 7499:     ?P("[zombie server handler] got connection on ~p - attempt send", [Socket]),
 7500:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, Bin),
 7501:     ?P("[zombie server handler] Sent data, waiting for reply on ~p", [Socket]),
 7502:     case gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 4) of
 7503:         {error, closed} ->
 7504:             ?P("[zombie server handler] recv: closed (expected)"),
 7505:             ok;
 7506:         {error, econnaborted} -> % may be returned on Windows
 7507:             ?P("[zombie server handler] recv: econnaborted (expected)"),
 7508:             ok;
 7509:         {error, Reason} ->
 7510:             ?P("[zombie server handler] UNEXPECTED recv failure reason: ~p",
 7511:                [Reason]),
 7512:             exit({unexpected_recv_error_reason, Reason});
 7513:         {ok, _} ->
 7514:             ?P("[zombie server handler] UNEXPECTED recv success"),
 7515:             exit(unexpected_recv_success)
 7516: 	  end,
 7517:     ?P("[zombie server handler] close socket ~p", [Socket]),
 7518:     gen_tcp:close(Socket),
 7519:     ?P("[zombie server handler] socket closed: inform collector"),
 7520:     zombie_collector ! {closed, Socket}.
 7521: 
 7522: 
 7523: %% Hanging send on windows when sending iolist with more than 16 binaries.
 7524: otp_7816(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 7525:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(2)),
 7526:     Cond = fun() ->
 7527: 		   %% With 'socket on Windows' we have actually no way to
 7528: 		   %% actually *know* that nothing is sent even after a timeout
 7529: 		   %% (and the send cancel that socket issues). The I/O 
 7530: 		   %% Completion Port framework may well have buffers still
 7531: 		   %% handle the data and send it as soon as it can.
 7532: 		   %% Basically, data is "out of our hands" as soon as we
 7533: 		   %% give it to the framework. Cancel may have "no effect"
 7534: 		   %% even if the completion operation is reported as
 7535: 		   %% 'aborted'.
 7536: 		   %% So, this test case simply does not work.
 7537: 		   case os:type() of
 7538: 		        {win32, nt} ->
 7539: 			   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 7540: 			       true ->
 7541: 				   {skip,
 7542: 				    "Not compatible with 'socket on Windows'"};
 7543: 			       false ->
 7544: 				   ok
 7545: 				       end;
 7546: 		       _ ->
 7547: 			   ok
 7548: 		   end
 7549: 	   end,
 7550:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 7551:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 7552:                             Addr;
 7553:                         {error, Reason} ->
 7554:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 7555:                     end
 7556:            end,
 7557:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_otp_7816(Config, Addr) end,
 7558:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 7559:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 7560: 
 7561: do_otp_7816(Config, Addr) ->
 7562:     Ctrl = self(),
 7563:     ?P("[ctrl] create server process..."),
 7564:     Server = spawn_link(fun() -> otp_7816_server(Config, Addr, Ctrl) end),
 7565:     ?P("[ctrl] await server process ready..."),
 7566:     receive {Server, ready, PortNum} -> ok end,
 7567: 
 7568:     ?P("[ctrl] connect to server..."),
 7569:     {ok, Socket} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum,
 7570:                             [binary,
 7571:                              {ip,           Addr},
 7572:                              {active,       false},
 7573:                              {packet,       4},
 7574:                              {send_timeout, 10}]),
 7575: 
 7576:     %% We use the undocumented feature that sending can be resumed after
 7577:     %% a send_timeout without any data loss if the peer starts to receive data.
 7578:     %% Unless of course the 7816-bug is in affect, in which case the write event
 7579:     %% for the socket is lost on windows and not all data is sent.
 7580: 
 7581:     ?P("[ctrl] begin sending..."),
 7582: 
 7583:     [otp_7816_ctrl(Socket, 18, BinSize, Server) ||
 7584: 	BinSize <- lists:seq(1000, 2000, 123)],
 7585: 
 7586:     ?P("[ctrl] sending complete - close socket"),
 7587: 
 7588:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Socket),
 7589:     ?P("[ctrl] stop server"),
 7590:     Server ! {self(), closed},
 7591:     ?P("[ctrl] await server stopped"),
 7592:     {Server, closed} = receive M -> M end,
 7593:     ?P("[ctrl] done"),
 7594:     ok.
 7595: 
 7596: 
 7597: otp_7816_ctrl(Socket, BinNr, BinSize, Server) ->
 7598:     ?P("[ctrl] create payload (BinSz: ~w)...", [BinSize]),
 7599:     Data = lists:duplicate(BinNr, <<1:(BinSize*8)>>),
 7600:     ?P("[ctrl] socket info prior to start sending: "
 7601:        "~n      ~p", [inet:info(Socket)]),
 7602:     Ctrl   = self(),
 7603:     Client = spawn_link(fun() -> otp_7816_send_data(Ctrl, Socket, Data) end),
 7604:     SentBytes =
 7605: 	receive
 7606: 	    {Client, continue, Loops} ->
 7607: 		?P("[ctrl] received continue from client: ~p", [Loops]),
 7608: 		SB = Loops * BinNr * BinSize,
 7609: 		Server ! {self(), recv, SB},
 7610: 		SB
 7611: 	end,
 7612:     ct:sleep(1000),
 7613:     ?P("[ctrl] socket info after sending ~w bytes: "
 7614:        "~n      ~p", [SentBytes, inet:info(Socket)]),
 7615:     ?P("[ctrl] await server result..."),
 7616:     ok = receive
 7617: 	     {Server, SR} ->
 7618: 		 ?P("[ctrl] server result: ~p", [SR]),
 7619: 		 SR
 7620: 	 end,
 7621:     ?P("[ctrl] await client termination..."),
 7622:     ok = receive
 7623: 	     {'EXIT', Client, normal} ->
 7624: 		 ?P("[ctrl] client normal exit"),
 7625: 		 ok;
 7626: 	     {'EXIT', Client, CR} ->
 7627: 		 ?P("[ctrl] client unexpected exit reason: ~p", [CR]),
 7628: 		 CR
 7629: 	 end,
 7630:     ?P("[ctrl] done with BinSz: ~p", [BinSize]),
 7631:     ok.
 7632:     
 7633: 
 7634: otp_7816_send_data(Ctrl, Socket, Data) ->
 7635:     otp_7816_send_data(Ctrl, Socket, Data, 0).
 7636: 
 7637: otp_7816_send_data(Ctrl, Socket, Data, Loops) ->
 7638:     ?P("[client] sending data (~w bytes, ~w)...", [iolist_size(Data), Loops]),
 7639:     case gen_tcp:send(Socket, Data) of
 7640: 	ok ->
 7641: 	    otp_7816_send_data(Ctrl, Socket, Data, Loops+1);
 7642: 
 7643: 	{error, timeout} when is_port(Socket) ->
 7644: 	    %% For the 'classic' sockets, when the OS buffers are
 7645: 	    %% full, the rest data are put into the (inet driver)
 7646: 	    %% internal, for later sending. SO, it can be counted
 7647: 	    %% as sent.
 7648: 	    ?P("[client] send timeout when Loops: ~p (+1)", [Loops]),
 7649: 	    Ctrl ! {self(), continue, Loops + 1},
 7650: 	    exit(normal);
 7651: 
 7652: 	{error, timeout} ->
 7653: 	    %% For inet_backend = 'socket' when we nothing of the
 7654: 	    %% message was sent.
 7655: 	    ?P("[client] send timeout when Loops: ~p", [Loops]),
 7656: 	    Ctrl ! {self(), continue, Loops},
 7657: 	    exit(normal);
 7658: 
 7659: 	{error, {timeout, RestData}} ->
 7660: 	    %% A timeout means that **some** of the data was not sent,
 7661: 	    %% currently there is no way to know how much.
 7662: 	    %% NOTE THAT THIS MEANS THAT WE MAY HAVE A PARTIAL PACKAGE
 7663: 	    %% WRITTEN, INCLUDING A HEADER THAT INDICATES A DATA
 7664: 	    %% SIZE THAT IS **NOT** PRESENT!!
 7665: 	    %% So for this trest case to work, we need to write the rest.
 7666: 	    %% But we cannot do that without first setting the package to raw.
 7667: 	    %%
 7668: 	    ?P("[client] send timeout"
 7669: 	       "~n      with ~w bytes of rest data"
 7670: 	       "~n      when Loops: ~p", [byte_size(RestData), Loops]),
 7671: 	    Ctrl ! {self(), continue, Loops + 1},
 7672: 	    ?P("[client] packet to 'raw'..."),
 7673: 	    ok = inet:setopts(Socket, [{packet, raw}, {send_timeout, 1000}]),
 7674: 	    ?P("[client] send ~w bytes of rest data...",
 7675: 	       [byte_size(RestData)]),
 7676: 	    ok = gen_tcp:send(Socket, RestData),
 7677: 	    ?P("[client] packet (back) to '4'..."),
 7678: 	    ok = inet:setopts(Socket, [{packet, 4}, {send_timeout, 10}]),
 7679: 	    ?P("[client] done"),
 7680: 	    exit(normal)
 7681: 
 7682:     end.
 7683:     
 7684:     
 7685: otp_7816_server(Config, Addr, Ctrl) ->
 7686:     ?P("[server] create listening socket"),
 7687:     {ok, LSocket} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary,  {ip, Addr},
 7688:                                         {packet, 4},
 7689:                                         {active, false}]),
 7690:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LSocket),
 7691:     ?P("[server] listening on ~w with port number ~p", [LSocket, PortNum]),
 7692:     Ctrl ! {self(), ready, PortNum},
 7693: 
 7694:     ?P("[server] accept connection..."),
 7695:     {ok, ASocket} = gen_tcp:accept(LSocket),
 7696:     ?P("[server] connection accepted..."),
 7697:     gen_tcp:close(LSocket),
 7698: 
 7699:     otp_7816_server_loop(ASocket, Ctrl),
 7700: 
 7701:     ?P("[server] terminating").
 7702: 
 7703: 
 7704: otp_7816_server_loop(Socket, Ctrl) ->
 7705:     ?P("[server] waiting for order..."),
 7706:     receive 
 7707: 	{Ctrl, recv, RecvBytes} -> 
 7708: 	    ?P("[server] start receiving (~w bytes)...", [RecvBytes]),
 7709: 
 7710: 	    ok = otp_7816_recv(Socket, RecvBytes),
 7711: 	    
 7712: 	    Ctrl ! {self(), ok},
 7713: 	    otp_7816_server_loop(Socket, Ctrl);
 7714: 	
 7715: 	{Ctrl, closed} ->
 7716: 	    {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0, 1000),
 7717: 	    Ctrl ! {self(), closed}
 7718:     end.
 7719: 
 7720: otp_7816_recv(Socket, BytesLeft) ->
 7721:     otp_7816_recv(Socket, BytesLeft, 1).
 7722: 
 7723: otp_7816_recv(_, 0, _) ->
 7724:     ?P("[server] got all data"),
 7725:     ok;
 7726: otp_7816_recv(Socket, BytesLeft, N) ->
 7727:     ?P("[server,~w] try recv (~p bytes left)", [N, BytesLeft]),
 7728:     case gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0, 1000) of
 7729: 	{ok, Bin} when (byte_size(Bin) =< BytesLeft) andalso
 7730: 		       (byte_size(Bin) > 0) -> 
 7731: 	    ?P("[server,~w] received ~p of ~p bytes",
 7732: 	       [N, size(Bin), BytesLeft]),
 7733: 	    otp_7816_recv(Socket, BytesLeft - byte_size(Bin), N+1);
 7734: 	{ok, Bin} ->
 7735: 	    ?P("[server,~w] received unexpected data: "
 7736: 	       "~n   Expected:    ~p bytes"
 7737: 	       "~n   Received:    ~p bytes"
 7738: 	       "~n   Socket Info: ~p",
 7739: 	       [N, BytesLeft, byte_size(Bin), inet:info(Socket)]),
 7740: 	    {error, {unexpected_data, BytesLeft, byte_size(Bin)}};
 7741: 	{error, timeout} ->
 7742: 	    ?P("[server,~w] got receive timeout when expecting more data:"
 7743: 	       "~n      Socket Info: ~p", [N,inet:info(Socket)]),
 7744: 	    {error, timeout}
 7745:     end.
 7746: 
 7747: 
 7748: %% ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 7749: 
 7750: %% Receive a packet with a faulty packet header.
 7751: otp_8102(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 7752:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 7753:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 7754:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 7755:                             Addr;
 7756:                         {error, Reason} ->
 7757:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 7758:                     end
 7759:            end,
 7760:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_otp_8102(Config, Addr) end,
 7761:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 7762:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 7763: 
 7764: do_otp_8102(Config, Addr) ->
 7765:     {ok, LSocket} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 7766:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LSocket),
 7767:     ?P("Listening on ~w with port number ~p", [LSocket, PortNum]),
 7768: 
 7769:     [otp_8102_do(Config, LSocket, Addr, PortNum, otp_8102_packet(Type, Size))
 7770:      || Size <- lists:seq(-10,-1), 
 7771: 	Type <- [4, {cdr,big}, {cdr,little}]],
 7772:     
 7773:     gen_tcp:close(LSocket),
 7774:     ok.
 7775: 
 7776: otp_8102_packet(4, Size) ->
 7777:     {<<Size:32/big>>, 4};
 7778: otp_8102_packet({cdr,big}, Size) ->
 7779:     {<<"GIOP",0,0,0,0,Size:32/big>>, cdr};
 7780: otp_8102_packet({cdr,little}, Size) ->
 7781:     {<<"GIOP",0,0,1,0,Size:32/little>>, cdr}.
 7782: 
 7783: otp_8102_do(Config, LSocket, Addr, PortNum, {Bin,PType}) ->
 7784: 
 7785:     ?P("Connect with packet option ~p ...",[PType]),
 7786:     {ok, RSocket} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [binary,
 7787:                                                      {ip,     Addr},
 7788:                                                      {packet, PType},
 7789:                                                      {active, true}]),
 7790:     {ok, SSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(LSocket),
 7791: 
 7792:     ?P("Got connection, sending ~p...",[Bin]),
 7793: 
 7794:     ok = gen_tcp:send(SSocket, Bin),
 7795: 
 7796:     ?P("Sending complete...",[]),
 7797: 
 7798:     {tcp_error,RSocket,emsgsize} = receive M -> M end,
 7799: 
 7800:     ?P("Got error msg, ok."),
 7801:     gen_tcp:close(SSocket),    
 7802:     gen_tcp:close(RSocket).
 7803: 
 7804: %% Verify packet_size handles long HTTP header lines.
 7805: otp_9389(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 7806:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 7807:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 7808:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 7809:                             Addr;
 7810:                         {error, Reason} ->
 7811:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 7812:                     end
 7813:            end,
 7814:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_otp_9389(Config, Addr) end,
 7815:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 7816:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 7817: 
 7818: do_otp_9389(Config, Addr) ->
 7819:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,false}]),
 7820:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
 7821:     ?P("Listening on ~w with port number ~p", [LS, PortNum]),
 7822:     OrigLinkHdr = "/" ++ string:chars($S, 8192),
 7823:     _Server = spawn_link(
 7824:                 fun() ->
 7825:                         {ok, S} = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
 7826:                         ok = inet:setopts(S, [{packet_size, 16384}]),
 7827:                         ok = otp_9389_loop(S, OrigLinkHdr),
 7828:                         ok = gen_tcp:close(S)
 7829:                 end),
 7830:     {ok, S} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum,
 7831:                        [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
 7832:     Req = "GET / HTTP/1.1\r\n"
 7833:         ++ "Host: " ++ inet_parse:ntoa(Addr) ++ "\r\n"
 7834:         ++ "Link: " ++ OrigLinkHdr ++ "\r\n\r\n",
 7835:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Req),
 7836:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{packet, http}]),
 7837:     {ok, {http_response, {1,1}, 200, "OK"}} = gen_tcp:recv(S, 0),
 7838:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{packet, httph}, {packet_size, 16384}]),
 7839:     {ok, {http_header, _, 'Content-Length', _, "0"}} = gen_tcp:recv(S, 0),
 7840:     {ok, {http_header, _, "Link", _, LinkHdr}} = gen_tcp:recv(S, 0),
 7841:     true = (LinkHdr == OrigLinkHdr),
 7842:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S),
 7843:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS),
 7844:     ok.
 7845: 
 7846: otp_9389_loop(S, OrigLinkHdr) ->
 7847:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,once},{packet,http}]),
 7848:     receive
 7849:         {http, S, {http_request, 'GET', _, _}} ->
 7850:             ok = otp_9389_loop(S, OrigLinkHdr, undefined)
 7851:     after
 7852:         3000 ->
 7853:             error({timeout,request_line})
 7854:     end.
 7855: otp_9389_loop(S, OrigLinkHdr, ok) ->
 7856:     Resp = "HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\nContent-length: 0\r\n" ++
 7857:         "Link: " ++ OrigLinkHdr ++ "\r\n\r\n",
 7858:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Resp);
 7859: otp_9389_loop(S, OrigLinkHdr, State) ->
 7860:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,once}, {packet,httph}]),
 7861:     receive
 7862:         {http, S, http_eoh} ->
 7863:             otp_9389_loop(S, OrigLinkHdr, ok);
 7864:         {http, S, {http_header, _, "Link", _, LinkHdr}} ->
 7865:             LinkHdr = OrigLinkHdr,
 7866:             otp_9389_loop(S, OrigLinkHdr, State);
 7867:         {http, S, {http_header, _, _Hdr, _, _Val}} ->
 7868:             otp_9389_loop(S, OrigLinkHdr, State);
 7869:         {http, S, {http_error, Err}} ->
 7870:             error({error, Err})
 7871:     after
 7872:         3000 ->
 7873:             error({timeout,header})
 7874:     end.
 7875: 
 7876: wrapping_oct() ->
 7877:     [{timetrap, {minutes,20}}].
 7878: 
 7879: %% Check that 64bit octet counters work.
 7880: wrapping_oct(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 7881:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 7882:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 7883:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 7884:                             Addr;
 7885:                         {error, Reason} ->
 7886:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 7887:                     end
 7888:            end,
 7889:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_wrapping_oct(Config, Addr) end,
 7890:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 7891:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 7892: 
 7893: %% {recbuf, 8192}, {sndbuf, 8192}
 7894: do_wrapping_oct(Config, Addr) ->
 7895:     ?P("[ctrl] create listen socket"),
 7896:     Ctrl = self(),
 7897:     {ok, LSock} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,false},{mode,binary}]),
 7898:     {ok, LPort} = inet:port(LSock),
 7899:     ?P("[ctrl] spawn acceptor"),
 7900:     Acceptor = spawn_link(fun() -> oct_acceptor(Ctrl, LSock) end),
 7901:     ?P("[ctrl] spawn pump"),
 7902:     Pump     = spawn_link(fun() -> 
 7903:                                   oct_datapump(Ctrl,
 7904:                                                Config, Addr, LPort, 16#10000FFFF)
 7905:                           end),
 7906:     ?P("[ctrl] await acceptor socket"),
 7907:     ASock = wc_await_socket("acceptor", Acceptor),
 7908:     ?P("[ctrl] await pump socket"),
 7909:     PSock = wc_await_socket("pump", Pump),
 7910:     ?P("[ctrl] await completion (from pump)"),
 7911:     Res = wc_await_completion(Acceptor, ASock, Pump, PSock),
 7912:     ?P("[ctrl] close listen socket"),
 7913:     gen_tcp:close(LSock),
 7914:     ?P("[ctrl] verify result"),
 7915:     ok = Res,
 7916:     ?P("[ctrl] done"),
 7917:     ok.
 7918: 
 7919: wc_await_socket(Tag, Pid) ->
 7920:     receive
 7921:         {Pid, socket, AS} ->
 7922:             ?P("received ~s socket: "
 7923:                "~n      ~p", [Tag, AS]),
 7924:             AS
 7925:     end.
 7926: 
 7927: wc_await_completion(Acceptor, ASock, Pump, PSock) ->
 7928:     wc_await_completion(Acceptor, ASock, Pump, PSock, 1, undefined).
 7929: 
 7930: wc_await_completion(undefined = _Acceptor, _ASock,
 7931:                     undefined = _Pump,     _PSock, 
 7932:                     Loops, Res) ->
 7933:     ?P("completed after ~w loops", [Loops]),
 7934:     Res;
 7935: wc_await_completion(Acceptor, ASock, Pump, PSock, Loops, CRes) ->
 7936:     receive
 7937:         {'EXIT', Pump, Res} ->
 7938:             ?P("[ctrl] Received pump exit: "
 7939:                "~n   Loops:  ~w"
 7940:                "~n   Reason: ~p", [Loops, Res]),
 7941:             wc_await_completion(Acceptor,  ASock,
 7942:                                 undefined, PSock,
 7943:                                 Loops + 1, Res);
 7944:         {'EXIT', Acceptor, Res} ->
 7945:             ?P("[ctrl] Received acceptor exit: "
 7946:                "~n   Loops:  ~w"
 7947:                "~n   Reason: ~p", [Loops, Res]),
 7948:             wc_await_completion(undefined, ASock,
 7949:                                 Pump,      PSock,
 7950:                                 Loops + 1, CRes)
 7951:                 
 7952:     after 10000 ->
 7953:             ASockInfo = wc_sock_info(ASock),
 7954:             AccInfo   = wc_proc_info(Acceptor),
 7955:             PSockInfo = wc_sock_info(PSock),
 7956:             PumpInfo  = wc_proc_info(Pump),
 7957:             ?P("Info ~w while waiting for clompletion: "
 7958:                "~n   Acceptor Socket Info: ~p"
 7959:                "~n   Acceptor Info:        ~p"
 7960:                "~n   Pump Socket Info:     ~p"
 7961:                "~n   Pump Info:            ~p",
 7962:                [Loops, ASockInfo, AccInfo, PSockInfo, PumpInfo]),
 7963:             wc_await_completion(Acceptor,  ASock,
 7964:                                 Pump,      PSock,
 7965:                                 Loops + 1, CRes)
 7966:     end.
 7967:             
 7968: wc_sock_info(S) ->
 7969:     try inet:info(S)
 7970:     catch
 7971:         _:_:_ ->
 7972:             undefined
 7973:     end.
 7974: 
 7975: wc_proc_info(P) when is_pid(P) ->
 7976:     try erlang:process_info(P)
 7977:     catch
 7978:         _:_:_ ->
 7979:             undefined
 7980:     end;
 7981: wc_proc_info(_) ->
 7982:     undefined.
 7983: 
 7984: %% {recbuf, 16*1024}, {sndbuf, 16*1024}
 7985: oct_datapump(Ctrl, Config, Addr, Port, N) ->
 7986:     ?P("[pump] connect to listener"),
 7987:     {ok, CSock} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port,
 7988: 			   [{ip, Addr}, {active, false}, {mode, binary}]),
 7989:     ?P("[pump] announce to ctrl"),
 7990:     Ctrl ! {self(), socket, CSock},
 7991:     {ok, [{sndbuf,SndBuf}]} = inet:getopts(CSock, [sndbuf]),
 7992:     ?P("[pump] connected - start 'pumping' with"
 7993:        "~n      SndBuf: ~w", [SndBuf]),
 7994:     put(action,  nothing),
 7995:     put(sent,    0),
 7996:     put(elapsed, 0),
 7997:     put(rem_bytes, N),
 7998:     oct_pump(CSock, N, binary:copy(<<$a:8>>,100000), 0, 0).
 7999: 
 8000: oct_pump(S, N, _, _, _Sent) when N =< 0 ->
 8001:     ?P("[pump] done"),
 8002:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S)),
 8003:     exit(ok);
 8004: oct_pump(S, N, Bin, Last, Sent) ->
 8005:     put(action, send),
 8006:     Start   = erlang:monotonic_time(nanosecond),
 8007:     Res     = gen_tcp:send(S, Bin),
 8008:     Stop    = erlang:monotonic_time(nanosecond),
 8009:     Elapsed = get(elapsed),
 8010:     put(elapsed, Elapsed + (Stop - Start)),
 8011:     put(action,  sent),
 8012:     put(sent,    Sent+1),
 8013:     case Res of
 8014: 	ok ->
 8015: 	    case inet:getstat(S) of
 8016: 		{ok, Stat} ->
 8017: 		    {_, R} = lists:keyfind(send_oct, 1, Stat),
 8018: 		    case (R < Last) of
 8019: 			true ->
 8020: 			    ?P("[pump] send counter error ~p < ~p", [R, Last]),
 8021:                             (catch gen_tcp:close(S)),
 8022: 			    exit({error, {output_counter, R, Last, N}});
 8023: 			false ->
 8024:                             put(rem_bytes, N - byte_size(Bin)),
 8025: 			    oct_pump(S, N-byte_size(Bin), Bin, R, Sent+1)
 8026: 		    end;
 8027: 		{error, StatReason} ->
 8028: 		    ?P("[pump] get stat failed:"
 8029: 		       "~n      Reason:    ~p"
 8030: 		       "~n   when"
 8031: 		       "~n      Remaining: ~p"
 8032: 		       "~n      Last:      ~p", [StatReason, N, Last]),
 8033: 		    (catch gen_tcp:close(S)),
 8034: 		    exit({error, {stat_failure, StatReason, N, Last}})
 8035: 	    end;
 8036: 	{error, SendReason} ->
 8037: 	    ?P("[pump] send failed:"
 8038: 	       "~n      Reason:    ~p"
 8039: 	       "~n   when"
 8040: 	       "~n      Remaining: ~p"
 8041: 	       "~n      Last:      ~p", [SendReason, N, Last]),
 8042: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(S)),
 8043: 	    exit({error, {send_failure, SendReason, N, Last}})
 8044:     end.
 8045:     
 8046: 
 8047: oct_acceptor(Ctrl, LSock) ->
 8048:     ?P("[acceptor] accept connection"),
 8049:     {ok, ASock} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
 8050:     ?P("[acceptor] announce to ctrl"),
 8051:     Ctrl ! {self(), socket, ASock},
 8052:     {ok, [{recbuf,RecBuf}]} = inet:getopts(ASock, [recbuf]),
 8053:     ?P("[acceptor] connection accepted - start receiving with: "
 8054:        "~n      RecBuf: ~w", [RecBuf]),
 8055:     put(action,  nothing),
 8056:     put(recv,    0),
 8057:     put(elapsed, 0),
 8058:     oct_aloop(ASock, inet:info(ASock), 0, 0).
 8059: 
 8060: oct_aloop(S, LastInfo, Received, Times) ->
 8061:     put(action, recv),
 8062:     Start   = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 8063:     Res     = gen_tcp:recv(S, 0),
 8064:     Stop    = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 8065:     Elapsed = get(elapsed),
 8066:     put(elapsed, Elapsed + (Stop - Start)),
 8067:     put(action,  received),
 8068:     put(recv,    Times+1),
 8069:     case Res of
 8070: 	{ok, _} ->
 8071:             #{counters := #{recv_oct := R} = _Stat} = Info = inet:info(S),
 8072:             case (R < Received) of
 8073:                 true ->
 8074:                     ?P("[acceptor] recv counter error:"
 8075:                        "~n      Recv Cnt:  ~p"
 8076:                        "~n      Received:  ~p"
 8077:                        "~n      Times:     ~p"
 8078:                        "~n      Info:      ~p"
 8079:                        "~n      Last Info: ~p",
 8080:                        [R, Received, Times, Info, LastInfo]),
 8081:                     (catch gen_tcp:close(S)),
 8082:                     {error, {output_counter, R, Received, Times}};
 8083:                 false ->
 8084:                     case Times rem 16#FFFFF of
 8085:                         0 ->
 8086:                             ?P("[acceptor] read: ~p"
 8087:                                "~n      Times: ~w"
 8088:                                "~n      Info:  ~p",
 8089:                                [R, Times, Info]);
 8090:                         _ ->
 8091:                             ok
 8092:                     end,
 8093:                     oct_aloop(S, Info, R, Times+1)
 8094:             end;
 8095: 
 8096: 	{error, RecvReason} ->
 8097: 	    ?P("[acceptor] receive failed:"
 8098: 	       "~n      Reason:   ~p"
 8099: 	       "~n   when"
 8100: 	       "~n      Received: ~p"
 8101: 	       "~n      Times:    ~p", [RecvReason, Received, Times]),
 8102: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(S)),
 8103:             ct:sleep(1000), % Just give the 'pump' a chance to get there first
 8104: 	    exit(closed)
 8105:     end.
 8106: 
 8107: ok({ok,V}) -> V.
 8108: 
 8109: get_hostname(Name) ->
 8110:     "@"++Host = lists:dropwhile(fun(C) -> C =/= $@ end, atom_to_list(Name)),
 8111:     Host.
 8112: 
 8113: otp_13939(doc) ->
 8114:     ["Check that writing to a remotely closed socket doesn't block forever "
 8115:      "when exit_on_close is false."];
 8116: otp_13939(suite) ->
 8117:     [];
 8118: otp_13939(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8119:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_opt(
 8120:         fun() ->
 8121:             {ok, Listener} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{exit_on_close, false}]),
 8122:             {ok, Port} = inet:port(Listener),
 8123: 
 8124:             spawn_link(
 8125:                 fun() ->
 8126:                     {ok, Client} = ?CONNECT(Config, "localhost", Port,
 8127:                         [{active, false}]),
 8128:                     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client)
 8129:                 end),
 8130: 
 8131:             {ok, Accepted} = gen_tcp:accept(Listener),
 8132: 
 8133:             ok = gen_tcp:send(Accepted, <<0:(10*1024*1024*8)>>),
 8134: 
 8135:             %% The bug surfaces when there's a delay between the send
 8136:             %% operations; inet:getstat is a red herring.
 8137:             timer:sleep(100),
 8138: 
 8139:             {error, Code} = gen_tcp:send(Accepted, <<0:(10*1024*1024*8)>>),
 8140:             ct:pal("gen_tcp:send returned ~p~n", [Code])
 8141:         end, [link, monitor]),
 8142: 
 8143:     receive
 8144:         {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} ->
 8145:             ok
 8146:     after 1000 ->
 8147:         demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
 8148:         exit(Pid, normal),
 8149:         ct:fail("Server process blocked on send.")
 8150:     end.
 8151: 
 8152: 
 8153: %% No point in running this as the test case with inet_backend = socket
 8154: %% as it tests a bug in the inet driver that cannot reproduced with
 8155: %% inet_backend = socket.
 8156: otp_12242(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8157:     Cond = fun() ->
 8158: 		   case os:type() of
 8159: 		       {win32,_} ->
 8160: 			   %% Even if we set sndbuf and recbuf to small sizes
 8161: 			   %% Windows either happily accepts to send GBytes of
 8162: 			   %% data in no time, so the second send below that
 8163: 			   %% is supposed to time out just succeeds, or the 
 8164: 			   %% first send that is supposed to fill the inet_drv
 8165: 			   %% I/O queue and start waiting for when more data
 8166: 			   %% can be sent instead sends all data but suffers
 8167: 			   %% a send failure that closes the socket.
 8168: 			   {skip, backpressure_broken_on_win32};
 8169: 		       _ ->
 8170: 			   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 8171: 			       true ->
 8172: 				   {skip, "Not compliant with socket"};
 8173: 			       false ->
 8174: 				   ok
 8175: 			   end
 8176: 		   end
 8177: 	   end,
 8178:     TC = fun() -> do_otp_12242(Config) end,
 8179:     ?TC_TRY(otp_12242, Cond, TC).
 8180: 
 8181: do_otp_12242(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8182:     %% Find the IPv4 address of an up and running interface
 8183:     %% that is not loopback nor pointtopoint
 8184:     {ok, IFList} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 8185:     ?P("IFList "
 8186:        "~n      ~p", [IFList]),
 8187:     case
 8188: 	lists:flatten(
 8189: 	  [lists:filtermap(
 8190: 	     fun ({addr, Addr}) when (tuple_size(Addr) =:= 4) ->
 8191: 		     {true, Addr};
 8192: 		 (_) ->
 8193: 		     false
 8194: 	     end, Opts)
 8195: 	   || {_,Opts} <- IFList,
 8196: 	      case lists:keyfind(flags, 1, Opts) of
 8197: 		  {_,Flags} ->
 8198: 		      lists:member(up, Flags)
 8199: 			  andalso
 8200: 			  lists:member(running, Flags)
 8201: 			  andalso
 8202: 			  not lists:member(loopback, Flags)
 8203: 			  andalso
 8204: 			  not lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags);
 8205: 		  false ->
 8206: 		      false
 8207: 	      end])
 8208:     of
 8209: 	[Addr|_] ->
 8210: 	    otp_12242(Config, Addr);
 8211: 	Other ->
 8212: 	    ?SKIPT({no_external_address, Other})
 8213:     end.
 8214: 
 8215: %%
 8216: otp_12242(Config, Addr) when (tuple_size(Addr) =:= 4) ->
 8217:     ct:timetrap(30000),
 8218:     ?P("Using address ~p", [Addr]),
 8219:     Bufsize  = 16 * 1024,
 8220:     Datasize = 128 * 1024 * 1024, % At least 1 s on GBit interface
 8221:     Blob     = binary:copy(<<$x>>, Datasize),
 8222:     LOpts =
 8223:         [{backlog,   4},
 8224: 	 {reuseaddr, true},
 8225: 	 {ip,        Addr},
 8226:          binary,
 8227: 	 {active,    false},
 8228:          {recbuf,    Bufsize},
 8229: 	 {sndbuf,    Bufsize},
 8230: 	 {buffer,    Bufsize}],
 8231:     COpts =
 8232:         [binary,
 8233: 	 {active,       false},
 8234: 	 {ip,           Addr},
 8235:          {linger,       {true, 1}}, % 1 s
 8236:          {send_timeout, 500},
 8237:          {recbuf,       Bufsize},
 8238: 	 {sndbuf,       Bufsize},
 8239: 	 {buffer,       Bufsize}],
 8240:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 8241:     {ok, ListenerNode} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME, "-pa " ++ Dir),
 8242:     Tester = self(),
 8243:     ?P("create listener"),
 8244:     {Listener, ListenerMRef} =
 8245:         spawn_opt(
 8246:           ListenerNode,
 8247:           fun () ->
 8248: 		  ?P("create listen socket"),
 8249:                   {ok,L}     = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, LOpts),
 8250:                   {ok,LPort} = inet:port(L),
