 8251: 		  ?P("inform tester about port number: ~w", [LPort]),
 8252:                   Tester ! {self(), port, LPort},
 8253: 		  ?P("try accept"),
 8254:                   {ok, A}    = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 8255: 		  ?P("accepted - close listen socket"),
 8256:                   ok         = gen_tcp:close(L),
 8257: 		  ?P("await close order"),
 8258:                   receive
 8259:                       {Tester, stop} ->
 8260: 			  ?P("close order received - close accepted socket"),
 8261:                           ok = gen_tcp:close(A)
 8262:                   end
 8263:           end, [link, monitor]),
 8264:     ?P("await listen port"),
 8265:     LPort = receive {Listener,port,P} -> P end,
 8266:     ?P("try connect to ~w", [LPort]),
 8267:     {ok,C} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, LPort, COpts, infinity),
 8268:     ?P("connected - get buffers"),
 8269:     {ok, ReadCOpts} = inet:getopts(C, [recbuf,sndbuf,buffer]),
 8270:     ?P("connected sockets buffers:"
 8271:        "~n      ~p", [ReadCOpts]),
 8272: 
 8273:     otp_12242_2(C, Blob, Datasize),
 8274: 
 8275:     ?P("send listener stop"),
 8276:     Listener ! {Tester, stop},
 8277:     ?P("await listener termination"),
 8278:     wait(ListenerMRef),
 8279:     ?P("stop listener node"),
 8280:     ?STOP_NODE(ListenerNode),
 8281:     ?P("done"),
 8282:     ok.
 8283:     
 8284: 
 8285: otp_12242_2(C, Blob, Datasize) ->
 8286:     %% Fill the buffers
 8287:     ?P("sending ~p bytes", [Datasize]),
 8288:     case gen_tcp:send(C, Blob) of
 8289:         ok ->
 8290:             ?P("sent ~p bytes", [Datasize]),
 8291:             otp_12242_3(C, Blob, Datasize);
 8292:         {error, {timeout, _RestData}} ->
 8293:             %% We filled the buffers and timed out;
 8294:             %% this is probably the socket backend - give up.
 8295:             ok;
 8296:         {error, timeout} ->
 8297:             %% The same as the previous clause
 8298:             ok
 8299:     end,
 8300:     _ = gen_tcp:close(C),
 8301:     ok.
 8302: 
 8303: otp_12242_3(C, Blob, Datasize) ->
 8304:     %% Try to ensure that the close call is in progress
 8305:     %% before the owner proceeds with sending
 8306:     CloserMRef = otp_12242_closer(C),
 8307:     
 8308:     ?P("await tref"),
 8309:     receive
 8310:         {tref,Tref} ->
 8311: 	    ?P("tref received - now await trigger timeout"),
 8312:             receive {timeout,Tref,_} -> ok end,
 8313:             ?P("trigger timeout received - try send ~p bytes again",
 8314: 	       [Datasize]),
 8315:             %% Now should the close be in progress...
 8316:             %% All buffers are full, remote end is not reading,
 8317:             %% and the send timeout is 1 s so this will timeout:
 8318:             {error, timeout} = gen_tcp:send(C, Blob),
 8319:             ?P("expected timeout - update send_timeout (to 10000)"),
 8320:             ok = inet:setopts(C, [{send_timeout, 10000}]),
 8321:             %% There is a hidden timeout here.  Port close is sampled
 8322:             %% every 5 s by prim_inet:send_recv_reply.
 8323:             %% Linger is 3 s so the Closer will finish this send:
 8324:             ?P("try send ~p bytes - expect error (closed)", [Datasize]),
 8325:             {error, closed} = gen_tcp:send(C, Blob),
 8326:             ?P("await closer termination"),
 8327:             normal = wait(CloserMRef),
 8328:             ok
 8329:     end.
 8330: 
 8331: otp_12242_closer(C) ->
 8332:     Owner = self(),
 8333:     {_Closer, CloserMref} =
 8334:         spawn_opt(
 8335:           fun () ->
 8336:                   ?P("[closer] starting"),
 8337:                   Owner ! {tref, erlang:start_timer(50, Owner, closing)},
 8338:                   ?P("[closer] calling gen_tcp:close(C)"),
 8339:                   try gen_tcp:close(C) of
 8340:                       Result ->
 8341:                           ?P("[closer] gen_tcp:close(C) -> ~p", [Result]),
 8342:                           ok = Result
 8343:                   catch
 8344:                       Class:Reason:Stacktrace ->
 8345:                           ?P("[closer] caught gen_tcp:close(C):"
 8346: 			     "~n      Error Class:  ~p"
 8347: 			     "~n      Error:        ~p"
 8348: 			     "~n      Stack trace:  ~p",
 8349:                             [Class, Reason, Stacktrace]),
 8350:                           erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stacktrace)
 8351:                   end
 8352:           end, [link, monitor]),
 8353:     CloserMref.
 8354: 
 8355: 
 8356: wait(Mref) ->
 8357:     receive {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,Reason} -> Reason end.
 8358: 
 8359: %% OTP-15536
 8360: %% Test that send error works correctly for delay_send
 8361: delay_send_error(Config) ->
 8362:     ?P("create listen socket"),
 8363:     {ok, Addr} = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
 8364:     {ok, L}    = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip,        Addr},
 8365:                                      {reuseaddr, true},
 8366:                                      {packet,    1},
 8367:                                      {active,    false}]),
 8368:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(L),
 8369: 
 8370:     delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, false),
 8371:     delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, true),
 8372:     ?P("close listen socket"),
 8373:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 8374: 
 8375: delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, Active) ->
 8376:     ?P("try connect - with delay_send:true active:~p",[Active]),
 8377:     {ok, C} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum,
 8378:                        [{ip,         Addr},
 8379:                         {packet,     1},
 8380:                         {active,     Active},
 8381:                         {delay_send, true}]),
 8382:     ?P("try accept"),
 8383:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 8384:     %% Do a couple of sends first to see that it works
 8385:     ?P("send data"),
 8386:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8387:     ?P("send data"),
 8388:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8389:     ?P("send data"),
 8390:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8391:     %% Close the receiver
 8392:     ?P("close receiver (accepted socket)"),
 8393:     ok = gen_tcp:shutdown(C, write),
 8394:     %%
 8395:     ?P("send data"),
 8396:     case gen_tcp:send(C, "hello") of
 8397:         ok ->
 8398:             ?P("send data"),
 8399:             case gen_tcp:send(C, "hello") of
 8400:                 ok ->
 8401:                     delay_send_error2(C);
 8402:                 {error, closed} ->
 8403:                     ?P("closed (expected)"),
 8404:                     ok
 8405:             end;
 8406: 
 8407:         {error, closed} ->
 8408:             ?P("closed (expected)"),
 8409:             ok;
 8410: 
 8411:         {error, #{info := eshutdown = R}} ->
 8412:             ?P("~w (expected)", [R]),
 8413:             ok;
 8414:         {error, eshutdown = R} ->
 8415:             ?P("~w (expected)", [R]),
 8416:             ok
 8417:     end,
 8418:     ?P("close accepted socket"),
 8419:     ok = gen_tcp:close(A),
 8420:     ?P("close connected socket"),
 8421:     ok = gen_tcp:close(C).
 8422: 
 8423: 
 8424: delay_send_error2(Sock) ->
 8425:     delay_send_error2(Sock, 3).
 8426: 
 8427: delay_send_error2(Sock, 0) ->
 8428:     gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 8429:     ct:fail("Unexpected send success");
 8430: delay_send_error2(Sock, N) ->
 8431:     %% Sleep in order for delay_send to have time to trigger
 8432:     %% This used to result in a double free
 8433:     timer:sleep(1000),
 8434:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, "hello") of
 8435:         ok ->
 8436:             delay_send_error2(Sock, N-1);
 8437:         {error, closed} ->
 8438:             ?P("closed (expected, ~w)", [N]),
 8439:             ok;
 8440:         {error, Reason} ->
 8441:             ct:fail(?F("Unexpected send error: ~p", [Reason]))
 8442:     end.
 8443: 
 8444:     
 8445: 
 8446: 
 8447: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8448: 
 8449: 
 8450: -define(MAX_WORKERS, 30).
 8451: 
 8452: %% 30-second test for gen_tcp in {active, N} mode,
 8453: %% ensuring it does not get stuck.
 8454: %% Verifies that erl_check_io properly handles extra EPOLLIN signals.
 8455: %% We do not bother with this test case on inet_backend = socket
 8456: %% since the test is about the inet-driver!
 8457: bidirectional_traffic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8458:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(30)),
 8459:     Cond = fun() ->
 8460: 		   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 8461: 		       true ->
 8462: 			   {skip, "Inet driver specific test"};
 8463: 		       false ->
 8464: 			   ok
 8465: 		   end
 8466: 	   end,
 8467:     Pre  = fun() ->
 8468: 		   Addr =
 8469: 		       case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8470: 			   {ok, A} ->
 8471: 			       A;
 8472: 			   {error, Reason} ->
 8473: 			       ?SKIPT({skip, Reason})
 8474: 		       end,
 8475:                    NumOnlineScheds = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 8476:                    NumWorkers0     = NumOnlineScheds * 2,
 8477:                    {NumWorkers, ActiveN} =
 8478:                        if
 8479:                            (NumWorkers0 =< 10) ->
 8480:                                {NumWorkers0, 20};
 8481:                            (NumWorkers0 =< 20) ->
 8482:                                {NumWorkers0, 18};
 8483:                            (NumWorkers0 =< ?MAX_WORKERS) ->
 8484:                                {NumWorkers0, 15};
 8485:                            true ->
 8486:                                {?MAX_WORKERS, 15}
 8487:                        end,
 8488:                    ?P("pre ->"
 8489:                       "~n   Number Of Online Schedulers: ~w"
 8490:                       "~n   =>"
 8491:                       "~n      Use workers: ~w"
 8492:                       "~n      ActiveN:     ~w",
 8493:                       [NumOnlineScheds, NumWorkers, ActiveN]),
 8494:                    Payload = bdt_payload(32),
 8495:                    {ok, LSock} = ?LISTEN(Config,
 8496:                                          0,
 8497:                                          [binary,
 8498:                                           {ip,        Addr},
 8499: 					  {packet,    0},
 8500:                                           {active,    false},
 8501:                                           {reuseaddr, true}]),
 8502:                    %% get all sockets to know failing ends
 8503:                    ?P("pre -> listen socket created: "
 8504:                       "~n      ~p", [LSock]),
 8505:                    #{lsock       => LSock,
 8506: 		     addr        => Addr,
 8507:                      num_workers => NumWorkers,
 8508:                      payload     => Payload,
 8509:                      %% The point of this is to make it "easy" to 
 8510:                      %% "configure" this value...
 8511:                      active_n    => ActiveN}
 8512:            end,
 8513:     Case = fun(Info) -> do_bidirectional_traffic(Config, Info) end,
 8514:     Post = fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 8515:                    ?P("post -> close listen socket"),
 8516:                    (catch gen_tcp:close(LSock))
 8517:            end,
 8518:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8519:             Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 8520: 
 8521: bdt_payload(N) ->
 8522:     rand:bytes(N).
 8523:     
 8524: 
 8525: do_bidirectional_traffic(Config, #{lsock       := LSock,
 8526:                                    num_workers := NumWorkers} = Info) ->
 8527:     ?P("case -> begin"),
 8528:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(LSock),
 8529:     ?P("case -> listen socket port number ~w", [Port]),
 8530:     Control = self(),
 8531:     ?P("case -> create ~w receivers", [NumWorkers]),
 8532:     Receivers = [spawn_link(fun () -> 
 8533: 				    exchange(Config,
 8534:                                              Info#{port => Port,
 8535:                                                    ctrl => Control})
 8536: 			    end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, NumWorkers)],
 8537:     ?P("case -> await the result"),
 8538:     %% Should we not collect as many as possible?
 8539:     %% To see how many as issues?
 8540:     Result =
 8541: 	%% If any of the receivers report, we have an error
 8542:         receive
 8543:             {timeout, Socket, Total} ->
 8544:                 ?P("case -> timeout msg for ~p: received ~w", [Socket, Total]),
 8545:                 {fail, {timeout, Socket, Total}};
 8546: 	    {error, Socket, Reason} ->
 8547:                 ?P("case -> error msg for ~p: ~p", [Socket, Reason]),
 8548:                 {fail, {error, Socket, Reason}}
 8549:         after 30000 ->
 8550:                 %% if it does not fail in 30 seconds, it most likely works
 8551:                 ?P("case -> timeout => success"),
 8552:                 ok
 8553:         end,
 8554:     ?P("case -> ensure all receivers terminated"),
 8555:     %% [begin unlink(Rec), exit(Rec, kill) end || Rec <- Receivers],
 8556:     bt_terminate_receivers(Receivers),
 8557:     ?P("case -> done"),
 8558:     Result.
 8559: 
 8560: %% The point of this (function) is so that the 'receivers' should
 8561: %% get a chance to "tell us" what they are up to...
 8562: bt_terminate_receivers(Recvs) ->
 8563:     bt_terminate_receivers_nice(Recvs),
 8564:     ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8565:     bt_terminate_receivers_force(Recvs).
 8566: 
 8567: bt_terminate_receivers_nice(Recvs) ->
 8568:     [begin
 8569:          unlink(Recv),
 8570:          Recv ! terminate
 8571:      end || Recv <- Recvs].
 8572: 
 8573: bt_terminate_receivers_force(Recvs) ->
 8574:     [exit(Recv, kill) || Recv <- Recvs].
 8575:     
 8576: exchange(Config, #{lsock    := LSock,
 8577: 		   addr     := Addr,
 8578:                    port     := Port, 
 8579:                    payload  := Payload,
 8580:                    ctrl     := Control,
 8581:                    active_n := ActiveN}) ->
 8582:     %% spin up client
 8583:     _ClntRcv = spawn_link(
 8584:         fun () ->
 8585:                 ?P("exchange:client -> connect"),
 8586:                 {ok, Client} =
 8587:                     ?CONNECT(Config,
 8588: 			     Addr,
 8589: 			     Port,
 8590: 			     [binary,
 8591: 			      {ip, Addr}, {packet, 0}, {active, ActiveN}]),
 8592:                 ?P("exchange:client -> connected: ~p"
 8593:                    "~n      PeerName: ~p"
 8594:                    "~n      SockName: ~p",
 8595:                    [Client,
 8596:                     oki(inet:peername(Client)), oki(inet:sockname(Client))]),
 8597:                 put(role, connected),
 8598:                 send_recv_loop(Client, Payload, Control, ActiveN)
 8599:         end),
 8600:     ?P("exchange -> accept"),
 8601:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
 8602:     ?P("exchange -> accepted: ~p"
 8603:        "~n      PeerName: ~p"
 8604:        "~n      SockName: ~p",
 8605:        [Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket))]),
 8606:     %% sending process
 8607:     put(role, accepted),
 8608:     send_recv_loop(Socket, Payload, Control, ActiveN).
 8609: 
 8610: send_recv_loop(Socket, Payload, Control, ActiveN) ->
 8611:     %% {active, N} must be set to active > 12 to trigger the issue
 8612:     %% {active, 30} seems to trigger it quite often & reliably
 8613:     Role = get(role),
 8614:     ?P("[~w] set (initial) active: ~p", [Role, ActiveN]),
 8615:     inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, ActiveN}]),
 8616:     ?P("[~w] spawn sender", [Role]),
 8617:     _Snd = spawn_link(
 8618:         fun Sender() ->
 8619:             case gen_tcp:send(Socket, Payload) of
 8620:                 ok ->
 8621:                     Sender();
 8622:                 {error, closed} ->
 8623:                     ?P("[~w,sender] Socket closed", [Role]),
 8624:                     exit(normal);
 8625:                 {error, Reason} ->
 8626:                     ?P("[~w,sender] Send failed: "
 8627:                        "~n      ~p", [Role, Reason]),
 8628:                     exit({send_failed, Reason})
 8629:             end
 8630:         end),
 8631:     ?P("[~w] begin recv", [Role]),
 8632:     recv(Socket, 0, 0, 0, Control, ActiveN).
 8633: 
 8634: recv(Socket, Total, TotIter, TotAct, Control, ActiveN) ->
 8635:     receive
 8636:         terminate ->
 8637:             ?P("[~w,recv] received terminate message when"
 8638:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8639:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8640:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8641:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8642:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8643:                [get(role),
 8644:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8645:                 Socket, (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8646:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8647:             exit(normal);
 8648: 
 8649:         {tcp, Socket, Data} ->
 8650:             recv(Socket,
 8651:                  Total + byte_size(Data), TotIter + 1, TotAct,
 8652:                  Control, ActiveN);
 8653:         {tcp_passive, Socket} ->
 8654:             inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, ActiveN}]),
 8655:             recv(Socket, Total, TotIter, TotAct + 1, Control, ActiveN);
 8656:         {tcp_closed, Socket} ->
 8657:             ?P("[~w,recv] closed when"
 8658:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8659:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8660:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8661:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8662: 	       [get(role), Total, TotIter, TotAct, (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8663: 	    ok;
 8664: 
 8665:         Other ->
 8666:             ?P("[~w,recv] received unexpected message"
 8667:                "~n      Msg:               ~p"
 8668:                "~n   when:"
 8669:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8670:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8671:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8672:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8673:                "~n      PeerName:          ~p"
 8674:                "~n      SockName:          ~p"
 8675:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8676:                [get(role),
 8677:                 Other,
 8678:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8679:                 Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket)),
 8680:                 (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8681:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8682:             Control ! {error, Socket, Other}
 8683: 
 8684:     after 2000 ->
 8685:             %% no data received in 2 seconds => test failed
 8686:             ?P("[~w,recv timeout] received nothing when:"
 8687:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8688:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8689:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8690:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8691:                "~n      PeerName:          ~p"
 8692:                "~n      SockName:          ~p"
 8693:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8694:                [get(role),
 8695:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8696:                 Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket)),
 8697:                 (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8698:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8699:             Control ! {timeout, Socket, Total}
 8700:     end.
 8701: 
 8702: 
 8703: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8704: 
 8705: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8706: %% We create a listen socket, then spawns processes that create
 8707: %% monitors to it...
 8708: socket_monitor1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8709:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8710:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8711:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8712:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8713:                             Addr;
 8714:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8715:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8716:                     end
 8717:            end,
 8718:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1(Config, Addr) end,
 8719:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8720:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8721: 
 8722: do_socket_monitor1(Config, Addr) ->
 8723:     ?P("begin"),
 8724:     Self         = self(),
 8725:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8726:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8727:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8728:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 8729: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 8730: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8731: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8732: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8733: 	 end,
 8734:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8735:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 8736:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8737:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8738:     ?P("close socket"),
 8739:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8740:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8741:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8742:     ?P("done"),
 8743:     ok.
 8744: 
 8745: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 8746:     sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 8747: 
 8748: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 8749:     receive
 8750: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 8751: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 8752: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 8753: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 8754: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 8755: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 8756: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 8757: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 8758: 	    exit(ok);
 8759: 
 8760: 	Any ->
 8761: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 8762: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 8763: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 8764:     end.
 8765: 
 8766: sm_await_client_ready(Pid) ->
 8767:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid, "client").
 8768: 
 8769: sm_await_client_ready(Pid, Name) ->
 8770:     receive
 8771: 	{Pid, ready} ->
 8772: 	    ?P("received ~s ready", [Name])
 8773:     end.
 8774: 
 8775: sm_await_down(Pid, Mon, ExpRes) ->
 8776:     receive
 8777: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, ExpRes} ->
 8778: 	    ?P("received expected process down message from ~p", [Pid]),
 8779: 	    ok;
 8780: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, UnexpRes} ->
 8781: 	    ?P("received unexpected process down message from ~p: "
 8782: 	       "~n   ~p", [Pid, UnexpRes]),
 8783: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_down, UnexpRes})
 8784:     end.
 8785: 
 8786: 
 8787: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8788: 
 8789: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8790: %% We create "many" listen socket(s), then spawns processes that create
 8791: %% monitors to them...
 8792: socket_monitor1_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8793:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8794:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8795:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8796:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8797:                             Addr;
 8798:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8799:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8800:                     end
 8801:            end,
 8802:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config, Addr) end,
 8803:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8804:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8805: 
 8806: do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config, Addr) ->
 8807:     ?P("begin"),
 8808:     Self         = self(),
 8809:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8810:     ?P("[client] create socket(s)"),
 8811:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8812:     {ok, LSock2} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8813:     {ok, LSock3} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8814:     {ok, LSock4} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8815:     {ok, LSock5} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8816:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8817:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 8818: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 8819: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 8820: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 8821: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8822: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 8823: 	 end,
 8824:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8825:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F([LSock1, LSock2, LSock3, LSock4, LSock5], F1),
 8826:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8827:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8828:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 8829:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8830:     gen_tcp:close(LSock2),
 8831:     gen_tcp:close(LSock3),
 8832:     gen_tcp:close(LSock4),
 8833:     gen_tcp:close(LSock5),
 8834:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8835:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8836:     ?P("done"),
 8837:     ok.
 8838: 
 8839: 
 8840: sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType) ->
 8841:     sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType, "client").
 8842: 
 8843: sm_await_socket_down2([], _ExpType, Name) ->
 8844:     ?P("[~s] all sockets down", [Name]),
 8845:     exit(ok);
 8846: sm_await_socket_down2(Mons, ExpType, Name) when is_list(Mons) ->
 8847:     ?P("[~s] await socket down", [Name]),
 8848:     receive
 8849: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) ->
 8850: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 8851: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 8852: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 8853: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 8854: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 8855: 	    case lists:keysearch(Mon, 1, Mons) of
 8856: 		{value, {Mon, Sock}} ->
 8857: 		    Mons2 = lists:keydelete(Mon, 1, Mons),
 8858: 		    sm_await_socket_down2(Mons2, ExpType, Name);
 8859: 		{value, Value} ->
 8860: 		    ?P("[~s] Unexpected socket down: "
 8861: 		       "~n   Value: ~p", [Name, Value]),
 8862: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_monitor, Mon, Value});
 8863: 		false ->
 8864: 		    ct:fail({unknown_monitor, Mon})
 8865: 	    end
 8866:     end.
 8867: 
 8868: 
 8869: 
 8870: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8871: 
 8872: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8873: %% We create a listen socket, then spawn client process(es) that create
 8874: %% monitors to it...
 8875: socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8876:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8877:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8878:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8879:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8880:                             Addr;
 8881:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8882:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8883:                     end
 8884:            end,
 8885:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config, Addr) end,
 8886:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8887:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8888: 
 8889: do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config, Addr) ->
 8890:     ?P("begin"),
 8891:     Self         = self(),
 8892:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8893:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8894:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 8895: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 8896: 	 end,
 8897:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 8898: 		 ?P("[~s] monitor socket", [Name]),
 8899: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8900: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8901: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8902: 	 end,
 8903:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 8904:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1, "client1"),
 8905:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(LSock1, F1, "client2"),
 8906:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(LSock1, F1, "client3"),
 8907:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(LSock1, F1, "client4"),
 8908:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(LSock1, F1, "client5"),
 8909:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 8910:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 8911:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 8912:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 8913:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 8914:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 8915:     ?P("close socket"),
 8916:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8917:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 8918:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8919:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 8920:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 8921:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 8922:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 8923:     ?P("done"),
 8924:     ok.
 8925:

 8927: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8928: 
 8929: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8930: %% We create a listen socket, then spawns processes that create
 8931: %% monitors to it...
 8932: socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8933:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8934:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8935:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8936:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8937:                             Addr;
 8938:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8939:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8940:                     end
 8941:            end,
 8942:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config, Addr) end,
 8943:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8944:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8945: 
 8946: do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config, Addr) ->
 8947:     ?P("begin"),
 8948:     Self         = self(),
 8949:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8950:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8951:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8952:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 8953: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 8954: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8955: 		 ?P("[client] sleep some"),
 8956: 		 ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8957: 		 ?P("[client] cancel (socket) monitor"),
 8958: 		 inet:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 8959: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 8960: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8961: 		 sm_await_no_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8962: 	 end,
 8963:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8964:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 8965:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8966:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8967:     ?P("close socket"),
 8968:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8969:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8970:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8971:     ?P("done"),
 8972:     ok.
 8973: 
 8974: 
 8975: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 8976:     sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 8977: 
 8978: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 8979:     receive
 8980: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 8981: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 8982: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 8983: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected (socket) down message: "
 8984: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 8985: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 8986: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 8987: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 8988: 	    exit({unexpected_down, Mon, Type, Sock, Info});
 8989: 
 8990: 	Any ->
 8991: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 8992: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 8993: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 8994: 
 8995:     after 1000 ->
 8996: 	    ?P("[~s] expected message timeout", [Name]),
 8997: 	    exit(ok)
 8998:     end.
 8999:

 9001: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9002: 
 9003: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9004: %% Spawn a process that creates a (listen) socket, then spawns processes
 9005: %% that create monitors to it...
 9006: socket_monitor2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9007:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9008:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9009:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9010:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9011:                             Addr;
 9012:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9013:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9014:                     end
 9015:            end,
 9016:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor2(Config, Addr) end,
 9017:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9018:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9019: 
 9020: do_socket_monitor2(Config, Addr) ->
 9021:     ?P("begin"),
 9022:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 9023:     Self         = self(),
 9024:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 9025: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 9026: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket"),
 9027: 			      {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9028: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket to ctrl"),
 9029: 			      Self ! {socket, L},
 9030: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 9031: 			      receive
 9032: 				  {Self, die} ->
 9033: 				      exit(normal)
 9034: 			      end
 9035: 		      end),
 9036:     LSock1 = receive
 9037: 		 {socket, L} ->
 9038: 		     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 9039: 		     L;
 9040: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 9041: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 9042: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 9043: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 9044: 	     end,
 9045:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 9046:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 9047: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 9048: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 9049: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 9050: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 9051: 	 end,
 9052:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9053:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 9054:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9055:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 9056:     ?P("kill owner"),
 9057:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 9058:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 9059:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 9060:     ?P("await client termination"),
 9061:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9062:     ?P("done"),
 9063:     ok.
 9064:

 9072: socket_monitor2_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9073:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9074:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9075:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9076:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9077:                             Addr;
 9078:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9079:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9080:                     end
 9081:            end,
 9082:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config, Addr) end,
 9083:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9084:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9085: 
 9086: do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config, Addr) ->
 9087:     ?P("begin"),
 9088:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 9089:     Self         = self(),
 9090:     ?P("spawn owner"),
 9091:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 9092: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 9093: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket(s)"),
 9094: 			      {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9095: 			      {ok, L2} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9096: 			      {ok, L3} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9097: 			      {ok, L4} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9098: 			      {ok, L5} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9099: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket(s) to ctrl"),
 9100: 			      Self ! {socket, [L1, L2, L3, L4, L5]},
 9101: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 9102: 			      receive
 9103: 				  {Self, die} ->
 9104: 				      exit(normal)
 9105: 			      end
 9106: 		      end),
 9107:     ?P("await sockets (from owner)"),
 9108:     LSocks = receive
 9109: 		 {socket, Socks} ->
 9110: 		     ?P("received socket(s) from owner"),
 9111: 		     Socks;
 9112: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 9113: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 9114: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 9115: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 9116: 	     end,
 9117:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 9118:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 9119: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 9120: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 9121: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 9122: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 9123: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 9124: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 9125: 	 end,
 9126:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9127:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSocks, F1),
 9128:     ?P("await client ready"),
 9129:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 9130:     ?P("kill owner"),
 9131:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 9132:     ?P("await owner (~p) termination", [OwnerPid]),
 9133:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 9134:     ?P("await client termination"),
 9135:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9136:     ?P("done"),
 9137:     ok.

 9218: %% This is the most basic of tests.

 9220: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 9221: otp_17492(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9222:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9223:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9224:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9225:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9226:                             Addr;
 9227:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9228:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9229:                     end
 9230:            end,
 9231:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_otp_17492(Config, Addr) end,
 9232:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9233:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9234: 
 9235: do_otp_17492(Config, Addr) ->
 9236:     ?P("begin"),
 9237: 
 9238:     Self = self(),
 9239: 
 9240:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 9241:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9242: 
 9243:     ?P("try get (created) listen socket info"),
 9244:     try inet:info(L) of
 9245: 	#{owner := Owner} = Info when is_pid(Owner) andalso (Owner =:= Self) ->
 9246: 	    ?P("(created) Listen socket info: ~p", [Info]);
 9247: 	OBadInfo ->
 9248: 	    ?P("(created) listen socket info: ~p", [OBadInfo]),
 9249: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9250: 	    ct:fail({invalid_created_info, OBadInfo})
 9251:     catch
 9252: 	OC:OE:OS ->
 9253: 	    ?P("Failed get (created) listen socket info: "
 9254: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 9255: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 9256: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 9257: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9258: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_created_info_result, {OC, OE, OS}})
 9259:     end,
 9260: 
 9261:     ?P("try close (listen) socket"),
 9262:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 9263: 
 9264:     ?P("try get (closed) listen socket info"),
 9265:     try inet:info(L) of
 9266: 	#{states := [closed]} = CInfo when is_port(L) ->
 9267: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: "
 9268: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 9269: 	#{rstates := [closed], wstates := [closed]} = CInfo ->
 9270: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: "
 9271: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 9272: 	CBadInfo ->
 9273: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: ~p", [CBadInfo]),
 9274: 	    ct:fail({invalid_closed_info, CBadInfo})
 9275:     catch
 9276: 	CC:CE:CS ->
 9277: 	    ?P("Failed get (closed) listen socket info: "
 9278: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 9279: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 9280: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [CC, CE, CS]),
 9281: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9282: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_closed_info_result, {CC, CE, CS}})
 9283:     end,
 9284: 
 9285:     ?P("done"),
 9286:     ok.

 9289: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9290: 
 9291: %% Check that we can connect with the option 'bind_to_device'
 9292: %% and the inet_backend option set to socket.
 9293: %% The value types *where* mutually exclusive:
 9294: %% prim_inet: binary()
 9295: %% socket:    string()
 9296: otp_18357(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9297:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(30)),
 9298:     Cond = fun() ->
 9299:                    is_socket_supported(),
 9300:                    has_support_sock_bindtodevice()
 9301:            end,
 9302:     Pre  = fun() ->
 9303:                    case ?LIB:which_local_host_info(inet) of
 9304:                        {ok, [#{name := Name, addr := Addr}|_]} ->
 9305:                            ?P("~w:pre -> local host info:"
 9306:                               "~n   (IF) Name: ~p"
 9307:                               "~n   (IF) Addr: ~p",
 9308:                               [?FUNCTION_NAME, Name, Addr]),
 9309:                            #{name => Name, addr => Addr};
 9310:                        {error, Reason} ->
 9311:                            {skip, ?F("Failed get local address: ~p", [Reason])}
 9312:                    end
 9313:            end,
 9314:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_18357(State) end,
 9315:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9316:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 9317: 
 9318: do_otp_18357(#{name := Name, addr := Addr}) ->
 9319:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 9320:     {ok, L}      = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ifaddr, Addr}]),
 9321:     {ok, PortNo} = inet:port(L),
 9322: 
 9323:     ?P("try connect (with bind-to-device)"),
 9324:     C = case gen_tcp:connect(Addr, PortNo,
 9325:                              [{inet_backend,   socket},
 9326:                               {bind_to_device, list_to_binary(Name)}]) of
 9327:             {ok, CSock} ->
 9328:                 CSock;
 9329:             {error, eperm = Reason} ->
 9330:                 ?P("Failed connecting, ~p, skipping", [Reason]),
 9331:                 (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9332:                 skip(Reason)
 9333:         end,
 9334: 
 9335:     ?P("try accept"),
 9336:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 9337: 
 9338:     ?P("cleanup"),
 9339:     (catch gen_tcp:close(C)),
 9340:     (catch gen_tcp:close(A)),
 9341:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9342: 
 9343:     ?P("done"),
 9344:     ok.

 9385: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9386: otp_18707(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9387:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9388:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 9389:             fun() ->
 9390:                     %% We are not actually trying to make a connection...
 9391:                     is_socket_supported(),
 9392:                     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
 9393:                         true ->
 9394:                             case ?WHICH_INET_BACKEND(Config) of
 9395:                                 socket ->
 9396:                                     ok;
 9397:                                 Backend ->
 9398:                                     ?SKIPT({backend, Backend})
 9399:                             end;
 9400:                         _ ->
 9401:                             ok
 9402:                     end
 9403:             end,
 9404:             fun() -> do_otp_18707(Config) end).
 9405: 
 9406: do_otp_18707(_Config) ->
 9407:     ?P("begin"),
 9408: 
 9409:     try gen_tcp:connect(#{port   => 80,
 9410:                           addr   => {127, 0, 0, 1},
 9411:                           family => inet},
 9412:                         [{inet_backend, socket}]) of
 9413:         {ok, Sock} ->
 9414:             %% Since we do not know what is going on
 9415:             %% on the machines we run the tests, this
 9416:             %% call "might" actually succeed...
 9417:             ?P("(expected) connect success"),
 9418:             gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 9419:             ok;
 9420:         {error, _Reason} ->
 9421:             ?P("expected failure: "
 9422:                "~n   ~p", [_Reason]),
 9423:             ok
 9424:     catch
 9425:         C:E:S ->
 9426:             ?P("unexpected failure: "
 9427:                "~n   C: ~p"
 9428:                "~n   E: ~p"
 9429:                "~n   S: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 9430:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, C, E, S})
 9431:     end,
 9432: 
 9433:     ?P("done"),
 9434:     ok.
 9435: 
 9436: 
 9437: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9438: 
 9439: send_block_unblock(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9440:     Size = 2048,
 9441:     Timeout = 500,
 9442:     Payload = payload(Size),
 9443:     BufSize = Size + (Size bsr 3), % + 12.5% - need to fill buffer > 75%
 9444:     io:format(
 9445:       "[~w] Payload size ~w, send timeout ~w~n", [self(), Size, Timeout]),
 9446:     Opts =
 9447:         [binary,
 9448:          {active, false},
 9449:          {exit_on_close, false},
 9450:          {show_econnreset, true},
 9451:          {high_watermark, Size * 6},
 9452:          {low_watermark, Size * 2},
 9453:          {sndbuf, BufSize},
 9454:          {recbuf, BufSize},
 9455:          {buffer, BufSize},
 9456:          {packet, 4}],
 9457:     {ok, L}  = gen_tcp:listen(0, Opts),
 9458:     {ok, P}  = inet:port(L),
 9459:     {ok, Sa} = gen_tcp:connect({127,0,0,1}, P, Opts),
 9460:     {ok, Sb} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 9461:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 9462:     {ok, Pa}  = inet:port(Sa),
 9463:     io:format("[~w] Listen port ~w, connect port ~w~n", [self(), P, Pa]),
 9464:     io:format("[~w] Accept socket ~w, connect socket ~w~n", [self(), Sb, Sa]),
 9465:     inet:i(),
 9466:     %% ok = inet:setopts(Sa, [{debug, true}]),
 9467:     fill_send_buffers(Payload, Sa, Sb, Timeout, 0).
 9468: 
 9469: fill_send_buffers(Payload, Sa, Sb, Timeout, N) ->
 9470:     N_1 = N + 1,
 9471:     case send_maybe_block(Sa, <<N:16, Payload/binary>>, Timeout) of
 9472:         ok ->
 9473:             io:format("[~w] Sent ~w~n", [self(), N]),
 9474:             fill_send_buffers(Payload, Sa, Sb, Timeout, N_1);
 9475:         Ref when is_reference(Ref) ->
 9476:             io:format("[~w] Send ~w pending ~w~n", [self(), N, Ref]),
 9477:             case send_maybe_block(Sa, <<N_1:16, Payload/binary>>, Timeout) of
 9478:                 Ref2 when is_reference(Ref2) ->
 9479:                 io:format("[~w] Send ~w pending ~w~n", [self(), N_1, Ref2]),
 9480:                     _ =
 9481:                         spawn_link(
 9482:                           fun () ->
 9483:                                   receive after Timeout -> ok end,
 9484:                                   loop_data(Sb)
 9485:                           end),
 9486:                     recv_data(Payload, Sa, Ref, Ref2, N_1, 0)
 9487:             end
 9488:     end.
 9489: 
 9490: recv_data(_Payload, Sa, Ref, Ref2, M, N) when M < N ->
 9491:     receive Msg ->
 9492:             {send_result, Ref, ok} = Msg,
 9493:             io:format("[~w] Send finished ~w~n", [self(), Ref]),
 9494:             receive Msg2 ->
 9495:                     {send_result, Ref2, ok} = Msg2,
 9496:                     io:format("[~w] Send finished ~w~n", [self(), Ref2]),
 9497:                     gen_tcp:shutdown(Sa, write),
 9498:                     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Sa, 0),
 9499:                     io:format("[~w] Recv closed~n", [self()]),
 9500:                     ok = gen_tcp:close(Sa),
 9501:                     receive Unexpected ->
 9502:                             ct:fail({unexpected, Unexpected})
 9503:                     after 0 ->
 9504:                             inet:i()
 9505:                     end
 9506:             end
 9507:     end;
 9508: recv_data(Payload, Sa, Ref, Ref2, M, N) ->
 9509:     Data = <<N:16, Payload/binary>>,
 9510:     {ok, Data} = gen_tcp:recv(Sa, 0),
 9511:     io:format("[~w] Recv ~w~n", [self(), N]),
 9512:     recv_data(Payload, Sa, Ref, Ref2, M, N + 1).
 9513: 
 9514: send_maybe_block(S, Data, Timeout) ->
 9515:     Parent = self(),
 9516:     Ref = make_ref(),
 9517:     _ =
 9518:         spawn_link(
 9519:           fun () ->
 9520:                   Parent ! {send_result, Ref, gen_tcp:send(S, Data)}
 9521:           end),
 9522:     receive
 9523:         {send_result, Ref, Result} ->
 9524:             false = is_reference(Result), %% Just to make it impossible
 9525:             Result
 9526:     after Timeout ->
 9527:             Ref
 9528:     end.
 9529: 
 9530: loop_data(S) ->
 9531:     case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0) of
 9532:         {ok, Data} ->
 9533:             io:format("[~w] Echo recv~n", [self()]),
 9534:             ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Data),
 9535:             io:format("[~w] Echo sent~n", [self()]),
 9536:             loop_data(S);
 9537:         {error, closed} ->
 9538:             io:format("[~w] Echo recv closed~n", [self()]),
 9539:             ok = gen_tcp:close(S)
 9540:     end.
 9541: 
 9542: payload(N) when is_integer(N), 0 =< N ->
 9543:     payload(N, <<>>).
 9544: %%
 9545: payload(0, Bin) -> Bin;
 9546: payload(N, Bin) ->
 9547:     C = rand:uniform($z - $0 + 1) + $0,
 9548:     payload(N - 1, <<Bin/binary, C>>).
 9549: 
 9550: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9551: 
 9552: is_windows() ->
 9553:     case os:type() of
 9554:         {win32, nt} ->
 9555:             true;
 9556:         _ ->
 9557:             false
 9558:     end.
 9559: 
 9560: is_linux() ->
 9561:     is_unix(linux, "Linux").
 9562: 
 9563: is_unix(Name, PlatformStr) ->
 9564:     is_platform(unix, Name, PlatformStr).
 9565: 
 9566: is_platform(Family, Name, PlatformStr)
 9567:   when is_atom(Family) andalso
 9568:        is_atom(Name) andalso
 9569:        is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 9570:     case os:type() of
 9571:         {Family, Name} ->
 9572:             ok;
 9573:         _ ->
 9574:             skip("Require " ++ PlatformStr)
 9575:     end.
 9576:   
 9577: 
 9578: is_socket_supported() ->
 9579:     try socket:info() of
 9580:         #{} ->
 9581:             ok
 9582:     catch
 9583:         error : notsup ->
 9584:             skip("esock not supported");
 9585:         error : undef ->
 9586:             skip("esock not configured")
 9587:     end.
 9588: 
 9589: has_support_sock_priority() ->
 9590:     has_support_socket_option_sock(priority).
 9591: 
 9592: has_support_sock_bindtodevice() ->
 9593:     has_support_socket_option_sock(bindtodevice).
 9594: 
 9595: has_support_socket_option_sock(Opt) ->
 9596:     has_support_socket_option(socket, Opt).
 9597: 
 9598: has_support_socket_option(Level, Option) ->
 9599:     case socket:is_supported(options, Level, Option) of
 9600:         true ->
 9601:             ok;
 9602:         false ->
 9603:             skip(?F("Not Supported: ~w option ~w", [Level, Option]))
 9604:     end.
 9605: 
 9606: 
 9607: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9608: 
 9609: skip(Reason) ->
 9610:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 9611: 
 9612: 
 9613: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9614: 
 9615: messages() ->
 9616:     pi(messages).
 9617: 
 9618: links() ->
 9619:     pi(links).
 9620: 
 9621: monitors() ->
 9622:     pi(monitors).
 9623: 
 9624: pi(Pid) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 9625:     process_info(Pid);
 9626: 
 9627: pi(Item) ->
 9628:     pi(self(), Item).
 9629: 
 9630: pi(Pid, Item) ->
 9631:     {Item, Val} = process_info(Pid, Item),
 9632:     Val.    
 9633:

 9637: send_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9638:     ?F("Send failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9639: 
 9640: connect_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9641:     ?F("Connect failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9642: 
 9643: listen_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9644:     ?F("Listen failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9645: 
 9646: accept_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9647:     ?F("Accept failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9648: 
 9649: port_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9650:     ?F("Port failed: ~w", [Reason]).
